translated: Thus, the example of the indigo flower and the excellent cloth from Vārāṇasī, which is blue, has the color blue, etc., is appropriate.

analyzed: de bzhin du ser bo la sogs pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //

original: lhag ma ni rnam thar las 'byung ba ji bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma ni rnam thar las 'byung ba ji bzhin no //

original: lhag ma gang zhe na /

translated: The internal form is the perception of form, the external form is seeing form and so on. This should be understood in accordance with the statement: One who has form sees form.

translated: The bases of infinite space and so on are called the bases of infinite space and so forth because they are the bases of infinite space and so on.🔽The bases of infinite space and so on are called the bases of infinite space and so on because they are the bases of infinite space and so on.🔽The bases of infinite space and so on are called the bases of infinite space and so on because they are the bases of infinite space and so on.🔽The bases of infinite space and so on are called the bases of infinite space and so on because they are the bases of infinite space and so on.🔽The bases of infinite space and so on are called the bases of infinite space and so on because they are the bases of infinite space and so on.

original: zad par sa dang / zad par chu dang / zad par med dang / zad par rlung dang / zad par sngon po dang / zad par ser po dang / zad par dmar po dang / zad par dkar po dang / zad par nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang /
analyzed: zad par sa dang / zad par chu dang / zad par med dang / zad par rlung dang / zad par sngon po dang / zad par ser po dang / zad par dmar po dang / zad par dkar po dang / zad par nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched dang /
translated: the base of infinite space,

original: zad par rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched do //
analyzed: zad par rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched do //
translated: and the base of infinite consciousness.

original: ci'i phyir ma lus pa'i skye mched rnams la sa la sogs pa ma lus par gdags she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma lus pa'i skye mched rnams la sa la sogs pa ma lus par gdags she na /
translated: Why are the bases of infinite space and so on called the bases of infinite space and so forth?

original: gnas dang bcas pa'i gzugs la khyab par bya ba 'byor pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas dang bcas pa'i gzugs la khyab par bya ba 'byor pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because they pervade form that possesses a basis.

analyzed: gal te ma lus pa'i skye mched rnams la sogs pa ma bzhag na ni /
translated: If the bases of infinite space and so on were not posited,

analyzed: des na @266b gnas dang bcas pa'i gzugs la khyab par 'byor ba nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore, because they pervade form that possesses a basis,🔽they are called the bases of infinite space and so on.

analyzed: de ngag ni ma lus par rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that this is the complete arrangement of the liberations.

original: lhag ma ni rnam thar bzhin ji ltar mthun mthun du sbyar ro //🔽nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched kyi ma lus pa la sogs pa'o //

translated: The remaining [liberations] are to be applied according to their respective order.🔽The sphere of infinite space is the first of the formless [absorptions].

original: ma lus pa'i skye mched rnams kyi ni rnam thar rnams 'grub bar byed do //
analyzed: ma lus pa'i skye mched rnams kyi ni rnam thar rnams 'grub bar byed do //
translated: The spheres of infinite space and so forth are the liberations.

original: de la rnam par thar pa rnams kyis ni rnam par thar pa rnams rtsom mo //
analyzed: de la rnam par thar pa rnams kyis ni rnam par thar pa rnams rtsom mo //
translated: Among them, the liberations are the beginning of the liberations.

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams kyis ni sbyor ro //
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams kyis ni sbyor ro //
translated: The spheres of mastery are the application.

original: ma lus pa'i skye mched rnams kyis ni rnam par thar pa rnams yongs su bsgrub par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ma lus pa'i skye mched rnams kyis ni rnam par thar pa rnams yongs su bsgrub par rig par bya'o //
translated: The spheres of totality are the complete accomplishment of the liberations.

original: nyon mongs med pa gang /
analyzed: nyon mongs med pa gang /
translated: What is the absence of conflict?

original: bsam gtan la brten te gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa 'byung ba rjes su bsrung ba'i gnas pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab gang dang / de dang mtshungs ldan gyi sems sems byung gi chos rnams so //
analyzed: bsam gtan la brten te gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa 'byung ba rjes su bsrung ba'i gnas pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab gang dang / de dang mtshungs ldan gyi sems sems byung gi chos rnams so //
translated: The meditative attainment of the station of guarding the arising of others' afflictions in dependence on the absorptions is concentration and wisdom that are the correct preparation for that and the phenomena of mind and mental factors concomitant with that.🔽The station of the absence of conflict is the meditative attainment of the station of the absence of conflict.

original: nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa ni sems can gang dag gi mig lam du snang bar 'dod pa de dag bdag la nyon mongs pa kun du mi 'byung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du byas nas 'dug bzhin du bsams nas shes pa'i dbang gis ma 'ongs
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa ni sems can gang dag gi mig lam du snang bar 'dod pa de dag bdag la nyon mongs pa kun du mi 'byung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar du byas nas 'dug bzhin du bsams nas shes pa'i dbang gis ma 'ongs
translated: The bodhisattva who has attained the absence of conflict abides in the desire realm and thinks, I will not allow any affliction to arise in me when any sentient being comes into my sight.

original: pa ni 'byung bar blta ste /
analyzed: pa ni 'byung bar blta ste /
translated: Through the power of his knowledge, he sees that in the future,

original: de ltar de'i drung du 'gro yang rung ci nas der de dag la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang / sor sna la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'thab rtsod mi skyed do //
analyzed: de ltar de'i drung du 'gro yang rung ci nas der de dag la rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang / sor sna la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'thab rtsod mi skyed do //
translated: even though he goes into their presence, he will not generate any affliction or secondary affliction such as attachment, anger, or pride toward them.

original: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa med pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyon mongs pa med pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas /
translated: Therefore, the absence of conflict is based on the absorptions.

original: gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa 'byung ba rjes su bsrung bas gnas pa yang dag par 'byor pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi nyon mongs pa 'byung ba rjes su bsrung bas gnas pa yang dag par 'byor pa zhes bya ba rgya cher 'byung ba la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the absence of conflict is the perfect mastery of abiding in the protection of the arising of others' afflictions in dependence on the absorptions.

original: smon nas shes pa gang bsam gtan la brten te 'di shes par bya'o zhes bsams nas yang dag par 'byor pa zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: smon nas shes pa gang bsam gtan la brten te 'di shes par bya'o zhes bsams nas yang dag par 'byor pa zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The knowledge through resolve is the perfect mastery of knowing whatever one wishes to know in dependence on the absorptions.🔽The knowledge through resolve is the perfect mastery of knowing whatever one wishes to know in dependence on the absorptions.

original: bsams nas shes pa ni de thob pa gal te dus gsum pa la sogs pa shes bya'i rnam pa de nyid shes par gyur pa 'dod par gyur na /
analyzed: bsams nas shes pa ni de thob pa gal te dus gsum pa la sogs pa shes bya'i rnam pa de nyid shes par gyur pa 'dod par gyur na /
translated: If one who has obtained that knowledge wishes to know the aspects of objects of knowledge in the three times and so on,

original: de dang der shes par bya'o zhes bsams nas bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug cing /
analyzed: de dang der shes par bya'o zhes bsams nas bsam gtan la snyoms par 'jug cing /
translated: one enters meditative attainment on the absorptions, thinking, I will know this and that.

original: de las langs nas de'i smon pa 'grul par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de las langs nas de'i smon pa 'grul par 'gyur te /
translated: Then, upon rising from that, one's resolve is fulfilled.

original: shes bya de shes so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes bya de shes so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of knowing that object of knowledge.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four correct knowledges.

original: chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa rnams so //🔽chos so so yang @267a * //
analyzed: chos so so yang dag par rig pa dang / don so so yang dag par rig pa dang / nges tshig so so yang dag par rig pa dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa rnams so // chos so so yang @267a * //
translated: The correct knowledge of the Teaching, the correct knowledge of the meaning, the correct knowledge of expression, and the correct knowledge of inspired speech.

original: dag par rig pa gang /
analyzed: dag par rig pa gang /
translated: What is the correct knowledge of the Teaching?

original: bsam gtan la brten nas rnam grangs su gtogs pa rnams la thogs pa med par yang dag par 'byor pa'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan la brten nas rnam grangs su gtogs pa rnams la thogs pa med par yang dag par 'byor pa'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: It is concentration of mind associated with full awareness, which, based on absorption, is applied to the enumeration of the Teaching without obstruction.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: ma rig pa la sogs pa brtsams nas mi shes pa dang mi mthong ba dang / mngon par mi rtogs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam grangs la thogs pa med pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya char 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa la sogs pa brtsams nas mi shes pa dang mi mthong ba dang / mngon par mi rtogs par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam grangs la thogs pa med pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya char 'byung ba'o //
translated: Having begun with ignorance, one acquires concentration of mind associated with full awareness, which is applied to the enumeration of the Teaching without obstruction, as far as the non-perception, the non-seeing, the non-realization of ignorance, etc.

original: don so so yang dag par rig pa gang /
analyzed: don so so yang dag par rig pa gang /
translated: What is the correct knowledge of the meaning?

original: mtshan nyid dang dgongs pa la thogs pa med pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang dgongs pa la thogs pa med pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The phrase having attained the authentic, unimpeded realization of the characteristics and intentions is the same as before.

original: chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / de na gzhan la dgongs pa la sogs pa la thogs pa med pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dang / de na gzhan la dgongs pa la sogs pa la thogs pa med pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher 'byung ba'o //
translated: The phrase having attained the authentic, unimpeded realization of the individual and general characteristics of phenomena, as well as the intentions that are based on them is explained in detail.

original: des tshig so so yang dag par rig pa gang /
analyzed: des tshig so so yang dag par rig pa gang /
translated: What is the correct understanding of words?

original: mi'i skad dang chos kyi nges tshig la thogs pa med pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //🔽yul mi'i skad ces pa ni /
analyzed: mi'i skad dang chos kyi nges tshig la thogs pa med pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin no // yul mi'i skad ces pa ni /
translated: The phrase having attained the authentic, unimpeded realization of the languages of humans and the etymological definitions of phenomena is the same as before.

original: yul so so bas ji ltar phan tshun rang dang spyi la ming gzhan gyi tha snyad 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: yul so so bas ji ltar phan tshun rang dang spyi la ming gzhan gyi tha snyad 'dogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase the languages of humans refers to the fact that in different countries, people use different terms to refer to the same thing.

original: chos kyi nges pa'i tshig la zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos kyi nges pa'i tshig la zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase the etymological definitions of phenomena refers to the fact that the terms used to refer to phenomena are not arbitrary.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example, the term earth is used because it is hard and solid.

original: 'jig pa dang rab tu 'jig pas de'i phyir 'jig rten zhes bya ba dang / gzugs su rung bas gzugs shes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa gang /
analyzed: 'jig pa dang rab tu 'jig pas de'i phyir 'jig rten zhes bya ba dang / gzugs su rung bas gzugs shes pa la sogs pa'o // spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa gang /
translated: The world is so called because it is destroyed and utterly destroyed. 🔽 The world is so called because it is destroyed and utterly destroyed.

original: chos rab tu dbye ba la thogs pa med pas yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //🔽'di ni rdzas su yod pa'o //
analyzed: chos rab tu dbye ba la thogs pa med pas yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin no // 'di ni rdzas su yod pa'o //
translated: The world is so called because it is destroyed and utterly destroyed.

original: 'di ni brtags pa'i yod pa'o //🔽kun rdzob tu yod do //
analyzed: 'di ni brtags pa'i yod pa'o // kun rdzob tu yod do //
translated: The world is so called because it is destroyed and utterly destroyed. 🔽 The world is so called because it is destroyed and utterly destroyed.

original: don dam par yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa chos rab tu 'byed pa'o //🔽mngon shes rnams ni drug ste /
analyzed: don dam par yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa chos rab tu 'byed pa'o // mngon shes rnams ni drug ste /
translated: The world is so called because it is destroyed and utterly destroyed. 🔽 The world is so called because it is destroyed and utterly destroyed. 🔽 The world is so called because it is destroyed and utterly destroyed. 🔽 The world is so called because it is destroyed and utterly destroyed. 🔽 The world is so called because it is destroyed and utterly destroyed.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon shes dang / lha'i rna ba'i mngon shes dang / sems kyi rnam grangs kyi mngon shes dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon shes dang / 'chi ba dang skye ba'i mngon shes dang / zag pa zad pa'i mngon shes so //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon shes dang / lha'i rna ba'i mngon shes dang / sems kyi rnam grangs kyi mngon shes dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon shes dang / 'chi ba dang skye ba'i mngon shes dang / zag pa zad pa'i mngon shes so //
translated: The world is so called because it is destroyed and utterly destroyed. 🔽 The world is so called because it is destroyed and utterly destroyed. 🔽 The world is so called because it is destroyed and utterly destroyed.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon shes gang /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon shes gang /
translated: The world is so called because it is destroyed and utterly destroyed. 🔽 The world is so called because it is destroyed and utterly destroyed. 🔽 The world is so called because it is destroyed and utterly destroyed. 🔽 The world is so called because it is destroyed and utterly destroyed. 🔽 The world is so called because it is destroyed and utterly destroyed. 🔽 The world is so called because it is destroyed and utterly destroyed. 🔽 The world is so called because it is destroyed and utterly destroyed. 🔽 The world is so called because it is destroyed and utterly destroyed. 🔽 The world is so called because it is destroyed and utterly destroyed. 🔽 The world is so called because it is destroyed and utterly destroyed. 🔽 The world is so called because it is destroyed and utterly destroyed. 🔽 The

original: bsam gtan la brten nas rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam 'phrul sna tshogs yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gang dang / de dag dang mtshungs ldan gyi sems sems byung gi chas rnams so //
analyzed: bsam gtan la brten nas rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam 'phrul sna tshogs yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gang dang / de dag dang mtshungs ldan gyi sems sems byung gi chas rnams so //
translated: It is concentration based on the absorptions, the meditative absorption that is the perfect achievement of the various miraculous powers, and it is wisdom and the mind and mental factors associated with them.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam 'phrul sna tshogs yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes pa ni /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rnam 'phrul sna tshogs yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin zhes pa ni /
translated: The meditative absorption that is the perfect achievement of the various miraculous powers.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: This is as follows:

original: gcig tu gyur nas mang por @267b 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gcig tu gyur nas mang por @267b 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Having been one, they become many.

original: lha'i rna ba'i mngon shes gang /
analyzed: lha'i rna ba'i mngon shes gang /
translated: What is the superknowledge of divine hearing?

original: bsam gtan la brten nas sgra sna tshogs nyan pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan la brten nas sgra sna tshogs nyan pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: It is concentration based on the absorptions, the meditative absorption that is the perfect achievement of hearing various sounds.

original: sgra sna tshogs nyan pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgra sna tshogs nyan pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes bya ba ni lha dang mi la sogs pa'o //
translated: The perfect achievement of hearing various sounds refers to the sounds of gods, humans, and so on.

original: sems kyi rnam grangs kyi mngon shes gang /
analyzed: sems kyi rnam grangs kyi mngon shes gang /
translated: What is the superknowledge of the categories of mind?

original: bsam gtam la brten nas sems can gzhan dag gi sems kyi spyod pa la 'jug pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam gtam la brten nas sems can gzhan dag gi sems kyi spyod pa la 'jug pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The knowledge of the mental activities of other beings by means of concentration is the superknowledge of the mind of another.

original: 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa sems kyi rgyu ba yang dag pa ci lta ba bzhin du 'du shes pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i sems zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bcas pa la sogs pa sems kyi rgyu ba yang dag pa ci lta ba bzhin du 'du shes pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i sems zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The knowledge of the mental activities of other beings, such as those who are attached, etc., is the superknowledge of the mind of another.

original: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon shes gang /
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa'i mngon shes gang /
translated: What is the superknowledge of the memory of past lives?

original: bsam gtan la brten nas sngon gyi mtha'i spyod pa rjes su dran pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan la brten nas sngon gyi mtha'i spyod pa rjes su dran pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The knowledge of the conduct of former lives by means of concentration is the superknowledge of the memory of past lives.🔽It is the knowledge of the succession of former lives of oneself and others, beginning with one’s own life,

original: 'das pa'i tshe rabs gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las brtsams te /🔽ming dang rigs dang / rus la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i lo rgyus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'das pa'i tshe rabs gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las brtsams te / ming dang rigs dang / rus la sogs pa'i rnam pa'i lo rgyus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and continuing up to a period of time equal to the extent of one’s memory.

original: 'chi ba dang skye ba'i mngon shes gang /
analyzed: 'chi ba dang skye ba'i mngon shes gang /
translated: What is the superknowledge of death and rebirth?

original: bsam gtan la brten nas sems can rnams kyi 'chi ba dang / skye ba mthong ba yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan la brten nas sems can rnams kyi 'chi ba dang / skye ba mthong ba yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The superknowledge of the divine eye, based on the absorptions, is the concentration, etc., consisting of the correct attainment of the vision of the death and birth of sentient beings.

original: lha'i mig gis sems can 'chi 'pho dang skye ba /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis sems can 'chi 'pho dang skye ba /
translated: The divine eye sees the death and birth of sentient beings,

original: kha dog bzang po dang ngan pa dang / bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dang / phyi ma'i mtha' la brtsams te /
analyzed: kha dog bzang po dang ngan pa dang / bde 'gro dang ngan 'gro dang / phyi ma'i mtha' la brtsams te /
translated: their good and bad complexions, their good and bad destinies, and, beginning with the future limit,🔽the vision of death and birth.🔽The superknowledge of the extinction of the impurities is

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mthong ba ngag yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba mthong ba ngag yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
translated: the concentration, etc., consisting of the correct attainment of the knowledge of the extinction of the impurities, based on the absorptions.

original: zag pa zad pa'i mngon shes gang /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa'i mngon shes gang /
translated: What is the superknowledge of the extinction of the impurities?

original: bsam gtan la brten nas zag pa zad pa shes pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gang dang / de dag dang mtshungs ldan gyi sems sems byung gi chos rnams so //
analyzed: bsam gtan la brten nas zag pa zad pa shes pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gang dang / de dag dang mtshungs ldan gyi sems sems byung gi chos rnams so //
translated: It is the concentration, etc., consisting of the correct attainment of the knowledge of the extinction of the impurities, based on the absorptions, and the thought and thought-concomitants associated with it.🔽It is the knowledge of the extinction of the impurities by whatever means.

original: thabs gang gis gang zag pa rnams yongs su zad pa gang yin pa de shes pa 'grub pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thabs gang gis gang zag pa rnams yongs su zad pa gang yin pa de shes pa 'grub pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the accomplishment of the knowledge of the extinction of the impurities.

original: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po rnams gang /
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byad bzang po rnams gang /
translated: What are the major and minor marks?

original: bsam gtan la brten nas mtshan dang dpe byad bzang pos brgyan pa'i sku kun du ston par yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gang dang / de dag dang mtshungs ldan gyi sems sems byung gi chos rnams dang / de las byung ba'i chos rnam smin rnams so //
analyzed: bsam gtan la brten nas mtshan dang dpe byad bzang pos brgyan pa'i sku kun du ston par yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gang dang / de dag dang mtshungs ldan gyi sems sems byung gi chos rnams dang / de las byung ba'i chos rnam smin rnams so //
translated: The concentration and wisdom—and the mind and mental factors associated with them—that consist of the mastery of displaying the body adorned with the major and minor marks in dependence on the absorptions, and the maturational results that arise from them.

original: gang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi dbang gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byed bzang po brgyad cus rnam par mdzes pa'i gzugs kyi sku gdul bya @268a * //🔽rnams la kun du ston cing /
analyzed: gang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi dbang gis sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis dang / dpe byed bzang po brgyad cus rnam par mdzes pa'i gzugs kyi sku gdul bya @268a * // rnams la kun du ston cing /
translated: Through the power of concentration and wisdom, the Bhagavan Buddhas display to their disciples the form body adorned with the thirty-two major marks and the eighty minor marks of a great being.

original: de dag gis de dag ni de'i rang bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis de dag ni de'i rang bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as being of that nature.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos kyi skus rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni chos kyi skus rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Bhagavan Buddhas are distinguished by the body of truth.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar ston nus pa rnams kyang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de ltar ston nus pa rnams kyang ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The bodhisattvas who are able to manifest these are of the nature of concentration and wisdom.

original: de las gzhan pa 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dag tu skyes pa rnams de las byung ba'i rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa 'khor gyi dkyil 'khor dag tu skyes pa rnams de las byung ba'i rnam par smin pa'i rang bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Those born in the circle of the retinue who are other than that should be understood to be of the nature of the evolutionary development of those.

original: yongs su dag pa bzhi po gang /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa bzhi po gang /
translated: What are the four purities?

original: gnas yongs dag dang / dmigs pa yongs dag dang / thugs yongs dag dang / mkhyen pa yongs dag go //
analyzed: gnas yongs dag dang / dmigs pa yongs dag dang / thugs yongs dag dang / mkhyen pa yongs dag go //
translated: Purity of realm, purity of object, purity of mind, and purity of knowledge.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' mngon par shes pa chen po thob pa'i rnam par thams cad yongs su dag pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams dang / byang chub sems dpa' mngon par shes pa chen po thob pa'i rnam par thams cad yongs su dag pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: The transcendent lords, the buddhas, and the bodhisattvas who have attained the great higher knowledges have four kinds of complete purity.

original: de la gnas yongs dag gang /
analyzed: de la gnas yongs dag gang /
translated: What is the purity of realm?

original: bsam gtan la brten nas ji ltar bzhed bzhin du gnas len pa dang / bzhugs pa dang / yongs su gtong ba dang / kun du ston pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gang de dag dang mtshungs ldan gyi sems sems byung gi chos rnams so //
analyzed: bsam gtan la brten nas ji ltar bzhed bzhin du gnas len pa dang / bzhugs pa dang / yongs su gtong ba dang / kun du ston pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab gang de dag dang mtshungs ldan gyi sems sems byung gi chos rnams so //
translated: It is the concentration and wisdom that are associated with the mind and mental factors that are the correct attainment of remaining as one wishes, of staying as one wishes, of giving up as one wishes, and of manifesting as one wishes, in dependence on the absorptions.

original: gang du bzhed pa der skye ba 'dzin pa dang / der skyes nas kyang tshe'i 'du byed byin gyis brlabs te ji srid bzhed par bzhugs pa dang / gang gi tshe bzhed pa de'i dus na tshe'i 'du byed 'dor te go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: gang du bzhed pa der skye ba 'dzin pa dang / der skyes nas kyang tshe'i 'du byed byin gyis brlabs te ji srid bzhed par bzhugs pa dang / gang gi tshe bzhed pa de'i dus na tshe'i 'du byed 'dor te go rims bzhin no //
translated: It is the correct attainment of taking birth wherever one wishes, and, having taken birth there, of blessing the life-forming winds so that one can stay as long as one wishes, and of giving up the life-forming winds at the appropriate time.

original: dmigs pa yongs dag gang /
analyzed: dmigs pa yongs dag gang /
translated: What is the complete purity of the object?

original: ji ltar bzhed bzhin du dmigs pa sprul pa dang / bsgyur ba mkhyen pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar bzhed bzhin du dmigs pa sprul pa dang / bsgyur ba mkhyen pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //

translated: Having begun with one's own aim, one declares, I have fully awakened to all aspects of the knowable, together with their extent and their details, and one's knowledge is fearless.

analyzed: mi 'jigs pa lhag ma rnams kyang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The remaining forms of fearlessness should be understood in the same way.

original: zag pa'i rnam pa thams cad ces pa ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa'i rnam pa thams cad ces pa ni bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams su blta bar bya'o //
translated: All aspects of the outflows should be understood as referring to the afflictions together with their traces.

original: bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams pa thams cad ces bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams pa thams cad ces bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi chos kun nas nyon mongs pa thams cad du blta bar bya'o //
translated: All the factors that are adverse elements should be regarded as all the defiled dharmas that are adverse elements.

original: nges par 'byin pa'i lam gyi rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba ni sbyor ba'i lam nas bzung ste mthar phyin pa'i lam gyi bar du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byin pa'i lam gyi rnam pa thams cad ces bya ba ni sbyor ba'i lam nas bzung ste mthar phyin pa'i lam gyi bar du blta bar bya'o //
translated: All the aspects of the path that leads to deliverance should be regarded as ranging from the path of application up to the path of conclusion.🔽The three foundations of mindfulness that are included in the accumulation are:

original: dran pa nye bar gnas gsum gang tshogs yongs su sdud de /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gnas gsum gang tshogs yongs su sdud de /
translated: the foundation of mindfulness that is related to the body,

original: kun nas nyon mongs @270a * //🔽pa'i rnam pa thams cad kun du mi 'byung ba rtogs pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs @270a * // pa'i rnam pa thams cad kun du mi 'byung ba rtogs pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i zhes pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: the foundation of mindfulness that is related to feelings,🔽and the foundation of mindfulness that is related to the mind.🔽The three foundations of mindfulness that are related to the spiritual levels are:

original: thun mong ma yin pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum ni /🔽'di la ston pa thugs brtse ba can thugs chen po dang ldan pa don bzhed pa /
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum ni / 'di la ston pa thugs brtse ba can thugs chen po dang ldan pa don bzhed pa /
translated: the foundation of mindfulness that is related to the spiritual levels that are free of signs and are accompanied by an effort,🔽the foundation of mindfulness that is related to the spiritual levels that are free of both signs and effort, and🔽the foundation of mindfulness that is related to the spiritual levels that are distinguished.🔽The three foundations of mindfulness that are related to purification are:🔽the foundation of mindfulness that is related to the purification of the mental afflictions,🔽the foundation of mindfulness that is related to the purification of the mental afflictions that are the root of the mental afflictions,🔽and the foundation of mindfulness that is related to the purification of the mental afflictions that are the root of the mental afflictions that are the root of the mental afflictions.🔽The three foundations of mindfulness that are related to the accumulation are:

original: phan pa bzhed pa /
analyzed: phan pa bzhed pa /
translated: the foundation of mindfulness that is related to the accumulation of merit,🔽the foundation of mindfulness that is related to the accumulation of wisdom, and🔽the foundation of mindfulness that is related to the accumulation of the means of attainment.🔽The three foundations of mindfulness that are related to the spiritual levels are:🔽the foundation of mindfulness that is related to the spiritual levels that are accompanied by signs and effort,🔽the foundation of mindfulness that is related to the spiritual levels that are free of signs but accompanied by a subtle form of effort, and🔽the foundation of mindfulness that is related to the spiritual levels that are free of both signs and effort.🔽The three foundations of mindfulness that are related to the distinguished are:

original: thugs brtse ba can nyan thos rnams la dge sbyong dag 'di ni phan par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: thugs brtse ba can nyan thos rnams la dge sbyong dag 'di ni phan par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: the foundation of mindfulness that is related to the distinguished spiritual qualities of the śrāvakas,🔽the foundation of mindfulness that is related to the distinguished spiritual qualities of the pratyekabuddhas, and🔽the foundation of mindfulness that is related to the distinguished spiritual qualities of the bodhisattvas.

original: 'di ni bde bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bde bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This will lead to happiness.🔽This will lead to benefit and happiness.

original: 'di ni phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur ba'o zhes chos ston pa de la nyan thos de dag gus par nyan pa dang / rna pa gtod pa dang / kun shes pa'i sems nye bar 'jog pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa de la de bzhin gshegs pa dgye par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ni phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur ba'o zhes chos ston pa de la nyan thos de dag gus par nyan pa dang / rna pa gtod pa dang / kun shes pa'i sems nye bar 'jog pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa de la de bzhin gshegs pa dgye par mi 'gyur /
translated: The Tathāgata does not rejoice in those disciples who listen to the Dharma with respect, who pay attention, who set their minds on retention, and who practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: yid bde bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: yid bde bar mi 'gyur /
translated: He does not feel pleased or delighted.

original: thugs dga' bar yang ya bor mi 'gyur gyi btang snyoms can du de bzhin gshegs pa de la gnas te dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang ldan pa 'di ni ma 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang po ste /
analyzed: thugs dga' bar yang ya bor mi 'gyur gyi btang snyoms can du de bzhin gshegs pa de la gnas te dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang ldan pa 'di ni ma 'dres pa'i dran pa nye bar gzhag pa dang po ste /
translated: The Tathāgata remains equanimous, mindful and fully aware. This is the first unshared quality of a Tathāgata.

original: gang 'phags pa sten pa bsten nas kyang 'khor la rjes su bstan par 'os pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'phags pa sten pa bsten nas kyang 'khor la rjes su bstan par 'os pa'o //
translated: It is suitable for the noble ones to rely on it and to teach it to their followers.

original: gzhan yang ston pa 'di ni phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du chos ston pa de la nyan thos de dag gus par mi nyan pa nas chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos mi sgrub pa'i bar de la /
analyzed: gzhan yang ston pa 'di ni phan pa dang bde bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar du chos ston pa de la nyan thos de dag gus par mi nyan pa nas chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos mi sgrub pa'i bar de la /
translated: Moreover, when the Teacher teaches the Dharma, saying, “This will lead to your welfare and happiness,” if the disciples do not listen respectfully, up to if they do not practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa kun nas mnar sems su mi 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa kun nas mnar sems su mi 'gyur /
translated: the Tathāgata does not become angry,

original: mi bzod par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: mi bzod par mi 'gyur /
translated: does not become intolerant,

original: thugs mi ches par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: thugs mi ches par mi 'gyur /
translated: does not become displeased,

original: thugs mi mnyes par mi 'gyur gyi btang snyoms can du de la zhes bya bar rgya cher sbyar te 'di ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: thugs mi mnyes par mi 'gyur gyi btang snyoms can du de la zhes bya bar rgya cher sbyar te 'di ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: does not become unhappy, but remains equanimous.

original: gsum pa'i bye brag ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: gsum pa'i bye brag ni 'di yin te /
translated: The difference in the third is as follows:

original: de la nyan thos kha cig gus par nyan pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'i bar du byed pa dang / kha cig gus par mi nyan pa nas /
analyzed: de la nyan thos kha cig gus par nyan pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'i bar du byed pa dang / kha cig gus par mi nyan pa nas /
translated: There, some disciples listen respectfully, up to practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma, while others do not listen respectfully, up to

original: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos mi sgrub pa'i par de la de bzhin gshegs pa dgyes par mi 'gyur pa nas /
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos mi sgrub pa'i par de la de bzhin gshegs pa dgyes par mi 'gyur pa nas /
translated: do not practice the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma. The Tathāgata does not become pleased, up to🔽does not become unhappy.

original: thugs mi mnyes par mi 'gyur ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: thugs mi mnyes par mi 'gyur ba'i bar du'o //
translated: up to: he does not displease the mind.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum po 'di dag ni /
translated: These three foundations of mindfulness

original: sto pa tshogs yongs su sdud ba la go rims bzhin du rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang / de gnyi ga'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / bag chags kyi rnam pa thams cad kun du mi 'byung ba dang yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sto pa tshogs yongs su sdud ba la go rims bzhin du rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang / de gnyi ga'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / bag chags kyi rnam pa thams cad kun du mi 'byung ba dang yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
translated: are the meditative concentrations, etc. which are the non-occurrence of all the forms of the addictions of both of these, and the non-occurrence of all the forms of the residues of both of these.

original: bsrung med gsum gang /
analyzed: bsrung med gsum gang /
translated: What are the three non-protections?

original: tshogs yongs su srung ba nyid la ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan par sbyor ba yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes @270b pa snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: tshogs yongs su srung ba nyid la ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin gdams pa dang / rjes su bstan par sbyor ba yang dag par 'byor ba'i zhes @270b pa snga ma bzhin no //
translated: They are the meditative concentrations, etc. which are the non-occurrence of all the forms of the residues of both of these, and the non-occurrence of all the forms of the residues of both of these.🔽The three non-protections🔽are the meditative concentrations, etc. which are the non-occurrence of all the forms of the residues of both of these, and the non-occurrence of all the forms of the residues of both of these.

original: bsrung ba med pa gsum ni /
analyzed: bsrung ba med pa gsum ni /
translated: The three non-protections are as follows:🔽In another Sutra it is said:

original: mdo gzhan las ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa sku'i phrin las kyis spyod pa yongs su dag pa ste /
analyzed: mdo gzhan las ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa sku'i phrin las kyis spyod pa yongs su dag pa ste /
translated: “The Tathagata is pure in his bodily actions.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sku'i phrin las yongs su ma dag pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sku'i phrin las yongs su ma dag pa med pa ste /
translated: There is no impure bodily action of the Tathagata.

analyzed: bdag la gzhan gyi shes su 'ong ngo zhes dpyas par dgongs pa med pa dang / de bzhin du gsungs dang thugs kyi phrin las la yang rig par bya'o //

original: de dag gi tha snyad gdags su med pas /
analyzed: de dag gi tha snyad gdags su med pas /
translated: The same should be understood with regard to his verbal and mental actions.

analyzed: dogs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir / ston pa nyid kyis 'dul ba'i skye bo bsdu ba las brtsams te /
translated: Since he has no conceptual thoughts,🔽he has no fear.🔽Therefore, the Teacher, having begun with the collection of disciples to be trained,

analyzed: ji ltar bzhed pa de bzhin du tshar bcad de sba bkod nas gdams pa dang rjes su bstan pa la sbyor ba yang dag par 'byor pa gsum du 'gyur bar rig par bya'o //

original: bsnyel ba med pa'i chos nyid gang /
analyzed: bsnyel ba med pa'i chos nyid gang /

translated: Having become omniscient, the movements of non-omniscience do not occur, which is the perfect attainment, as before.

translated: Having become omniscient, the movements of body and speech that indicate the remaining afflictive and cognitive obscurations do not occur, which is the perfect attainment of the samadhi, and so on.

original: thugs rje chen po gang /
analyzed: thugs rje chen po gang /

original: khams gsum na spyod pa'i sems can thams cad kyi sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa thams cad la dmigs nas thugs rje la gnas pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //

translated: Such are the errors of an arhat, but the Tathāgata has none of these in any way.

analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa res 'ga' dgon pa nags khrod chen por rgyu ba na lam nor te /
translated: Moreover, sometimes an arhat, wandering in a great wilderness, takes the wrong path.

original: grong stong du phyin nas sgra 'byin pa dang / sgra sgrogs pa dang / ku co cher 'don pa dang / bag chags @271b kyi nyes pa la brten nas /🔽nyon mongs pa can gyi gang mo rta gad so snang bar rgod pa dang / 'phya ba nye bar ston pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa'i dgra bcom pa'i ca co de dag de bzhin gshegs pa la thams cad kyi thams cad du mi mnga'o //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyel ba med pa nyid de /
analyzed: grong stong du phyin nas sgra 'byin pa dang / sgra sgrogs pa dang / ku co cher 'don pa dang / bag chags @271b kyi nyes pa la brten nas / nyon mongs pa can gyi gang mo rta gad so snang bar rgod pa dang / 'phya ba nye bar ston pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa'i dgra bcom pa'i ca co de dag de bzhin gshegs pa la thams cad kyi thams cad du mi mnga'o // de bzhin gshegs pa la bsnyel ba med pa nyid de /
translated: He does not go to an empty village and cry out,

original: nyon mongs pa med par yun ring po nas mdzad pa dang / gsungs pa rjes su dran pa'i phyir ro //🔽gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni snyoms par zhugs na mnyam par gzhag par 'gyur gyi /🔽langs nas mnyam par gzhag pa ma yin no //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa la ni gnas skabs thams cad du sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa med do //

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni phung po la shin tu mi mthun pa'i 'du shes su 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni phung po la shin tu mi mthun pa'i 'du shes su 'gyur zhing /
translated: Moreover, for the arhat, the aggregates are the basis for a perception of what is extremely disagreeable,

original: phung po med pa mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba'i du shes su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phung po med pa mya ngan las 'das pa zhi ba'i du shes su 'gyur ro //
translated: and the nonexistence of the aggregates is the basis for a perception of peace, which is nirvana.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni phung po dang mya ngan las 'das pa ni tha dad pa'i 'du shes mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni phung po dang mya ngan las 'das pa ni tha dad pa'i 'du shes mi mnga'o //
translated: But the Tathāgata does not have a perception of the aggregates and nirvana as being different.

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni so sor ma brtags par sems can gyi don yal bar 'dor ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni so sor ma brtags par sems can gyi don yal bar 'dor ro //
translated: Moreover, the arhat abandons the welfare of sentient beings without examination.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni de lta bu dang mthun pa so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni de lta bu dang mthun pa so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms mi mnga'o //
translated: But the Tathāgata does not have such an indifference that is not based on examination.

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par ma dag pa las brtsams te 'dun pa las kyang ma thob pa'i yongs su nyams pas yongs su nyams pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni shes bya'i sgrib pa rnam par ma dag pa las brtsams te 'dun pa las kyang ma thob pa'i yongs su nyams pas yongs su nyams pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the arhat, beginning with the purification of the obscurations to the knowable, is subject to a complete retrogressing that is due to a loss of aspiration.

original: brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba las kyang yongs su nyams so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus dang / dran pa dang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba las kyang yongs su nyams so //
translated: He also falls away from his vigor, mindfulness, concentration, wisdom, and liberation.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni yongs su nyams pa 'di drug med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la ni yongs su nyams pa 'di drug med do //
translated: The Tathagata has no such six kinds of falling away.

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni res 'ga' lus kyi las dge ba la 'jug /
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni res 'ga' lus kyi las dge ba la 'jug /
translated: Moreover, the Arhat sometimes engages in virtuous bodily actions,

original: res 'ga' lung du ma bstan pa la 'jug go //
analyzed: res 'ga' lung du ma bstan pa la 'jug go //
translated: sometimes in indeterminate actions.

original: lus kyi las la ji lta ba bzhin du ngag gi las dang yid kyi las kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: lus kyi las la ji lta ba bzhin du ngag gi las dang yid kyi las kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The same holds for his speech and mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las gsum pa ni //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i phrin las gsum pa ni //
translated: The Tathagata has no such three kinds of actions.

original: ye shes sngon du 'gro ba dang / ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'i las med do //🔽de las ye shes kyis kun nas bslang pa'i phyir ye shes sngon du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes sngon du 'gro ba dang / ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa'i las med do // de las ye shes kyis kun nas bslang pa'i phyir ye shes sngon du 'gro ba'o //
translated: He has no indeterminate actions, because his actions are preceded by and follow after his knowledge.🔽They are preceded by knowledge, because they are motivated by knowledge.

original: ye shes dang lhan cig rgyu ba'i phyir dang ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: ye shes dang lhan cig rgyu ba'i phyir dang ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: They follow after knowledge, because they are in association with knowledge.

original: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni rtsol ba tsam gyis dus gsum gyi shes bya'i dngos po rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dgra bcom pa ni rtsol ba tsam gyis dus gsum gyi shes bya'i dngos po rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, the Arhats do not realize the things that are knowable in the three times merely by wishing to do so.

original: des na de'i ye shes mthong ba'i chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de'i ye shes mthong ba'i chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, their knowledge is obstructed by the obscurations of the knowable.

original: thams cad rtogs par yang mi 'gyur te /🔽des @272a * //
analyzed: thams cad rtogs par yang mi 'gyur te / des @272a * //
translated: They do not realize everything.

original: na de'i ya shes mthong ba thogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: na de'i ya shes mthong ba thogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, their knowledge is obstructed by the obscurations of the knowable.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtsol ba tsam gyis dus gsum gyi shes bya'i dngos po thams cad rtogs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni rtsol ba tsam gyis dus gsum gyi shes bya'i dngos po thams cad rtogs te /
translated: The Tathāgata realizes all the things that are knowable in the three times merely by wishing to do so.

original: de lta bas na de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ces bya ba'o //🔽de la 'di dag las dang po drug ni /
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad ces bya ba'o // de la 'di dag las dang po drug ni /
translated: Therefore, these are called the eighteen special qualities of the Buddha.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi phrin las thun mong ma yin par yongs su dag pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi phrin las thun mong ma yin par yongs su dag pa yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
translated: Among them, the first six are the purity of the uncommon deeds of body, speech, and mind, which are the meditative absorption of perfect mastery, and so on.

original: de la 'khrul pa med ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la 'khrul pa med ces bya ba ni /
translated: Among them, “without error”

original: sku'i phrin las yongs su dag pa las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: sku'i phrin las yongs su dag pa las brtsams pa'o //
translated: is from the perspective of the purity of the deeds of the body.

original: ca co med ces bya ba 'di ni gsung gi phrin las yongs su dag pa las brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: ca co med ces bya ba 'di ni gsung gi phrin las yongs su dag pa las brtsams pa'o //
translated: The absence of incoherence is in terms of the purification of the action of teaching.

original: bsnyel ba med pa dang tha dad pa'i 'du shes med pa dang / sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa med pa dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms med ces bya ba 'di bzhi ni thugs kyi phrin las yongs su dag pa'i dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsnyel ba med pa dang tha dad pa'i 'du shes med pa dang / sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa med pa dang / so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms med ces bya ba 'di bzhi ni thugs kyi phrin las yongs su dag pa'i dbang du byas par rig par bya'o //
translated: The absence of forgetfulness, the absence of a variety of ideas, the absence of a lack of meditative concentration, and the absence of a lack of full awareness are to be known as being in terms of the purification of the action of mind.

original: 'dun pa nyams pa med ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dun pa nyams pa med ces bya ba ni /
translated: The absence of a loss of enthusiasm is in terms of the purification of the action of aspiration.🔽The absence of a loss of effort, the absence of a loss of mindfulness, the absence of a loss of concentration, and the absence of a loss of wisdom are in terms of the purification of the action of striving.🔽The absence of a loss of liberation is in terms of the purification of the action of the faculties.🔽The absence of a loss of the vision of awareness of liberation is in terms of the purification of the action of knowledge.🔽The absence of a loss of the faculties, the absence of a loss of the powers, and the absence of a loss of the aspects of enlightenment are in terms of the purification of the action of the path.🔽The absence of a loss of the aspects of the path is in terms of the purification of the action of the branches of the path.🔽The absence of a loss of meditative concentration is in terms of the purification of the action of meditative development.

original: rnam par grol ba nyams pa med pa zhes bya ba'i bar du drug ni /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba nyams pa med pa zhes bya ba'i bar du drug ni /
translated: The absence of a loss of equanimity is in terms of the purification of the action of final deliverance.🔽The absence of a loss of the applications of mindfulness is in terms of the purification of the action of the knowledge of the path.🔽The absence of a loss of the right efforts is in terms of the purification of the action of the knowledge of the stages.🔽The absence of a loss of the bases of supernatural power is in terms of the purification of the action of the knowledge of the faculties.🔽The absence of a loss of the faculties is in terms of the purification of the action of the knowledge of the powers.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po gnas dang bcas pa dang / 'bras bu dang bcas pa rnams ma thob pa'i yongs su nyams pa med par yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //🔽de la gnas ni 'dun pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po gnas dang bcas pa dang / 'bras bu dang bcas pa rnams ma thob pa'i yongs su nyams pa med par yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o // de la gnas ni 'dun pa'o //
translated: The absence of a loss of the powers is in terms of the purification of the action of the knowledge of the branches of the path.🔽The absence of a loss of the branches of the path is in terms of the purification of the action of the knowledge of the aspects of the path.

original: 'bras bu ni rnam par grol pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni rnam par grol pa'o //
translated: The absence of a loss of the aspects of the path is in terms of the purification of the action of the knowledge of final deliverance.🔽The absence of a loss of the knowledge of the path is in terms of the purification of the action of the knowledge of

original: dbang po ni brtson 'grus la sogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dbang po ni brtson 'grus la sogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The faculties are to be known as effort and so on.

original: lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba 'di gsum ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phrin las mdzad pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las thams cad ye shes sngon du 'gro zhing ye shes kyi rjes su 'brang ba 'di gsum ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phrin las mdzad pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
translated: All actions of body, speech, and mind are preceded by knowledge and follow after knowledge. These three are the samādhi, etc., of the perfect attainment of the performance of activity that is not shared.

original: 'das pa'i dus lam chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus lam chags ma thogs pa'i ye shes zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The knowledge of the past time without attachment and obstruction, and so on, up to

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus la zhes bya ba 'di gsum ni ye shes la gnas pa thun mong ma yin pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus la zhes bya ba 'di gsum ni ye shes la gnas pa thun mong ma yin pa yang dag par 'byor ba'i ting nge 'dzin la sogs pa'o //
translated: the knowledge of the present time. These three are the samādhi, etc., of the perfect attainment of the knowledge that is not shared.

original: rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang /
analyzed: rnam par thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang /
translated: What is the knowledge of all aspects?

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab gang /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams la rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid yang dag par 'byor pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang shes rab gang /
translated: It is the samādhi, etc., of the perfect attainment of the knowledge of all aspects with regard to the aggregates, constituents, and sense-spheres.

original: de dag dang mtshungs ldan gyi sems sems byung gi chos rnams so //
analyzed: de dag dang mtshungs ldan gyi sems sems byung gi chos rnams so //
translated: and the phenomena of mind and mental factors that are concomitant with them.

original: phung po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par gyi mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba'i mthur thug pa mkhyen par grub ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / khyad par gyi mtshan nyid rab tu dbye ba'i mthur thug pa mkhyen par grub ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is established that he knows the ultimate extent of the specific characteristics and the essential nature of the aggregates, etc.

original: yon tan 'di rnams ji ltar mngon par @272b sgrub ;
analyzed: yon tan 'di rnams ji ltar mngon par @272b sgrub ;
translated: How are these qualities accomplished?

original: phyi rol pa'am /
analyzed: phyi rol pa'am /
translated: They are accomplished by the bodhisattva, not by the outsider,

original: nyan thos sam /
analyzed: nyan thos sam /
translated: not by the śrāvaka,🔽not by the bodhisattva,

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'am rung ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'am rung ste /
translated: but by the Tathāgata.

original: dag pa'i bsam gtan bzhi la brten nas tshad med pa rnams mngon par grub bo //
analyzed: dag pa'i bsam gtan bzhi la brten nas tshad med pa rnams mngon par grub bo //
translated: The immeasurables are accomplished on the basis of the four pure meditations.

original: tshad med pa rnams ji ltar mngon par shes pa lnga 'am de bzhin no //
analyzed: tshad med pa rnams ji ltar mngon par shes pa lnga 'am de bzhin no //
translated: The five superknowledges are accomplished in the same way.

original: yon tan lhag ma rnams ni nyan thos sam /
analyzed: yon tan lhag ma rnams ni nyan thos sam /
translated: The remaining qualities are accomplished on the basis of the four perfect-end-of-the-prior-ages meditations,🔽whether by the śrāvaka,

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'am de bzhin gshegs pa'ang rung ste /🔽rab kyi mthar phyin pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa la brten nas /🔽mngon par grub pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'am de bzhin gshegs pa'ang rung ste / rab kyi mthar phyin pa'i bsam gtan bzhi pa la brten nas / mngon par grub pa'o //
translated: the bodhisattva, or the Tathāgata.

original: de yang ci'i phyir bsam gtan la brten nas /
analyzed: de yang ci'i phyir bsam gtan la brten nas /
translated: And why are they accomplished on the basis of the meditations?

original: ji ltar rnam par bzhag pa bzhin du lan mang du yid la byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par bzhag pa bzhin du lan mang du yid la byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one frequently brings to mind the way in which they are established.

original: de dag ni mngon par grub pa'i gnas dang / mngon par grub pa po gang zag dang / mngon bar sgrub pa'i thabs kyis yongs su bstan to //🔽mngon par sgrub pa'i thabs ni ji ltar rnam par bzhag pa bzhin du lan mang du yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: de dag ni mngon par grub pa'i gnas dang / mngon par grub pa po gang zag dang / mngon bar sgrub pa'i thabs kyis yongs su bstan to // mngon par sgrub pa'i thabs ni ji ltar rnam par bzhag pa bzhin du lan mang du yid la byed pa ste /
translated: They are taught by way of the basis of their establishment, the person who establishes them, and the means of their establishment.🔽The means of their establishment is the frequent bringing to mind of the way in which they are established.

original: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du sems mnyam par bzhag pas yang dang yang du de la 'jog ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du sems mnyam par bzhag pas yang dang yang du de la 'jog ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that one repeatedly places the mind on them in meditative equipoise, in accordance with the teachings.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: tshad med pa mngon par bsgrub par 'dod pa byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems khon med pa dang / 'dren zla med ces bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa bsam gtan la brten nas bsam pa yid la byed pas mang du byed do //
analyzed: tshad med pa mngon par bsgrub par 'dod pa byams pa dang ldan pa'i sems khon med pa dang / 'dren zla med ces bya ba la sogs pa bstan pa bsam gtan la brten nas bsam pa yid la byed pas mang du byed do //
translated: one who desires to establish the immeasurables frequently brings to mind the teachings of loving kindness, such as the thought endowed with loving kindness that is free of enmity and rivalry, etc., in dependence on the meditative absorptions.

original: de bzhin du mngon par shes pa la sogs pa mngon par bsgrub par 'dod pa dang / gcig tu gyur nas mang por gyur ces bya ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa yid la byed pas mang du byed do zhes bya ba sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mngon par shes pa la sogs pa mngon par bsgrub par 'dod pa dang / gcig tu gyur nas mang por gyur ces bya ba la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa yid la byed pas mang du byed do zhes bya ba sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one who wishes to manifest the superknowledges, etc., should be understood as one who frequently practices the mental attention that is established in the form of the wish: “May I become one, may I become many, etc.”

original: yon tan 'di dag ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yon tan 'di dag ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: These good qualities are twofold:

original: rang gi bya ba la nye bar gnas pa dang / gnas pa las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi bya ba la nye bar gnas pa dang / gnas pa las gyur pa'o //
translated: those that are based on one’s own activity and those that are based on abiding.

original: rang gi bya ba la nye bar gnas pa gang /
analyzed: rang gi bya ba la nye bar gnas pa gang /
translated: What are those that are based on one’s own activity?

original: de dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa kun rdzob shes pa'i rang bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rjes la thob pa kun rdzob shes pa'i rang bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as having the nature of conventional knowledge that is attained subsequent to the supramundane path.

original: yang gnas pa las gyur pa gang /
analyzed: yang gnas pa las gyur pa gang /
translated: What are those that are based on abiding?

original: de dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes kyi rang bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as having the nature of supramundane knowledge.

original: rang gi bya ba la nye bar gnas pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi bya ba la nye bar gnas pa ni /
translated: Those that are based on one’s own activity

original: gang dag gi 'phags pa ci rigs su mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba la sogs pa'i las byed do //
analyzed: gang dag gi 'phags pa ci rigs su mi mthun pa'i phyogs spong ba la sogs pa'i las byed do //
translated: are those by which the noble ones perform their functions, such as abandoning the resistances, etc., in whatever way is appropriate.

original: gnas pa las gyur pa ni mchog tu zhi ba rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus pa dmigs pa med pa'i tshad med pa la sogs pa gang dag gi mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa las gyur pa ni mchog tu zhi ba rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis bsdus pa dmigs pa med pa'i tshad med pa la sogs pa gang dag gi mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pa'o //
translated: The action of the immeasurables is to make sentient beings happy and to mature them.

original: tshad med pa rnams kyis las ci mdzad /🔽mi mthun pa'i phyogs spyod ngo //
analyzed: tshad med pa rnams kyis las ci mdzad / mi mthun pa'i phyogs spyod ngo //
translated: The immeasurables are four:🔽loving kindness, compassion, joy, and equanimity.

original: thugs brtse bar gnas @273a * //
analyzed: thugs brtse bar gnas @273a * //
translated: Loving kindness is the wish that they be happy.🔽Compassion is the wish that they be free from suffering.

analyzed: 'di dag gis sems can gyi don gyi rjes su mthun par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because these are in conformity with the benefit of sentient beings.
