analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gis gnas na sems can thams cad la thugs brtse bar gnas pas bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par mdzad do //
translated: Therefore, when they abide in these, they abide in compassion for all sentient beings, and so they complete the accumulation of merit.

original: de nyid kyi phyir sems can thams cad yongs su smin par mdzad pa la mi skye te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir sems can thams cad yongs su smin par mdzad pa la mi skye te /
translated: For this very reason, they do not tire of bringing all sentient beings to maturity.

original: sems can thams cad la thugs brtse bas bdag la mi lta ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la thugs brtse bas bdag la mi lta ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are compassionate toward all sentient beings, they do not look to their own benefit.

original: rnam thar rnams kyis las ci mdzad /
analyzed: rnam thar rnams kyis las ci mdzad /
translated: What is their action in the liberations?

original: sprul pa'i las mngon par sgrub pa'o /🔽sdug par sprul ba la kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sprul pa'i las mngon par sgrub pa'o / sdug par sprul ba la kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They accomplish the action of emanation.🔽They do not become defiled by emanating beauty.

original: zhi ba'i rnam thar rnams la mi chags so //
analyzed: zhi ba'i rnam thar rnams la mi chags so //
translated: They do not become attached to the liberations of beauty.

original: mos pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i gnas pa mchog tu rab tu zhi ba'i gnas pas gnas so //
analyzed: mos pa'i phyir 'phags pa'i gnas pa mchog tu rab tu zhi ba'i gnas pas gnas so //
translated: They abide in the highest peace of the noble abodes, because of their aspiration.

original: rnam par thar pa rnams las gnyis ni sprul pa'i las mngon par sgrub po //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rnams las gnyis ni sprul pa'i las mngon par sgrub po //
translated: Of the liberations, two are the accomplishment of the action of emanation.

original: gsum pas ni /
analyzed: gsum pas ni /
translated: The third is the accomplishment of the action of purification.

original: dge ba sprul pa la kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba sprul pa la kun nas nyon mongs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the wholesome emanations, he is not defiled.

original: gzugs med pa'i rnam par thar pa bzhis ni zhi ba'i rnam par thar pa rnams la mi chags so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i rnam par thar pa bzhis ni zhi ba'i rnam par thar pa rnams la mi chags so //
translated: By means of the four formless emancipations, he is not attached to the emancipations of peace.

original: thabs ni 'phags pa'i gnas pa mchog tu rab tu zhi ba'i gnas te de de ltar mos pa'i don ni rnam par thar pa'i don du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: thabs ni 'phags pa'i gnas pa mchog tu rab tu zhi ba'i gnas te de de ltar mos pa'i don ni rnam par thar pa'i don du rig par bya'o //
translated: The method is the supreme, most tranquil station of the noble ones. The meaning of his resolve in this way is to be known as the meaning of emancipation.🔽What is the action of the spheres of mastery?🔽By means of the three emancipations, he has power over the objective supports.🔽The action of the spheres of mastery, etc., should be applied in the same way as the previous explanation.

original: zil gnon gyi skye mched rnams kyis las ci mdzad dmigs pa zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zil gnon gyi skye mched rnams kyis las ci mdzad dmigs pa zil gyis gnon pa'i phyir /
translated: What is the action of the spheres of totality?

original: rnam thar gsum po dag dmigs pa las dbang bsgyur bar mdzad do //
analyzed: rnam thar gsum po dag dmigs pa las dbang bsgyur bar mdzad do //
translated: By means of the three emancipations, he has power over the objective supports.

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched la sogs pa'i las kyang snga ma bzhin du de ltar bstan pa'i tshul du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched la sogs pa'i las kyang snga ma bzhin du de ltar bstan pa'i tshul du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The action of the spheres of mastery, etc., should be applied in the same way as the previous explanation.🔽What is the action of the spheres of totality?🔽By means of the three emancipations, he has power over the objective supports.🔽The action of the spheres of totality, etc., should be applied in the same way as the previous explanation.🔽What is the action of the unlimiteds?

original: ma lus pa'i skye mched rnams kyis las ci mdzad /
analyzed: ma lus pa'i skye mched rnams kyis las ci mdzad /
translated: By means of the three emancipations, he has power over the objective supports.

original: mtha' yas par mdzad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mtha' yas par mdzad pa'i phyir /
translated: The action of the unlimiteds, etc., should be applied in the same way as the previous explanation.🔽What is the action of the bases of subjugation?🔽By means of the three emancipations, he has power over the objective supports.🔽The action of the bases of subjugation, etc., should be applied in the same way as the previous explanation.🔽What is the action of the bases of totality?

original: rnam thar gyi dmigs pas yongs su sgrub par mdzad do //
analyzed: rnam thar gyi dmigs pas yongs su sgrub par mdzad do //
translated: By means of the three emancipations, he has power over the objective supports.🔽The action of the bases of totality, etc., should be applied in the same way as the previous explanation.

original: nyon mongs pa med pas las ci mdzad /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pas las ci mdzad /
translated: What is the action of being without affliction?

original: bzung ba'i tshig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzung ba'i tshig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: It is the action of being a support.

original: gzhan gyi sems rjes su srung ba gces su byed pa ji ltar mthun pa bzhin du smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems rjes su srung ba gces su byed pa ji ltar mthun pa bzhin du smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the action of being a support, because one is a support for the Dharma.🔽What is the action of the knowledge of the future?

original: smon nas shes pas las ci mdzad byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / da ltar gyi lung ston pa dang / 'jig rten mang pos bkur bar @273b 'gyur ro //🔽thams cad shes so zhes gus par byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: smon nas shes pas las ci mdzad byung ba dang 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / da ltar gyi lung ston pa dang / 'jig rten mang pos bkur bar @273b 'gyur ro // thams cad shes so zhes gus par byas pa'i phyir /
translated: It is the action of being an object of respect in the world.

original: 'jig rten mang pos bkur bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten mang pos bkur bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is the action of being an object of respect in the world, because one is respected as omniscient.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyis las ci mdzad /
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa rnams kyis las ci mdzad /
translated: What is the action of the analytical knowledges?

original: bshad pas sems can rnams kyi sems tshim par mdzad do //🔽rnam pa sna tshogs mang pos the tshom gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pas sems can rnams kyi sems tshim par mdzad do // rnam pa sna tshogs mang pos the tshom gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the action of satisfying the minds of beings.🔽It is the action of satisfying the minds of beings, because one satisfies the minds of beings by means of the Dharma.

original: mngon par shes pa rnams kyis las ci mdzad /🔽lus kyi las kyis bstan pa la 'dun par mdzad do //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa rnams kyis las ci mdzad / lus kyi las kyis bstan pa la 'dun par mdzad do //
translated: What is the action of the superknowledges?🔽It is the action of attracting beings by means of the body.

original: ngag gi las kyis 'dun par mdzad do //
analyzed: ngag gi las kyis 'dun par mdzad do //
translated: It is the action of attracting beings by means of speech.

original: sems kun rjod pas kyang 'dun par mdzad do //
analyzed: sems kun rjod pas kyang 'dun par mdzad do //
translated: He also inspires them to aspire to the knowledge of the thoughts of all beings.

original: sems can gyi spyod pa dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba mkhyen nas sems can rnams nges par 'byung ba la ji ltar tshig gsung ngo ;
analyzed: sems can gyi spyod pa dang / 'ong ba dang / 'gro ba mkhyen nas sems can rnams nges par 'byung ba la ji ltar tshig gsung ngo ;
translated: Knowing the conduct, coming and going of beings, he inspires them to aspire to the deliverance of beings, according to their words.

original: / rdzu 'phrul dang lha'i rna ba dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba dang / zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa rnams kyis ni go rims bzhin du lus kyi las la sogs pa bstan pa la 'dun bar mdzad /
analyzed: / rdzu 'phrul dang lha'i rna ba dang / gzhan gyi sems shes pa dang / sngon gyi gnas dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba dang / zag pa zad pa'i mngon par shes pa rnams kyis ni go rims bzhin du lus kyi las la sogs pa bstan pa la 'dun bar mdzad /
translated: By the superknowledges of magical power, divine ear, knowledge of others' minds, knowledge of past lives, knowledge of death and rebirth, and knowledge of the destruction of the impurities, he inspires them to aspire to the teaching of the body, etc., respectively.

original: lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pas ni sgra'i rnam pa thams cad rtogs nas ngag gi las kyi 'dun par mdzad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lha'i rna ba'i mngon par shes pas ni sgra'i rnam pa thams cad rtogs nas ngag gi las kyi 'dun par mdzad par rig par bya'o //
translated: By the superknowledge of the divine ear, having understood all aspects of sound, he inspires them to aspire to the teaching of speech.

original: mtshan dang dpe byang bzang po rnams kyis las ci mdzad /
analyzed: mtshan dang dpe byang bzang po rnams kyis las ci mdzad /
translated: What is the function of the major and minor marks?

original: mthong ma thag tu skyes bu chen po nyid du yid ches skye'o //
analyzed: mthong ma thag tu skyes bu chen po nyid du yid ches skye'o //
translated: As soon as they see him, they believe in the Great Man.

original: gzhan gyi sems mngon par dang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems mngon par dang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The minds of others are purified.

original: yongs su dag par las ci mdzad /
analyzed: yongs su dag par las ci mdzad /
translated: What does the purification of the basis do?

original: bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba yongs su 'dzin to //
analyzed: bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba yongs su 'dzin to //
translated: It takes up birth in existence as one wishes.

original: bzhed na bskal pa las lhag par bzhugs so //
analyzed: bzhed na bskal pa las lhag par bzhugs so //
translated: If one wishes, one can remain for an eon or more.

original: tshe'i 'du byed kyang 'dor ro //
analyzed: tshe'i 'du byed kyang 'dor ro //
translated: One can also cast off the life forces.

original: chos la dbang bsgyur ro //
analyzed: chos la dbang bsgyur ro //
translated: One has power over phenomena.

original: ting nge 'dzin la dbang bsgyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la dbang bsgyur ro //
translated: One has power over concentration.

original: dam pa'i chos kyang yang dag par 'dzin to //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos kyang yang dag par 'dzin to //
translated: One upholds the true Dharma.

original: gnas yongs su dag pa ni ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin du gnas ngan len pa dang / bzhugs pa dang / yongs su gtong ba'i dbang du mdzad nas srid par skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa la sogs pa gsum du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas yongs su dag pa ni ji ltar bzhed pa bzhin du gnas ngan len pa dang / bzhugs pa dang / yongs su gtong ba'i dbang du mdzad nas srid par skye ba yongs su 'dzin pa la sogs pa gsum du rig par bya'o //
translated: The purification of the basis should be understood as the three, taking up birth in existence as one wishes, and so on, in terms of the control over the negative tendencies, remaining, and relinquishing of the basis.

original: dmigs pa yongs su dag pa ni chos la dbang bsgyur ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa yongs su dag pa ni chos la dbang bsgyur ro //
translated: The purification of the object is having power over phenomena.

original: sems yongs su dag pas ni ting nge 'dzin la dbang bsgyur ro //
analyzed: sems yongs su dag pas ni ting nge 'dzin la dbang bsgyur ro //
translated: The purification of mind is having power over concentration.

original: ye shes yongs su dag pas ni dam pa'i chos yang dag par 'dzin to //
analyzed: ye shes yongs su dag pas ni dam pa'i chos yang dag par 'dzin to //
translated: The purification of wisdom is upholding the true Dharma.

original: stobs kyis las ci mdzad /
analyzed: stobs kyis las ci mdzad /
translated: What does power do?

original: rgyur med pa dang / mi mthun pa'i rgyur smra ba dang / ma byas pa dang / phrad par smra ba bsal nas yang dag par mngon par mthong ba'i lam ston to //🔽sems can gyi sems kyi spyod pa dang / bshad pa'i snod dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / dmigs pa @274a * //
analyzed: rgyur med pa dang / mi mthun pa'i rgyur smra ba dang / ma byas pa dang / phrad par smra ba bsal nas yang dag par mngon par mthong ba'i lam ston to // sems can gyi sems kyi spyod pa dang / bshad pa'i snod dang / bsam pa dang / bag la nyal ba dang / dmigs pa @274a * //
translated: He teaches the path of seeing correctly, having eliminated the causes that do not exist, the causes that are contrary, the unmade, and the theory of contact.🔽He teaches the path that is appropriate to the spiritual gene, having understood the conduct of the minds of sentient beings, their suitability as recipients, their attitudes, their latent tendencies, their objects,

original: dang ; tshogs dang / 'os su 'gyur ba dang / nges par yang dag par rjes su rtogs nas ji lta bar 'os par legs pa'i lam ston to //
analyzed: dang ; tshogs dang / 'os su 'gyur ba dang / nges par yang dag par rjes su rtogs nas ji lta bar 'os par legs pa'i lam ston to //
translated: their accumulations, their fitness, and their thorough knowledge.

original: bdud thams cad kyang char gcod do //
analyzed: bdud thams cad kyang char gcod do //
translated: He cuts off all the demons.

original: thams cad du dri ba dris pa yang lung ston pa /
analyzed: thams cad du dri ba dris pa yang lung ston pa /
translated: He answers all questions.

original: stobs rnams kyi nang nas sto bas gnyis ni mngon par mtho ba'i lam ston to //
analyzed: stobs rnams kyi nang nas sto bas gnyis ni mngon par mtho ba'i lam ston to //
translated: Two of the powers teach the path of distinction.

original: lhag ma rnams kyis ni nges par legs pa'i lam ston to //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis ni nges par legs pa'i lam ston to //
translated: The rest teach the path of right conduct.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mdzad pa ni 'di dag go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis mdzad pa ni 'di dag go //
translated: These are the deeds of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni //
translated: With regard to that, the Bhagavat, by the power of knowing the possible and impossible,

original: mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu med pa las byung ba dang rang bzhin dang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung ngo zhes rgyu med pa dang / mi mthun pa'i rgyur smra pa de spong ngo //
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba'i rgyu med pa las byung ba dang rang bzhin dang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung ngo zhes rgyu med pa dang / mi mthun pa'i rgyur smra pa de spong ngo //
translated: rejects the assertion of a cause that is not a cause, such as the primal substance, God, etc., and the assertion of a cause that is not compatible, such as the assertion that the effect arises from a cause that is not its cause.

original: las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni bdag gis ma byas kyang las 'ong ngo zhes ma byas pa dang phrad par smra ba de spongs te /
analyzed: las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni bdag gis ma byas kyang las 'ong ngo zhes ma byas pa dang phrad par smra ba de spongs te /
translated: By the power of knowing the fruition of actions, he rejects the assertion that one encounters the result of an action that one has not done.

original: 'di ltar yang dag par ma nor ba bde 'gro'i lam ston to //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag par ma nor ba bde 'gro'i lam ston to //
translated: Thus, he teaches the unerring path to good destinies.

original: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni /🔽sems kyi rgyu pa sems kyi spyod pa rnams te /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni / sems kyi rgyu pa sems kyi spyod pa rnams te /
translated: By the power of knowing the absorptions, liberations, samādhis, and samāpattis,🔽he knows the mental processes and the conduct of the mind.

original: sems kyi rgyu pa rnams rtogs so //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyu pa rnams rtogs so //
translated: He realizes the mental processes.

original: dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni bshad pa'i snod dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po yongs su smin pa rjes su rtogs so /
analyzed: dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni bshad pa'i snod dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po yongs su smin pa rjes su rtogs so /
translated: By the power of knowing the supreme and not supreme faculties, one realizes the vessel for the teachings, the fully ripened faculties of faith and so on.

original: mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni bsam pa ste /🔽ngan pa dang / bzang po la mos pa rjes su rtogs so //
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni bsam pa ste / ngan pa dang / bzang po la mos pa rjes su rtogs so //
translated: By the power of knowing the various aspirations, one realizes the various intentions.

original: khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni /🔽bag la nyal sel nus pa'i nyon mongs pa rjes su rtogs so //
analyzed: khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni / bag la nyal sel nus pa'i nyon mongs pa rjes su rtogs so //
translated: By the power of knowing the various elements, one realizes the various dispositions.

original: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni /🔽dmigs pa nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni / dmigs pa nyan thos kyi theg pa'am /
translated: By the power of knowing the paths that lead everywhere, one realizes the paths that lead to the higher realms and definite goodness.

original: theg pa chen po bstan pa'i chos kyis bsdus pa rjes su rtogs so //🔽sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni /
analyzed: theg pa chen po bstan pa'i chos kyis bsdus pa rjes su rtogs so // sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni /
translated: By the power of knowing the absorptions, liberations, concentrations and so forth, one realizes the paths that lead to the higher realms and definite goodness.

original: tshe rabs snga ma dag la tshogs yang dag par bsgrub pa 'phags pa'i lam gyi rgyu rjes su rtogs so ;
analyzed: tshe rabs snga ma dag la tshogs yang dag par bsgrub pa 'phags pa'i lam gyi rgyu rjes su rtogs so ;
translated: By the power of knowing former lives, one realizes the cause of the noble path, the perfect accomplishment of the accumulations in former lives.🔽By the power of knowing death and rebirth, one realizes the result of the noble path, the complete purification of the three realms.

original: /'chi 'pho dang / skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni /
analyzed: /'chi 'pho dang / skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni /
translated: By the power of knowledge of death and rebirth,

original: phyi ma la 'os su 'gyur ba rjes su rtogs so //
analyzed: phyi ma la 'os su 'gyur ba rjes su rtogs so //
translated: he understands what is appropriate for the future.

original: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis ni /
translated: By the power of knowledge of the destruction of the impurities,

original: 'jig rten thams cad nges par 'byung ba rjes su rtogs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad nges par 'byung ba rjes su rtogs te /
translated: he understands the deliverance of the whole world,

original: gang las ji lta ba bzhin du thar pa'i lam ston to //
analyzed: gang las ji lta ba bzhin du thar pa'i lam ston to //
translated: and he teaches the path of deliverance just as it is.

original: stobs nyid ni 'di dag gi phung @274b po dang ; nyon mongs pa dang / lha'i bu dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud tshar gcod pa'i khyad par gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: stobs nyid ni 'di dag gi phung @274b po dang ; nyon mongs pa dang / lha'i bu dang / 'chi bdag gi bdud tshar gcod pa'i khyad par gyi phyir ro //
translated: The powers are so called because they crush the aggregates, the afflictions, the son of gods, and the demon of death.

original: khyad par ni shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs nas bar chad mi byed pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa nas zag pa zad pa'i bar thams cad du dri ba dris na /
analyzed: khyad par ni shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs nas bar chad mi byed pa dang / gnas dang gnas ma yin pa nas zag pa zad pa'i bar thams cad du dri ba dris na /
translated: The specific powers are as follows: having abandoned the obscurations to omniscience, he is unimpeded in all his activities, from place to place, and so forth, up to the destruction of the impurities.

original: 'dri ba lung ston pa la thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dri ba lung ston pa la thogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When he is asked questions, he is unimpeded in answering them.

original: mi 'jigs pa rnams kyis las ci mdzad /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa rnams kyis las ci mdzad /
translated: What is the action of the forms of fearlessness?

original: 'khor gyi nang du bdag ston pa yang dag pa yin par rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang du bdag ston pa yang dag pa yin par rnam par 'jog go //
translated: He establishes himself as the true teacher in the midst of the assembly.

original: rgol pa bzhin mu stegs can rnams kyang tshar gcong do //
analyzed: rgol pa bzhin mu stegs can rnams kyang tshar gcong do //
translated: The tirthikas are defeated like the disputants.

original: 'khor gyi nang du bdag ston pa yang dag par bdag dang / gzhan la phan par zhugs pa nyid du rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang du bdag ston pa yang dag par bdag dang / gzhan la phan par zhugs pa nyid du rnam par 'jog go //
translated: He is established as the teacher who benefits himself and others in the assembly.

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa nas lam gyi bar rgol pa'i mu stegs can rnams chos dang mthun par tshar gcod do //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa nas lam gyi bar rgol pa'i mu stegs can rnams chos dang mthun par tshar gcod do //
translated: From the time of his enlightenment until the time of his passing, he defeats the tirthikas in accordance with the Dharma.

original: dran pa nyer gnas rnams kyis las ci mdzad /
analyzed: dran pa nyer gnas rnams kyis las ci mdzad /
translated: What is the function of the foundations of mindfulness?

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i tshogs yongs su sdud do //🔽gus par nyan pa la sogs pa la rjes su chags pa la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i tshogs yongs su sdud do // gus par nyan pa la sogs pa la rjes su chags pa la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: He gathers the assembly of those who are not defiled.

original: kun nas nyon mongs la can ma yin pas tshogs yongs su sdud do //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs la can ma yin pas tshogs yongs su sdud do //
translated: He gathers the assembly of those who are not defiled because he is not defiled by attachment to those who listen respectfully and so on.

original: bsrung med rnams kyis las ci mdzad /🔽rgyun mi 'chad par tshogs la tshogs gsung ngo //
analyzed: bsrung med rnams kyis las ci mdzad / rgyun mi 'chad par tshogs la tshogs gsung ngo //
translated: What is the function of the unhindered knowledges?🔽He teaches the Dharma to the assembly without interruption.

original: yang dag par rjes su ston to //
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su ston to //
translated: He teaches the Dharma to the assembly without interruption.

original: rang gi nyes pa brjod du dogs nas bsrung ba med pa'i phyir rgyun mi 'chad par tshogs la yongs su 'doms so //
analyzed: rang gi nyes pa brjod du dogs nas bsrung ba med pa'i phyir rgyun mi 'chad par tshogs la yongs su 'doms so //
translated: He constantly and uninterruptedly instructs the assembly, because he is without protection, fearing that his faults will be mentioned.

original: bsnyel ba med pa'i chos nyid kyis las ci mdzad /
analyzed: bsnyel ba med pa'i chos nyid kyis las ci mdzad /
translated: What does he do by the nature of being without forgetfulness?

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mi 'dor ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mi 'dor ro //
translated: He does not abandon the deeds of a Buddha.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba nye bar gnas pa la skad cig tsam yang bag med pas 'dul bar mi mdzad pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mi 'dor //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba nye bar gnas pa la skad cig tsam yang bag med pas 'dul bar mi mdzad pa'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mi 'dor //
translated: He does not abandon the deeds of a Buddha, because he is not unconcentrated for even a moment in the performance of the aims of sentient beings.

original: bag chags legs par bcom pas las ci mdzad /
analyzed: bag chags legs par bcom pas las ci mdzad /
translated: What does he do by the destruction of the residues?

original: nyon mongs med pas nyon mongs pa'i tshul gyi sbyor ba mi ston to //
analyzed: nyon mongs med pas nyon mongs pa'i tshul gyi sbyor ba mi ston to //
translated: He does not show the performance of the addictions, because he is without addictions.

original: ji ltar dge slong dgra bcom pa 'khrul pa la sogs pa ston pa lta bu ma yin te nyon mongs pa med pas nyon mongs pa lta bu'i spyod pa mi ston to //
analyzed: ji ltar dge slong dgra bcom pa 'khrul pa la sogs pa ston pa lta bu ma yin te nyon mongs pa med pas nyon mongs pa lta bu'i spyod pa mi ston to //
translated: He does not show the performance of the addictions as though he were addicted, as for example a bhikṣu Arhat might do.

original: thugs rje chen pos las ci mdzad /
analyzed: thugs rje chen pos las ci mdzad /
translated: What does he do by his great compassion?

original: nyin mtshan lan drug tu 'jig rten pa la rnam par gzigs so //
analyzed: nyin mtshan lan drug tu 'jig rten pa la rnam par gzigs so //
translated: He looks at the world six times each day and night.

original: su 'phel bar gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis so sor rtog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: su 'phel bar gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis so sor rtog pa'i phyir /
translated: One should investigate with such aspects as Who is increasing? and so on.

original: nyin mtshan lan drug tu 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs so //
analyzed: nyin mtshan lan drug tu 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs so //
translated: He sees the world six times each day and night with the thought Who is growing in virtue? Who is growing in evil? and so forth.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyis las ci mdzad /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyis las ci mdzad /
translated: What is the action of the Buddhas' unique qualities?

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi phrin las yongs su dag pa dang / 'thob pa dang / gshegs pa dang / bzhugs @275a * //🔽pas kyang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad zil gyis gnon to //
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi phrin las yongs su dag pa dang / 'thob pa dang / gshegs pa dang / bzhugs @275a * // pas kyang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas thams cad zil gyis gnon to //
translated: They surpass all the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas by their pure actions of body, speech and mind, by their attainment, their going and their dwelling.

original: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi phrin las thun mong ma yin pa yongs su dag par 'byor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid /
analyzed: sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi phrin las thun mong ma yin pa yongs su dag par 'byor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid /
translated: The action of the unique qualities is to surpass all the Sravakas and Pratyekabuddhas by the purity of the Buddha's actions of body, speech and mind, by his attainment, his going and his dwelling.🔽The action of the ten powers is to eliminate all doubts of all beings.🔽The action of the four forms of fearlessness is to eliminate all doubts of all beings.

original: mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skabs bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid bstan pa'i skabs bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The action of the four forms of unobstructed knowledge is to teach the Dharma without impediment.

original: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis las ci mdzad /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyis las ci mdzad /
translated: The action of great compassion is to rescue all beings from the suffering of the three worlds.🔽The action of the eighteen aspects exclusive to the Buddhas is to prevent the eye of the world from being destroyed.

original: sems can thams cad kyi the tshom gcod ngo //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi the tshom gcod ngo //
translated: The action of the knowledge of all the aspects is to eliminate all the doubts of all beings.🔽The action of the knowledge of the path to all destinations is to teach the Dharma in order to eliminate all the doubts of all beings.

original: chos kyi tshul yang yun ring du 'jog go //
analyzed: chos kyi tshul yang yun ring du 'jog go //
translated: The action of the knowledge of the recollective formula is to make the Dharma last a long time and to prevent the eye of the world from being destroyed.

original: des sems can ma smin pa rnams ni yongs su min pa dang / yongs su smin pa rnams ni rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des sems can ma smin pa rnams ni yongs su min pa dang / yongs su smin pa rnams ni rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By this, immature sentient beings are brought to maturity, and those who are mature are liberated.

original: thams cad ye shes thogs pa med pas sems can thams cad kyi the tshom gcod do //
analyzed: thams cad ye shes thogs pa med pas sems can thams cad kyi the tshom gcod do //
translated: By means of unobstructed knowledge, he severs the doubts of all sentient beings.

original: the tshom bcad pa'i phyir de dang der bstan pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs yang dag par sdud pa'i rigs kyis yang dag par sdud pas /
analyzed: the tshom bcad pa'i phyir de dang der bstan pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs yang dag par sdud pa'i rigs kyis yang dag par sdud pas /
translated: In order to sever doubts, he collects the various Dharma teachings that are taught here and there, and by collecting them,

original: chos kyi tshul yang yun ring du 'jog go //
analyzed: chos kyi tshul yang yun ring du 'jog go //
translated: he establishes the way of the Dharma for a long time.

original: chos kyi tshul de la brten nas sems can rnams yongs su ma smin pa rnams ni yongs su smin par mdzad do //
analyzed: chos kyi tshul de la brten nas sems can rnams yongs su ma smin pa rnams ni yongs su smin par mdzad do //
translated: Relying on that way of the Dharma, he brings to maturity those sentient beings who are not yet mature.

original: yongs su smin pa rnams ni rnam par grol bar mdzad do //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa rnams ni rnam par grol bar mdzad do //
translated: And he liberates those who are mature.

original: mngon par rtogs pa 'di dag las gong nas gong du khyad par du 'phags pa'i lam thob na /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa 'di dag las gong nas gong du khyad par du 'phags pa'i lam thob na /
translated: When he attains a path that is superior to these realizations,

original: lam snga ma dman pa ni 'dor ro //
analyzed: lam snga ma dman pa ni 'dor ro //
translated: he abandons the former inferior path.

original: bsdoms te spong ba yang mngon sum du byed do //
analyzed: bsdoms te spong ba yang mngon sum du byed do //
translated: He also manifests the abandonment of the collection of defilements.

original: khyad par du 'phags pa'i lam thob na /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa'i lam thob na /
translated: When one obtains the path of distinction,

original: lam dman pa 'dor ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: lam dman pa 'dor ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: one abandons the inferior path.

original: 'bras bus bsdus pa'i lam thob par gyur na 'jug pa'i lam dman pa 'dor zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'bras bus bsdus pa'i lam thob par gyur na 'jug pa'i lam dman pa 'dor zhes brjod do //
translated: When one obtains the path included in the fruit, one abandons the inferior path of entry.

original: yang mchog tu gyur pa mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang mchog tu gyur pa mngon du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because one realizes the supreme,

original: bsdoms te spong ba yang mngon sum du byed do zhes pa ni /
analyzed: bsdoms te spong ba yang mngon sum du byed do zhes pa ni /
translated: one also realizes the abandonment of the totality.

original: 'bras bu thob pa'i dus te /
analyzed: 'bras bu thob pa'i dus te /
translated: This refers to the time of obtaining the fruit,

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnas ngan len ma lus par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one has abandoned all the negative tendencies that are adverse to it.

original: gnas gyur pa'i khyad par thob pa'o //
analyzed: gnas gyur pa'i khyad par thob pa'o //
translated: One obtains the distinction of the transformation.

original: phung po lhag ma med kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su /
analyzed: phung po lhag ma med kyi mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su /
translated: In the realm of nirvana without remainder,

original: nyan thos kyi lam thams cad rgyun yang dag par gcod pa'i rnam par 'dor bas rnam par spong ste byang chub sems dpa' ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi lam thams cad rgyun yang dag par gcod pa'i rnam par 'dor bas rnam par spong ste byang chub sems dpa' ni ma yin no //
translated: the Sravakas completely abandon all paths by eliminating their continuity, but the Bodhisattvas do not.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad pa dang / yon tan mi zad pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad pa dang / yon tan mi zad pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the roots of virtue of the bodhisattvas are said to be inexhaustible, and their qualities are said to be inexhaustible.

original: rgyun yang dag par spong pa'i rnam par 'dor ba rnam par spong ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgyun yang dag par spong pa'i rnam par 'dor ba rnam par spong ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The abandonment of the abandonment of the foundations of mindfulness is called the thorough relinquishment of thorough relinquishment.

original: gtan du kun du mi spyod pas rnam par 'dor zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gtan du kun du mi spyod pas rnam par 'dor zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is called thorough relinquishment because it is never engaged in.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni de ltar rnam par spong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni de ltar rnam par spong ba ma yin te /
translated: The bodhisattvas do not have such an abandonment.

original: de'i lam ni thob par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de'i lam ni thob par byed pa ni /
translated: Their path is one of attainment,

original: @275b sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba'i bsam pa sngon du gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @275b sems can thams cad yongs su mya ngan las bzla ba'i bsam pa sngon du gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are motivated by the intention to lead all sentient beings to complete nirvana.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad pa dang yon tan mi zad pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni dge ba'i rtsa ba mi zad pa dang yon tan mi zad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the roots of virtue of the bodhisattvas are said to be inexhaustible, and their qualities are said to be inexhaustible.

original: 'di ltar blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las mi zang pa bstan pa rnams yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar blo gros mi zad pas bstan pa'i mdo las mi zang pa bstan pa rnams yin no //
translated: In this way, the teachings on inexhaustibility in the Aksayamatinirdesa Sutra are explained.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po gang dag rnam par gzhag pa ci'i phyir /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i dngos po gang dag rnam par gzhag pa ci'i phyir /
translated: Why are the neutral things that are posited so?

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yongs su 'dri ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yongs su 'dri ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they ask questions that are not in accordance with reality.

original: ci'i phyir tshul bzhin ma yin pa yongs su 'dri /
analyzed: ci'i phyir tshul bzhin ma yin pa yongs su 'dri /
translated: Why do they ask questions that are not in accordance with reality?

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la sogs pa yongs su spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la sogs pa yongs su spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they reject cause and effect, defilement and purification, and so on.

original: 'dri ba de dag gi 'dri ba don dang ldan pa ji lta bu yin zhen /
analyzed: 'dri ba de dag gi 'dri ba don dang ldan pa ji lta bu yin zhen /
translated: How is it that their questions are meaningful?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi las brtsams nas gang 'dri ba ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi las brtsams nas gang 'dri ba ste /
translated: They ask questions that are based on the four noble truths.

original: 'di ltar de rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la sogs pa'i nang du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de rgyu dang 'bras bu dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba la sogs pa'i nang du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they understand cause and effect, defilement and purification, and so on.

original: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'/
analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'/
translated: Why is it that the bodhisattva,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i nges pa la zhugs ni rgyun du zhugs par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i nges pa la zhugs ni rgyun du zhugs par mi 'gyur /
translated: having entered the certainty of the bodhisattva, does not become a stream-winner?

original: rgyun la 'jug pa yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun la 'jug pa yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the entry into the stream has not been completed.

original: mi gnas pa'i lam thob pas rgyun la 'jug pa yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i lam thob pas rgyun la 'jug pa yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they have attained the path that does not abide, they do not fully establish entry into the continuum.

original: ci'i phyir lan cig phyir 'ong bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lan cig phyir 'ong bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Why do they not become once-returners?

original: bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba tshad med pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsams bzhin du srid par skye ba tshad med pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they take up immeasurable rebirths in existence as they wish.

original: ci'i phyir phyir mi 'ong bar mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i phyir phyir mi 'ong bar mi 'gyur /
translated: Why do they not become non-returners?

original: bsam gtan rnams kyi gnas shing 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams kyi gnas shing 'dod pa'i khams su skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they abide in the dhyanas and take rebirth in the desire realm.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs par byas nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni bden pa rnams mngon par rtogs par byas nas /
translated: The bodhisattvas, having realized the truths,

original: sa bcu rnams su bsgom pa'i lam la shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por lam bsgom gyi nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sa bcu rnams su bsgom pa'i lam la shes bya'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por lam bsgom gyi nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa'i gnyen por ni ma yin te /
translated: on the path of meditation in the ten grounds, cultivate the path as an antidote to the obstructions to omniscience, but not as an antidote to the afflictive obstructions.

original: de'i byang chub thob pa na nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa lan cig la spong ngo //
analyzed: de'i byang chub thob pa na nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa lan cig la spong ngo //
translated: When they attain enlightenment, they abandon both the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience at the same time.

original: lan cig la dgra bcom pa dang / de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lan cig la dgra bcom pa dang / de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur ro //
translated: At the same time they become arhats and tathagatas.

original: de nyon mongs pa ma spangs su zin kyang sngags dang sman gyis gzung ba'i dug lta bu dang / dper na spangs pa'i dgra bcom pa ltar /
analyzed: de nyon mongs pa ma spangs su zin kyang sngags dang sman gyis gzung ba'i dug lta bu dang / dper na spangs pa'i dgra bcom pa ltar /
translated: Even though he has not abandoned the afflictions, he is like one who has taken poison and has been cured by an antidote, or like an arhat who has abandoned the afflictions.

original: sa thams cad du nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa mi skyed do //
analyzed: sa thams cad du nyon mongs pa'i nyes pa mi skyed do //
translated: He does not generate the faults of the afflictions on any of the stages.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' shes bya la mkhas pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa rnam par rtogs pa la mkhas pa dang / rnam par mi rtogs pa la mkhas par bya'o //
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' shes bya la mkhas pa dang / thabs la mkhas pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa rnam par rtogs pa la mkhas pa dang / rnam par mi rtogs pa la mkhas par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva should be skilled in the knowable, skilled in means, skilled in unreal imagination, and skilled in non-imagination.

original: dus dus su dbang po rnams sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: dus dus su dbang po rnams sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: From time to time, he should apply the faculties.

original: zhes bya gang de @276a * //
analyzed: zhes bya gang de @276a * //
translated: What is that?

original: yang rnam pa drug tu blta ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa drug tu blta ste /
translated: It should be seen as sixfold:

original: 'khrul pa dang / 'khrul pa'i gnas dang / 'khrul ba dang ma khrul ba yang ma yin pa dang / ma 'khrul pa dang / 'khrul pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa dang / 'khrul pa'i gnas dang / 'khrul ba dang ma khrul ba yang ma yin pa dang / ma 'khrul pa dang / 'khrul pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
translated: error, the basis of error, neither error nor non-error, non-error, the cause of error, and the result of error.

original: de la 'khrul pa ni bzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'khrul pa ni bzung ba dang 'dzin par mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: Among them, error is the adherence to the apprehended object and apprehending subject.

original: 'khrul ba'i gnas ni 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul du byed kyi /
analyzed: 'khrul ba'i gnas ni 'phags pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul du byed kyi /
translated: The basis of error is the domain of the noble ones' intuition,

original: rgyu tsam yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du rtog pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa gang la byis pa rnams gang mngon par zhen pa 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu tsam yang dag pa ma yin pa kun du rtog pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa gang la byis pa rnams gang mngon par zhen pa 'jug pa'o //
translated: but it is also the mere cause, which is the nature of unreal imagination, in which the childish are attached and engage.

original: ma 'khrul pa'i gnas ni de bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa'i gnas ni de bzhin nyid de /
translated: The basis of non-error is thusness,

original: de rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rten yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis of non-conceptual intuition.

original: 'khrul pa yang yin la ma 'khrul pa yin pa ni ;
analyzed: 'khrul pa yang yin la ma 'khrul pa yin pa ni ;
translated: That which is both error and non-error

analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i bar du yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

translated: Because those phenomena are imputed by the mind to a non-entity, and are designated by the name ‘impermanent,’ and so on.
