original: skur 'debs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por stong pa nyid kyis ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: skur 'debs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por stong pa nyid kyis ma yin zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The antidote to the conception of denial is the statement, “It is not by emptiness.”

original: ming de kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de dang bral ba nyid du thams cad du yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ming de kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid de dang bral ba nyid du thams cad du yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the name is always present as being free from that imagined reality.🔽As an antidote to the conception of identity, it is said:

original: gcig pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por gzugs stong ba nyid gang yin de gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por gzugs stong ba nyid gang yin de gzugs ma yin zhes bya ba nas /
translated: That which is the emptiness of form is not form.

original: rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid gang yin par rnam par shes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa stong pa nyid gang yin par rnam par shes pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs te /
translated: That which is the emptiness of consciousness is not consciousness.

original: ngo bo nyid gzhan yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gzhan yin pa'i phyir gzugs la sogs pa ni kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Because of being a different nature, form, etc. are the imagined reality.

original: stong pa nyid ni yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: Emptiness is the perfected reality.🔽As an antidote to the conception of difference, it is said:

original: tha dad pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por stong pa nyid las gzugs gzhan ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por stong pa nyid las gzugs gzhan ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Form is not other than emptiness.

original: gzugs nyid stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzugs nyid stong pa nyid do //
translated: Emptiness is form.

original: stong pa nyid gzugs so zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du gsungs te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid gzugs so zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du gsungs te /
translated: Consciousness is not other than emptiness.

original: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas /
analyzed: kun brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pas /
translated: Because it has the characteristic of the non-existence of the imagined reality,

original: de las ma gtogs par de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las ma gtogs par de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no such thing apart from that.

original: ngo bo nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por 'di lta ste /
translated: The antidote to the discrimination of intrinsic reality is stated thus:

original: gzugs zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'di ni ming tsam mo zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽brjod pa ma gtogs par brjod pa'i @278a * //
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba nas rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'di ni ming tsam mo zhes bya ba gsungs te / brjod pa ma gtogs par brjod pa'i @278a * //
translated: “This is merely a name, from form to consciousness.”

original: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because apart from the expression, there is no intrinsic reality of the expression.

original: khyad par du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por ngo bo nyid kyis mi skye ba'i zhes bya ba nas rnam par byang ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs te /
analyzed: khyad par du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por ngo bo nyid kyis mi skye ba'i zhes bya ba nas rnam par byang ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs te /
translated: The antidote to the discrimination of particularity is stated thus: “One does not see origination by intrinsic reality, up to one does not see purification.”

original: skye ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa'i khyad par gyi mtshan nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the characteristics of particularity such as origination are negated.

original: ming ji lta ba bzhin du don rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por mi bcos ma la chos so sor brtags pas glo bur du ming gi rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ming ji lta ba bzhin du don rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por mi bcos ma la chos so sor brtags pas glo bur du ming gi rjes su tha snyad 'dogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'o //
translated: The antidote to the discrimination of the meaning in accordance with the name is stated thus: “One does not see the dharma as a fabrication, by investigating the dharma individually, as a nominal designation that has arisen adventitiously.”

original: don ji lta ba bzhin du ming du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por byang chub sems dpa' ming de dag thams cad yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin du ming du rnam par rtog pa'i gnyen por byang chub sems dpa' ming de dag thams cad yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: As an antidote to the discursive thought of a name in regard to the object as it is, the bodhisattva does not see any of those names as real.

original: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas mngon par zhen pa med do zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su mi mthong bas mngon par zhen pa med do zhes gsungs te /
translated: Since he does not see them as real, he does not settle down on them.

original: don ji lta ba bzhin du ming du mi mthong na mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin du ming du mi mthong na mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If he does not see the name in regard to the object as it is, he does not settle down on it.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa nyid gang /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa nyid gang /
translated: What is non-discursiveness?🔽Non-discursiveness of non-satisfaction, non-discursiveness of non-error, and non-discursiveness of non-elaboration.

original: chog par mi 'dzin pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa nyid dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa nyid dang / spros pa med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa nyid de so so'i skye bo rnams dang / nyan thos rnams dang /
analyzed: chog par mi 'dzin pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa nyid dang / phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa nyid dang / spros pa med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa nyid de so so'i skye bo rnams dang / nyan thos rnams dang /
translated: They belong to ordinary beings, śrāvakas,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / go rims bzhin no //
translated: and bodhisattvas, respectively.

original: de la so so'i skye bo rnams ni /
analyzed: de la so so'i skye bo rnams ni /
translated: Among them, ordinary beings

original: gang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa chos nyid 'ga' zhig la brtsams nas sems pa mthar khrid de /
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa chos nyid 'ga' zhig la brtsams nas sems pa mthar khrid de /
translated: Having begun with some fact such as impermanence, they lead their thoughts to a conclusion,

original: 'di ni de bzhin no zhes nges par byed cing yongs su tshim pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin no zhes nges par byed cing yongs su tshim pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: and they become certain that it is so and attain satisfaction.

original: de dag gis ni chog par 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid ces bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gis ni chog par 'dzin pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyid ces bya ste /
translated: This is called the conception of satisfaction.

original: de la mi rtog pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad rgyun 'chad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la mi rtog pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa thams cad rgyun 'chad pa'i phyir /
translated: In that regard, the conception of nonconceptuality is so called because it is the cessation of all conceptions.

original: nyan thos rnams ni phung po rnams la rtag pa la sogs pa'i phyin ci log gi gnyen por ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa la chos tsam du yongs su brtags nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa bdag med par rtogs te /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni phung po rnams la rtag pa la sogs pa'i phyin ci log gi gnyen por ji lta ba bzhin du gzugs la sogs pa la chos tsam du yongs su brtags nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes pa bdag med par rtogs te /
translated: The śrāvakas, as an antidote to the error of permanence, etc., with regard to the aggregates, thoroughly investigate form, etc., as mere phenomena, just as they are, and realize the supramundane cognition of selflessness.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi de ni phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ces brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi de ni phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ces brjod do //
translated: Therefore, that is called the nonconceptual nonerror.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa la chos tsam de yang spong bar rig nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni gzugs la sogs pa la chos tsam de yang spong bar rig nas /
translated: Bodhisattvas, knowing that even that mere phenomenon of form, etc. is to be abandoned,

original: chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma rnam par bshig ste /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma rnam par bshig ste /
translated: destroy the signs of all phenomena.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes mchog tu zhi bas de bzhin nyid thams cad du 'gro bar rtogs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes mchog tu zhi bas de bzhin nyid thams cad du 'gro bar rtogs te /
translated: By means of the supramundane wisdom of supreme peace, they realize the suchness that pervades all.

original: de'i phyir de dag ni spros pa med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ces brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag ni spros pa med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ces brjod do //
translated: Therefore, they are said to be the nonconceptuality of the absence of mental construction.

original: spros pa med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ni yid la @278b byed pa med pas ma yin /
analyzed: spros pa med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ni yid la @278b byed pa med pas ma yin /
translated: The nonconceptuality of the absence of mental construction should be seen as not being due to the absence of mental activity,

original: yang dag par 'das pas ma yin /
analyzed: yang dag par 'das pas ma yin /
translated: not being due to transcendence,

original: rnam par zhi bas ma yin /
analyzed: rnam par zhi bas ma yin /
translated: not being due to complete peace,

original: ngo bo nyid kyis ma yin /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis ma yin /
translated: not being due to an intrinsic nature,

original: dmigs pa la mngon par 'du byed pas ma yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa la mngon par 'du byed pas ma yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: and not being due to the mental construction of an objective support.

original: gal te yid la byed pa pa med pas de skad byas na /
analyzed: gal te yid la byed pa pa med pas de skad byas na /
translated: If it is said that it is so due to the absence of mental activity,

original: des na gnyid kyis log pa dang / ra ro ba la sogs pa la yang rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na gnyid kyis log pa dang / ra ro ba la sogs pa la yang rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then even those who are asleep, drunk, etc. would have nonconceptuality.

original: de dag la chos kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la chos kyi mtshan ma yid la byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not have the mental activity of the signs of the Dharma.

original: ji ste yang dag par 'das pas de skad ces bya na ni /
analyzed: ji ste yang dag par 'das pas de skad ces bya na ni /
translated: If it is said that way because of transcending,

original: de bas na bsam gtan gnyis pa las sogs pa thams cad kyang rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na bsam gtan gnyis pa las sogs pa thams cad kyang rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then all of the second concentration and so forth would be non-conceptual,

original: rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa dang dpyod pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they transcend the conceptual thoughts of investigation and analysis.

original: de'i phyir na rnam par rtog pa'i lus ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir na rnam par rtog pa'i lus ni /
translated: Therefore, it contradicts this statement:

original: khams gsum pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i zhes bya ba 'di dang 'gal lo //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i zhes bya ba 'di dang 'gal lo //
translated: “The body of conceptual thought is the mind and mental factors of the three realms.”

original: ji ste rnam par zhi bas de skad du bya ba ni /
analyzed: ji ste rnam par zhi bas de skad du bya ba ni /
translated: If it is said that way because of complete pacification,

original: des na 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa snyoms par 'jug pa yang rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa snyoms par 'jug pa yang rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then the meditative absorption of the cessation of discriminations and feelings would also be non-conceptual,

original: des sems dang sems las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnam par zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des sems dang sems las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa rnam par zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it completely pacifies the conceptual thoughts of the mind and mental factors.

original: de'i phyir shes pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would be without consciousness.

original: ji ste ngo bo nyid kyis de skad ces bya na ni /
analyzed: ji ste ngo bo nyid kyis de skad ces bya na ni /
translated: If it is called that by intrinsic nature,

original: des na gzugs rnam par mi rtog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na gzugs rnam par mi rtog par 'gyur te /
translated: then form would be non-conceptual,

original: de rnam par mi rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnam par mi rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the intrinsic nature of non-conceptuality.

original: ji ste dmigs pa la mngon par 'du byed pas de skad bya na ni /
analyzed: ji ste dmigs pa la mngon par 'du byed pas de skad bya na ni /
translated: If it is called that because it is a formative factor with regard to an object,

original: des na rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa rnam par mi rtog par 'gyur te /🔽'di ni rnam pa mi rtog pa'o zhes mngon par 'du byed pa 'di ni /
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa rnam par mi rtog par 'gyur te / 'di ni rnam pa mi rtog pa'o zhes mngon par 'du byed pa 'di ni /
translated: then the conceptual would be non-conceptual,🔽because the formative factor of this conceptualization,

original: mtshan ma la rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan ma la rnam par rtog pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: which is the characteristic of conceptualization with regard to signs,🔽would be non-conceptual.

original: de lta bas na rnam par de dag gi rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du mi blta bar bya ste //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par de dag gi rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du mi blta bar bya ste //
translated: Therefore, those forms should not be regarded as non-conceptual,

original: 'on kyang dmigs pa la mngon par 'du byed pa med par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang dmigs pa la mngon par 'du byed pa med par blta bar bya'o //
translated: but rather as non-formative with regard to an object.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' de rjes su mthun pa de nyid kyi gdams pa la brten nas chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su ma grub par rnam par rtog ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' de rjes su mthun pa de nyid kyi gdams pa la brten nas chos thams cad kyi mtshan ma ni rang bzhin gyis yongs su ma grub par rnam par rtog ste /
translated: When the bodhisattva, on the basis of that very concordant instruction, conceives the signs of all phenomena as essentially unestablished,

original: rnam par rtog pa de la goms pa'i stobs bskyed pas so so rang gi mngon par 'du byed pa nyid kyis ji lta ba bzhin du spros pa med pa'i dbyings chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la sems mnyam par 'jog ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de la goms pa'i stobs bskyed pas so so rang gi mngon par 'du byed pa nyid kyis ji lta ba bzhin du spros pa med pa'i dbyings chos thams cad kyi de bzhin nyid la sems mnyam par 'jog ste /
translated: then, by the power of cultivating that conception, he settles his mind in the reality of all phenomena, the unelaborated realm, just as it is, by his own personal effort.

original: de ni de'i spros pa med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ces brjod do //
analyzed: de ni de'i spros pa med pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ces brjod do //
translated: That is called his unelaborated non-imagination.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyis dbang po rnon po yin na ji ltar dbang po rnams sbyor ce na /🔽dbang po rnon @279a * //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyis dbang po rnon po yin na ji ltar dbang po rnams sbyor ce na / dbang po rnon @279a * //
translated: If the bodhisattva is naturally of sharp faculties, how does he sharpen his faculties?

original: po chung ngu la brten te rnon po'i 'bring mngon par bsgrub bo //
analyzed: po chung ngu la brten te rnon po'i 'bring mngon par bsgrub bo //
translated: He sharpens his faculties by relying on the small of the sharp faculties to achieve the medium of the sharp faculties.

original: dbang po rnon po'i 'bring la brten te rnon po'i chen po mngon par bsgrub bo //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po'i 'bring la brten te rnon po'i chen po mngon par bsgrub bo //
translated: and on the basis of the middling of the sharp faculties, he accomplishes the great of the sharp faculties.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyis dbang po rnon po'o zhes sngar bshad na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni rang bzhin gyis dbang po rnon po'o zhes sngar bshad na /
translated: Since it was previously explained that the bodhisattva is naturally of sharp faculties,

original: de ji ltar dus su dbang po rnams sbyar bar bya zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar dus su dbang po rnams sbyar bar bya zhes brjod ce na /
translated: how is it that he is said to apply his faculties in a timely way?

original: rang gi rigs kyi rtul po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gong nas gong du mngon par bsgrub pas de spyang bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi rigs kyi rtul po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gong nas gong du mngon par bsgrub pas de spyang bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that he sharpens them by accomplishing the higher types of faculties, such as the sharp, that belong to his own family.

original: gzhan du na dbang po rnon po'i rigs rnams kyis dbang po rnams dbang po gcig tu gyur na ni /
analyzed: gzhan du na dbang po rnon po'i rigs rnams kyis dbang po rnams dbang po gcig tu gyur na ni /
translated: Otherwise, if the families of the sharp faculties were to become one faculty,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang por gyur pa'i khyad par mi dmigs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi dbang por gyur pa'i khyad par mi dmigs par 'gyur na /
translated: the distinctive nature of the bodhisattvas’ faculties would not be observed.

original: de yang dmigs pas de'i phyir ji skad bshad pa de grub bo //
analyzed: de yang dmigs pas de'i phyir ji skad bshad pa de grub bo //
translated: But since it is observed, the point is established as explained.🔽The attainment of those is by that.

original: thob pa rnams des zhes bya ba ste kun nas btus pa bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: thob pa rnams des zhes bya ba ste kun nas btus pa bzhi pa'o /
translated: This is the fourth collection.

original: // / yang dag pa'i gtan gyi rnam nges gang /
analyzed: // / yang dag pa'i gtan gyi rnam nges gang /
translated: What is the determination of the right times?

original: rnam par bdun te /
analyzed: rnam par bdun te /
translated: It is sevenfold:

original: don rnam des dang / rnam bshad rnam des dang / rab tu phye nas kun du bstan pa rnams nges dang / yang dag par dri ba rnam des dang / bsdu ba rnam nges dang / smra ba rnam nges dang / ldem por dgongs ba rnam nges dang /
analyzed: don rnam des dang / rnam bshad rnam des dang / rab tu phye nas kun du bstan pa rnams nges dang / yang dag par dri ba rnam des dang / bsdu ba rnam nges dang / smra ba rnam nges dang / ldem por dgongs ba rnam nges dang /
translated: the Ascertainment of Meaning, the Ascertainment of Expression, the Ascertainment of Exposition, the Ascertainment of Questions, the Ascertainment of Collection, the Ascertainment of Speech, the Ascertainment of Indirect Expression, and the Ascertainment of Meaning.

original: don rnam nges gang /
analyzed: don rnam nges gang /
translated: What is the Ascertainment of Meaning?

original: don drug la brtsams nas gang rnams nges so //
analyzed: don drug la brtsams nas gang rnams nges so //
translated: It is the ascertainment of the six topics.

original: don drug gang /
analyzed: don drug gang /
translated: What are the six topics?

original: ngo bo nyid kyi don dang / rgyu'i don dang / 'bras bu'i don dang / las kyi don dang / spyor ba'i don dang / 'jug pa'i don no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi don dang / rgyu'i don dang / 'bras bu'i don dang / las kyi don dang / spyor ba'i don dang / 'jug pa'i don no //
translated: The topic of nature, the topic of cause, the topic of result, the topic of activity, the topic of endowment, and the topic of function.

original: ngo bo nyid kyi don ni /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi don ni /
translated: What is the topic of nature?

original: ngo bo nyid gsum ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gsum ste /
translated: It is the three natures:

original: kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: kun brtags pa dang / gzhan gyi dbang dang / yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: the imagined, the other-dependent, and the reality.🔽What is the topic of cause?

original: rgyu'i don ni skye ba dang / 'byung ba dang / 'grub pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i don ni skye ba dang / 'byung ba dang / 'grub pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: It is the cause of arising, the cause of evolution, and the cause of accomplishment.

original: de la skye ba'i rgyu ni rkyen rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de la skye ba'i rgyu ni rkyen rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Therein, the cause of arising is the four conditions.

original: rgyu dang de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa dang / bdag po'i rkyen rnams so //
analyzed: rgyu dang de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa dang / bdag po'i rkyen rnams so //
translated: object, and dominant condition.

original: de las 'dus byas thams cad 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las 'dus byas thams cad 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all conditioned things are established from those.

original: 'byung ba'i rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cause of origination is as follows:

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “With ignorance as condition, there are volitions,” up to

original: kun 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / 'gog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar 'dis mthar gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par byang ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / 'gog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i bar 'dis mthar gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam par byang ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “with birth as condition, there is aging and death.” This is because the origination of affliction and purification occurs in sequence.

original: 'grub pa'i rgyu ni mngon sum du dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs par bsnyad pas bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: 'grub pa'i rgyu ni mngon sum du dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs par bsnyad pas bsdus pa ste /
translated: The cause of establishment is included in direct perception and non-perception.

original: des bsgrub pa ma grags pa'i don sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des bsgrub pa ma grags pa'i don sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because by that, the meaning of what is to be established that is not well known is established.

original: 'bras bu'i don ni /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i don ni /
translated: The meaning of result is as follows:

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dang / skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / bral ba'i @279b 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dang / skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / bral ba'i @279b 'bras bu'o //
translated: The result of evolution, the result of natural outcome, the result of conscious effort, the result of separation, and the dominant result.

original: de la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The result of evolution is as follows:

original: kun du len ba'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: kun du len ba'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: the appropriating consciousness.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu 'di lta ste /
translated: The result of natural outcome is as follows:

original: sngar skyes pa'i dge ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi de'i rgyu las byung ba dge ba la sogs pa'i chos phyi ma rnams so /
analyzed: sngar skyes pa'i dge ba la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi de'i rgyu las byung ba dge ba la sogs pa'i chos phyi ma rnams so /
translated: later virtuous, etc., states that arise from the cause of previously arisen virtuous, etc., states.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The result of conscious effort is as follows:

original: sems can thams cad kyi thun mong gi las kyi dbang gis snod kyi 'jig rten gyi chos so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi thun mong gi las kyi dbang gis snod kyi 'jig rten gyi chos so //
translated: the world of sentient beings that arises from the power of the common karma of all sentient beings.

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni 'di lta ste //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni 'di lta ste //
translated: The result of separation is as follows:🔽the result of the path that is the separation from the obscurations.

original: lo thog la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lo thog la sogs pa'o //
translated: The dominant result is as follows:🔽the world of the physical environment that arises from the power of the common karma of all sentient beings.

original: bral ba'i 'bras bu ni 'phags pa'i lam gyis bag la nyal legs par bcom pa'o //
analyzed: bral ba'i 'bras bu ni 'phags pa'i lam gyis bag la nyal legs par bcom pa'o //
translated: The effect of separation is the complete destruction of the latent impressions by the noble path.

original: las kyi don gang /
analyzed: las kyi don gang /
translated: What is the meaning of action?

original: dmigs pa'i las gang /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i las gang /
translated: What is the action of support?

original: byed pa'i las dang / 'bad pa'i las dang / bsgyur ba'i las dang / thob pa'i las so //🔽de la las de rnams kyi don ni /
analyzed: byed pa'i las dang / 'bad pa'i las dang / bsgyur ba'i las dang / thob pa'i las so // de la las de rnams kyi don ni /
translated: The action of support is the action of the basis, the action of preparation, the action of projection, the action of instigation, the action of transformation, and the action of acquisition.

original: 'di ltar las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sngar bstan pa bzhin blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sngar bstan pa bzhin blta bar bya'o //
translated: The meaning of these actions is to be understood according to the defilement section of the subject of action.

original: sbyor ba ni lnga ste mang po las gyur ba dang / rjes su 'ching ba las gyur ba dang / 'brel ba las gyur pa dang / gnas skabs las gyur pa dang / gyur pa las gyur pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni lnga ste mang po las gyur ba dang / rjes su 'ching ba las gyur ba dang / 'brel ba las gyur pa dang / gnas skabs las gyur pa dang / gyur pa las gyur pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: There are five kinds of preparation: preparation consisting of many elements, preparation consisting of binding, preparation consisting of connection, preparation consisting of state, and preparation consisting of transformation.

original: mang po las gyur ba'i sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mang po las gyur ba'i sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Preparation consisting of many elements is, for example,

original: khang pa'i shing dang pha gu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khang pa'i shing dang pha gu la sogs pa'o //
translated: the wood, nails, etc., for a house.

original: rjes su 'ching ba las gyur ba'i sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rjes su 'ching ba las gyur ba'i sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Preparation consisting of binding is, for example,

original: bag la nyal la sogs pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: bag la nyal la sogs pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: the latent impressions, etc.

original: 'di ltar de yod na kun du mi spyod kyang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de yod na kun du mi spyod kyang nyon mongs pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Thus, even when one does not engage in the activity, one is said to be endowed with the defilements, etc.

original: 'brel ba las gyur ba'i sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'brel ba las gyur ba'i sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The application of relation is, for example,

original: rang gi skye bo rnams kyi phan tshun du 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi skye bo rnams kyi phan tshun du 'brel ba'o //
translated: the mutual relation of one’s own people.

original: gnas skabs las gyur pa'i sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gnas skabs las gyur pa'i sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The application of state is, for example,

original: phan 'dogs pa la sogs pa'i sems rgyud kyi gnas skabs te /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa la sogs pa'i sems rgyud kyi gnas skabs te /
translated: the state of the mental continuum of one who is helpful, etc.

original: 'di ltar de'i 'phral du ba de ba dang ldan pa nas sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i bar du brjod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i 'phral du ba de ba dang ldan pa nas sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i bar du brjod do //
translated: Thus, immediately after that, one is said to be endowed with joy, etc., up to being endowed with neither-unpleasant-nor-pleasant.

original: gyur pa las gyur ba'i sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gyur pa las gyur ba'i sbyor ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The application of transformation is, for example,

original: glo bur gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la sogs pa mngon du gyur ba ste /
analyzed: glo bur gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa la sogs pa mngon du gyur ba ste /
translated: the manifestation of adventitious secondary defilements, etc.

original: 'di lta de yod na 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'di lta de yod na 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa dang ldan pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Thus, when that exists, one is said to be endowed with attachment, etc., and with faith, etc.

original: 'jug pa'i don ni 'jug pa pa lnga ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i don ni 'jug pa pa lnga ste /
translated: The meaning of engagement is the five engagements.

original: mtshan nyid kyi 'jug pa dang / phyin ci log gi 'jug pa dang / phyi ci ma log pa'i 'jug pa dang / rab tu dbye ba'i 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi 'jug pa dang / phyin ci log gi 'jug pa dang / phyi ci ma log pa'i 'jug pa dang / rab tu dbye ba'i 'jug pa'o //
translated: the engagement of the characteristics, the engagement of error, the engagement of non-error, and the engagement of differentiation.

original: 'jug pa'i don rnam pa lnga ni /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i don rnam pa lnga ni /
translated: The five kinds of engagement are:

original: de rnams kyi 'jug pa'i don du brjod do //🔽de la mtshan nyid 'jug pa ni /🔽skye ba la sogs pa 'dus @280a * //
analyzed: de rnams kyi 'jug pa'i don du brjod do // de la mtshan nyid 'jug pa ni / skye ba la sogs pa 'dus @280a * //
translated: They are described as the engagement of these.

original: byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum ste /
analyzed: byas kyi mtshan nyid gsum ste /
translated: Therein, the engagement of the characteristics is the three characteristics of the conditioned, i.e., origination and so on,

original: de dag gi rnam par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the origination of the conditioned.

original: rten la 'jug pa ni rten la gnas par bya ba la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: rten la 'jug pa ni rten la gnas par bya ba la gnas pa ste /
translated: The engagement of the basis is the basis of the one who engages in the basis.

original: 'di ltar sa la sems can rnams so //🔽phyin ci log gi 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa la sems can rnams so // phyin ci log gi 'jug pa ni /
translated: Thus, sentient beings are based on the earth.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams te /
translated: The engagement of error is the dharmas of affliction,

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin ma yin par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they engage in what is not as it is.

original: phyin ci ma log par 'jug pa ni 'phags pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par 'jug pa ni 'phags pa'i lam ste /
translated: The engagement of non-error is the noble path,

original: de phyin ci ma log par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de phyin ci ma log par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it engages in what is as it is.

original: rab tu dbye ba'i 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i 'jug pa ni /
translated: The engagement of differentiation is the engagement of the unconditioned,🔽because it is the differentiation of the conditioned.

original: chos rnams kyi rnam pa tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi rnam pa tha dad pa yin te /
translated: The aspects of the teachings are distinct,

original: 'di lta 'du byed thams cad 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / nang dang phyi la sogs pa'i rnam par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di lta 'du byed thams cad 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / nang dang phyi la sogs pa'i rnam par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are applied to the past, future, and present, to the internal and external, and so on.

original: rnam bshad rnam bshad rnam des gang /
analyzed: rnam bshad rnam bshad rnam des gang /
translated: What is the explanation of the explanations?

original: gang gis mdo'i sde rnams rnam bshad byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang gis mdo'i sde rnams rnam bshad byed pa ste /
translated: It is that by which the scriptural collections are explained.

original: don rgya cher ston zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don rgya cher ston zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the teaching of the extensive meaning.

original: de yang gang /
analyzed: de yang gang /
translated: What is that?

original: yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po dang / yongs su shes par bya ba'i don dang / yongs su shes par bya ba'i rgyu dang / yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu dang / de rab tu shes pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po dang / yongs su shes par bya ba'i don dang / yongs su shes par bya ba'i rgyu dang / yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu dang / de rab tu shes pa'o //
translated: It is the thing to be completely understood, the meaning to be completely understood, the cause of complete understanding, complete understanding, the result of complete understanding, and the thorough knowledge of that.

original: de rnams yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po la sogs pa don drug po dag mdo sde so sor rnam par bshad pa rnam par nges pa ji ltar mthun mthun du'o //
analyzed: de rnams yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po la sogs pa don drug po dag mdo sde so sor rnam par bshad pa rnam par nges pa ji ltar mthun mthun du'o //
translated: The six topics, the thing to be completely understood, and so on, are explained in the scriptural collections in accordance with the ascertainment of the explanations.

original: de la yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po ni phung po la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po ni phung po la sogs pa'o //
translated: The thing to be fully understood is the aggregates, etc.

original: yongs su shes par bya ba'i don ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba'i don ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning to be fully understood is impermanence, etc.

original: yongs su shes par bya ba'i rgyu ni tshul khrims dang / dbang po'i sgo sngom pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba'i rgyu ni tshul khrims dang / dbang po'i sgo sngom pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The cause of full understanding is morality, restraint of the sense faculties, etc.

original: yongs su shes pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams so //
translated: Full understanding is the factors of enlightenment.

original: yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu ni rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: The result of full understanding is liberation.

original: de rab tu shes pa ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'o //
analyzed: de rab tu shes pa ni rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'o //
translated: The full understanding of that is the vision of the knowledge of liberation.

original: yang rnam bshad kyi sgo bcu bzhi ste /
analyzed: yang rnam bshad kyi sgo bcu bzhi ste /
translated: There are fourteen kinds of explanation:

original: sgo bcu bzhi ni rnam bshad bsdu ba'i sgo dang / dngos po bsdu ba'i sgo dang / yan lag dang nye ba'i yan lag gi sgo dang / gong nas gong du mngon par bsgrub pa'i sgo dang / spong ba'i sgo dang / yi ge yongs su bsgyur ba'i sgo dang /
analyzed: sgo bcu bzhi ni rnam bshad bsdu ba'i sgo dang / dngos po bsdu ba'i sgo dang / yan lag dang nye ba'i yan lag gi sgo dang / gong nas gong du mngon par bsgrub pa'i sgo dang / spong ba'i sgo dang / yi ge yongs su bsgyur ba'i sgo dang /
translated: The fourteen kinds of explanation are: the door of explanation, the door of collecting things, the door of branches and sub-branches, the door of higher and higher accomplishment, the door of abandonment, the door of changing letters, the door of non-attachment, the door of non-disturbance, the door of non-distinction, the door of non-discrimination, the door of non-perception, the door of non-apprehension, the door of non-observation, and the door of non-existence.

original: chud za ba dang chud mi za ba'i sgo dang / gang zag rnam gzhag gi sgo dang / rab tu dbye ba rnam bzhag gi sgo dang / tshul gyi sgo dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i sgo dang / stobs dang stobs ma yin pa'i sgo dang /
analyzed: chud za ba dang chud mi za ba'i sgo dang / gang zag rnam gzhag gi sgo dang / rab tu dbye ba rnam bzhag gi sgo dang / tshul gyi sgo dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i sgo dang / stobs dang stobs ma yin pa'i sgo dang /
translated: the door of loss and non-loss, the door of the presentation of the person, the door of the presentation of the divisions, the door of the method, the door of thorough understanding, etc., the door of power and impotence,

original: bzlas te brjod pa'i sgo dang / mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo'o //
analyzed: bzlas te brjod pa'i sgo dang / mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo'o //
translated: the door of repetition, and the door of accomplishment.

original: de la rnam par bshad pa bsdu ba'i sgo ni @280b mdo sde gang du 'thad pa dang bcas pas dgos pa'i don dang / tshig gi don dang / mtshams sbyar ba dang dgongs pa dang / brgal ba dang / lan brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par bshad pa bsdu ba'i sgo ni @280b mdo sde gang du 'thad pa dang bcas pas dgos pa'i don dang / tshig gi don dang / mtshams sbyar ba dang dgongs pa dang / brgal ba dang / lan brjod pa'o //
translated: Among them, the door of collecting explanations is a sutra that teaches the meaning of the purpose, the meaning of the words, the connection, the intention, the objections, and the replies, along with the principles.

original: dngos po bsdu pa'i sgo ni mdo sde gang du bslab ba dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / dngos po la sogs pa ston pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po bsdu pa'i sgo ni mdo sde gang du bslab ba dang / 'phags pa'i bden pa dang / dngos po la sogs pa ston pa ste /
translated: The door of collecting things is a sutra that teaches the trainings, the noble truths, things, etc.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: sdig pa thams cad mi bya ste //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad mi bya ste //
translated: Do not commit any evil,

original: dge ba phun sum tshogs par spyad //
analyzed: dge ba phun sum tshogs par spyad //
translated: Practice virtue well,

original: rang gi sems ni yongs su gdul //
analyzed: rang gi sems ni yongs su gdul //
translated: Fully tame one's mind.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching of the Buddha.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig su bcad pa bslab pa gsum gyi dbang du byas pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig su bcad pa bslab pa gsum gyi dbang du byas pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: This verse is from the perspective of the three trainings.

original: yan lag dang nye ba'i yan lag gi sgo ni /
analyzed: yan lag dang nye ba'i yan lag gi sgo ni /
translated: From the perspective of the branches and sub-branches,

original: gang du tshig gcig gis bstan pa la lhags rnams kyis bshad do zhes rab tu ston pa ste /
analyzed: gang du tshig gcig gis bstan pa la lhags rnams kyis bshad do zhes rab tu ston pa ste /
translated: it is taught that when one word is taught, the assemblies explain it.

original: dper na dal ba phun sum tshogs pa bcu gnyis bstan pa las bdag phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzhan phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di gnyis go rims bzhin du tshig 'og ma lnga lngas bshad blta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na dal ba phun sum tshogs pa bcu gnyis bstan pa las bdag phun sum tshogs pa dang / gzhan phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di gnyis go rims bzhin du tshig 'og ma lnga lngas bshad blta bu ste /
translated: For example, in the teaching on the twelve perfections of leisure, the two words perfection of self and perfection of others are explained respectively by the next five words each.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: mi nyid dang / 'phags pa'i yul gyi dbus su skyes pa dang / dbang po rnams ma tshang ba med pa dang / las kyi mtha' smin par ma gyur ba dang / gnas su gyur ba la dad pa dang / sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: mi nyid dang / 'phags pa'i yul gyi dbus su skyes pa dang / dbang po rnams ma tshang ba med pa dang / las kyi mtha' smin par ma gyur ba dang / gnas su gyur ba la dad pa dang / sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba dang /
translated: Human birth, being born in the central land of the noble ones, having complete faculties, not having committed the worst actions, having faith in the right place, the appearance of the buddhas,

original: dam pa'i chos ston pa dang / bstan pa'i chos rnams gnas pa dang / gnas pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / gzhan gyi phyir snying brtse ba'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ston pa dang / bstan pa'i chos rnams gnas pa dang / gnas pa'i chos kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / gzhan gyi phyir snying brtse ba'o //
translated: the teaching of the true Dharma, the duration of the teachings, the practice of the Dharma that endures, and the compassion for others.

original: gong nas gong du mngon phar bsgrub pa'i sgo ni /
analyzed: gong nas gong du mngon phar bsgrub pa'i sgo ni /
translated: The door of higher and higher accomplishment is

original: gang du 'og ma gong mar mngon par bsgrub pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang du 'og ma gong mar mngon par bsgrub pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: where the lower is accomplished in the higher.

original: chos de dag ni de ltar bstan to zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos de dag ni de ltar bstan to zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: These dharmas are taught like this.

original: dper na dbang po lnga po rnams te /
analyzed: dper na dbang po lnga po rnams te /
translated: For example, it is like the five faculties.

original: 'di ltar dad na brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
analyzed: 'di ltar dad na brtson 'grus rtsom mo //
translated: Thus, if there is faith, one exerts vigor.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams na dran pa nye bar gnas so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams na dran pa nye bar gnas so //
translated: If one exerts vigor, mindfulness is present.

original: dran pa nye bar gnas na sems mnyam par 'jog go //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gnas na sems mnyam par 'jog go //
translated: If mindfulness is present, the mind is in equipoise.

original: sems mnyam par bzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems mnyam par bzhag na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes bya'o //
translated: If the mind is in equipoise, one knows reality just as it is.

original: spong ba'i sgo ne 'di la brtsams nas 'di spong bar stong pa ste /
analyzed: spong ba'i sgo ne 'di la brtsams nas 'di spong bar stong pa ste /
translated: The door of abandonment is that which is taught in this context, the abandonment of this.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this.

original: ste'u lta bu'i mdo las zag pa zad pa las brtsams nas 'di las phyi rol ba dang / chos 'di la thos pa dang / sems pa tsam gyis tshogs par 'dzin pa dang / bsgom pas yongs su yi chad pa dang / tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i dge slong dag nga ni shes bzhin mthong bzhin du zag pa rnams zad par smra'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mdo'i tshig gi du ma bu dang pos ni gang zag @281a * //
analyzed: ste'u lta bu'i mdo las zag pa zad pa las brtsams nas 'di las phyi rol ba dang / chos 'di la thos pa dang / sems pa tsam gyis tshogs par 'dzin pa dang / bsgom pas yongs su yi chad pa dang / tshogs yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i dge slong dag nga ni shes bzhin mthong bzhin du zag pa rnams zad par smra'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i mdo'i tshig gi du ma bu dang pos ni gang zag @281a * //
translated: The first passage rejects the person who is not a Buddhist.

analyzed: yi ge yongs su bsgyur ba'i sgo ni gang du don gzhan yang rab tu grub pa'i yi ge rnams gzhan du yongs su bsgyur ba ste /

original: dper na mi gang mi dad byas mi gzo //
analyzed: dper na mi gang mi dad byas mi gzo //
translated: For example, it is like the verse:🔽“One who is ungrateful and faithless…”

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa lta bu'o //
translated: and so on.

original: chud za ba dang chud mi za ba'i sgo ni /
analyzed: chud za ba dang chud mi za ba'i sgo ni /
translated: The method of loss and non-loss is

original: gang du rab tu chud za ba dang / rab tu chud mi za ba dang / de gnyi ga'i thabs dang / de gnyi ga'i rab tu dbye ba ston pa ste /
analyzed: gang du rab tu chud za ba dang / rab tu chud mi za ba dang / de gnyi ga'i thabs dang / de gnyi ga'i rab tu dbye ba ston pa ste /
translated: the teaching of the method of both loss and non-loss, and the analysis of both.

original: dper na legs par skyes pa'i mdo las rab tu chud za ba ni phyi nang gi rdzas la lhag par chags pa'o //
analyzed: dper na legs par skyes pa'i mdo las rab tu chud za ba ni phyi nang gi rdzas la lhag par chags pa'o //
translated: For example, in the Subāhu-paripṛcchā-sūtra, loss is attachment to external and internal things.

original: de la phyi'i rdzas ni khyim dang chung ma la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de la phyi'i rdzas ni khyim dang chung ma la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: There, external things are characterized by home, wife, and so on.

original: nang gi rdzas ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid do //🔽rab tu chud mi za ba ni de gnyi ga la lhag par chags pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: nang gi rdzas ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'i mtshan nyid do // rab tu chud mi za ba ni de gnyi ga la lhag par chags pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Internal things are characterized by the five appropriated aggregates.🔽Non-loss is freedom from attachment to both.

original: rab tu chud mi za ba'i thabs ni de rab tu mi 'byung ba dang / rab tu byung nas kyang zag pa zad par bya ba la bag byed pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu chud mi za ba'i thabs ni de rab tu mi 'byung ba dang / rab tu byung nas kyang zag pa zad par bya ba la bag byed pa'o //
translated: The method of non-loss is not engaging in that, and even if one goes forth, making effort to eliminate the defilements.

original: de las bzlog pa ni chud mi za bar bya ba'i thabs su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni chud mi za bar bya ba'i thabs su blta bar bya'o //
translated: The opposite of that should be seen as the means of not wasting.

original: de la kye ma rigs kyi bu legs par skyed pas 'di ni gnyis kyis mdzes te /
analyzed: de la kye ma rigs kyi bu legs par skyed pas 'di ni gnyis kyis mdzes te /
translated: In this regard, “Oh, son of noble family, this is beautiful with the two, by good development.

original: skra dang kha spu bregs pa nas rab tu byung ba'i bar dang / gang zag pa zad pa nas rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar 'dis chud mi za ba dang / de'i thabs nye bar bstan nas de las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid du chud za ba dang /
analyzed: skra dang kha spu bregs pa nas rab tu byung ba'i bar dang / gang zag pa zad pa nas rab tu shes so zhes bya ba'i bar 'dis chud mi za ba dang / de'i thabs nye bar bstan nas de las bzlog pa'i mtshan nyid du chud za ba dang /
translated: This shows the non-wasting and its means, from shaving the head and face up to going forth, and from the exhaustion of defilements up to fully knowing.

original: de'i thabs bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i thabs bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The opposite of that will show the wasting and its means.

original: chud mi za bar rab tu dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis rab tu bstan pa //
analyzed: chud mi za bar rab tu dbye ba'i tshigs su bcad pa'i dbyangs kyis rab tu bstan pa //
translated: A verse on the analysis of non-wasting:

original: dge slong 'di ni mdzes pa ste //🔽nye bar zhi zhing zag pa zad //
analyzed: dge slong 'di ni mdzes pa ste // nye bar zhi zhing zag pa zad //
translated: This monk is beautiful,

original: ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba'o //
translated: peaceful, with defilements exhausted.

original: de ltar rab tu byung ba dang / zag pa zad pa yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar rab tu byung ba dang / zag pa zad pa yongs su bstan to //
translated: Thus, going forth and the exhaustion of defilements are shown.

original: zag pa zad pa de yang /
analyzed: zag pa zad pa de yang /
translated: And that exhaustion of defilements

original: 'dod chags bral zhing bral ba ste //
analyzed: 'dod chags bral zhing bral ba ste //
translated: is free from attachment, free.

original: nyer len med pas mya ngan 'das //
analyzed: nyer len med pas mya ngan 'das //
translated: Nirvana is due to the absence of appropriation.

original: bdud kyi sde ni pham byas nas //
analyzed: bdud kyi sde ni pham byas nas //
translated: Having defeated the army of Mara,

original: lus kyi tha ma 'dzin pa yin //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: lus kyi tha ma 'dzin pa yin // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: he takes up his final body.

original: 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i lam la 'dod chags dang bral nas /
analyzed: 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i lam la 'dod chags dang bral nas /
translated: This verse shows that, having become detached from the worldly path,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba spangs pa dang / gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba yang spangs pa dang / nang gi rdzas spangs par yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyi tha ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba spangs pa dang / gong ma'i cha dang mthun pa'i kun du sbyor ba yang spangs pa dang / nang gi rdzas spangs par yongs su bstan to //
translated: he abandons the fetters associated with the lower realm by means of the supramundane path, and also abandons the fetters associated with the higher realm, and abandons the internal material.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu zad pa'i skabs yin pas kyang 'dir bstan par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu zad pa'i skabs yin pas kyang 'dir bstan par blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is taught here because it is the occasion for the exhaustion of cause and effect.

original: 'di las bzlog pa ni rab tu chud za ba'i dbye ba bstan par blta bar @281b bya'o //
analyzed: 'di las bzlog pa ni rab tu chud za ba'i dbye ba bstan par blta bar @281b bya'o //
translated: The opposite of this should be understood as the teaching of the classification of complete loss.

original: gang zag rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo ni //
analyzed: gang zag rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo ni //
translated: The classification of persons is taught

original: gang du gang zag 'di snyed kyi dbang du byas nas 'di gsungs so zhes bya bar ston pa ste //
analyzed: gang du gang zag 'di snyed kyi dbang du byas nas 'di gsungs so zhes bya bar ston pa ste //
translated: in order to show that this is taught with reference to this many persons.

original: dper na chu las gyur pa lta bu'i mdo las 'byung ba'i lta ste //
analyzed: dper na chu las gyur pa lta bu'i mdo las 'byung ba'i lta ste //
translated: For example, the Sutra on the Element of Water states:

original: de ni gang zag gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhir rab tu dbye ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ste //
analyzed: de ni gang zag gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhir rab tu dbye ba'i dbang du mdzad nas gsungs pa ste //
translated: This is stated with reference to the classification of individuals into two, three, and four types.

original: so so'i skye bo dang / bden pa mthong ba'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo dang / bden pa mthong ba'o //
translated: They are ordinary beings and those who have seen the truths.

original: so so'i skye bo gsum du rab tu phye nas blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo gsum du rab tu phye nas blta bar bya ste /
translated: Ordinary beings should be understood to be classified into three types:

original: dkar po ma yin pa dang / cung zad dkar ba dang / cher dkar ba'o //
analyzed: dkar po ma yin pa dang / cung zad dkar ba dang / cher dkar ba'o //
translated: those who are not virtuous, those who are slightly virtuous, and those who are very virtuous.

original: bden pa mthong ba ni bzhir rab tu dbye ba ste /
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba ni bzhir rab tu dbye ba ste /
translated: Those who have seen the truths are classified into four types:

original: 'bras bu la gnas pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu la gnas pa bzhi'o //
translated: the four who abide in the result.

original: gsum ni slob pa'o //
analyzed: gsum ni slob pa'o //
translated: Three are learners.

original: rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo ni /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba rnam par gzhag pa'i sgo ni /
translated: The door of classification is

original: gang du mu bzhi la sogs pa'i dri ba rnams kyi don de brjod pa ste //
analyzed: gang du mu bzhi la sogs pa'i dri ba rnams kyi don de brjod pa ste //
translated: where the meaning of questions with four possibilities and so on are stated.

original: dper na mi rtag pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: dper na mi rtag pa'i mdo las /
translated: For example, the Sutra on Impermanence states:

original: gang gi 'di legs par mthong ba des gzugs thams cad mthong ngam //
analyzed: gang gi 'di legs par mthong ba des gzugs thams cad mthong ngam //
translated: “Whoever sees this well, does that one see all forms?

original: gang gis gzugs thams cad mthong ba des 'di thams cad legs par mthong ngam zhes bya bar mu bzhi'o //
analyzed: gang gis gzugs thams cad mthong ba des 'di thams cad legs par mthong ngam zhes bya bar mu bzhi'o //
translated: If one sees all forms, does one see all of this? There are four alternatives.🔽The first alternative is the four aggregates of feeling, etc., which are not to be fully understood and abandoned by superimposing the errors of permanence,

original: mu dang po ni tshor ba la sogs pa phung po bzhi la rtag pa dang / gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang / bdag tu phyin ci log tu sgro ma btags par yongs su shes par bya ba dang spang bar bya ba ste yang dag par rjes su blta ba'o //
analyzed: mu dang po ni tshor ba la sogs pa phung po bzhi la rtag pa dang / gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang / bdag tu phyin ci log tu sgro ma btags par yongs su shes par bya ba dang spang bar bya ba ste yang dag par rjes su blta ba'o //
translated: purity, happiness, and self, but are to be seen just as they are.🔽The second alternative is form, which is not to be fully understood and abandoned by superimposing the errors of permanence,

original: mu gnyis pa ni gzugs la rtag pa dang / gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang / bdag tu phyin ci lcog tu sgro btags nas yongs su shes par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba ma yin pa yang dag par rjes su blta ba'o //
analyzed: mu gnyis pa ni gzugs la rtag pa dang / gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang / bdag tu phyin ci lcog tu sgro btags nas yongs su shes par bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba ma yin pa yang dag par rjes su blta ba'o //
translated: purity, happiness, and self, but is to be seen just as it is.

original: mu gsum pa ni gzugs la rtag pa dang / gtsang ba dang bde ba dang / bdag tu phyin ci log tu sgro ma btags par yongs su shes par bya ba dang spang bar bya ba yang dag par rjes su blta ba'o //
analyzed: mu gsum pa ni gzugs la rtag pa dang / gtsang ba dang bde ba dang / bdag tu phyin ci log tu sgro ma btags par yongs su shes par bya ba dang spang bar bya ba yang dag par rjes su blta ba'o //
translated: The third alternative is to see that form is not to be fully understood or abandoned by over-intellectualizing it as permanent, pure, blissful, or a self.

original: mu bzhi pa ni tshor ba la sogs pa phung po bzhi la rtag pa dang / gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang / bdag tu phyin ci log tu sgro btags nas yongs su shes par bya ba ma yin pa dang / spang bar bya ba ma yin par yang dag par rjes su blta ba'o //
analyzed: mu bzhi pa ni tshor ba la sogs pa phung po bzhi la rtag pa dang / gtsang ba dang / bde ba dang / bdag tu phyin ci log tu sgro btags nas yongs su shes par bya ba ma yin pa dang / spang bar bya ba ma yin par yang dag par rjes su blta ba'o //
translated: The fourth alternative is to see that the four aggregates beginning with feeling are not to be fully understood or abandoned by over-intellectualizing them as permanent, pure, blissful, or a self.

original: gzugs la mu bzhi ji lta ba de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa thams cad la yang rgya cher blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs la mu bzhi ji lta ba de bzhin du tshor ba la sogs pa thams cad la yang rgya cher blta bar bya'o //
translated: Just as there are four alternatives with regard to form, so there are four alternatives with regard to all the aggregates beginning with feeling.

original: gang bya ba byas pa thams cad 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba yin nam /
analyzed: gang bya ba byas pa thams cad 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba yin nam /
translated: Is it that all that is to be done is done, and that there is no other existence after this?

original: gang 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes pa de thams cad bya ba byas pa yin nam zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: gang 'di las srid pa gzhan mi shes pa de thams cad bya ba byas pa yin nam zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: All of these are those who will not know another existence, and all of them have completed their work.

original: smras pa / mu bzhi ste /
analyzed: smras pa / mu bzhi ste /
translated: It is said: There are four alternatives.

original: mu dang po ni ji srid 'tsho'i bar du legs par spyad pa spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo'o //
analyzed: mu dang po ni ji srid 'tsho'i bar du legs par spyad pa spyod pa'i so so'i skye bo'o //
translated: The first alternative is the ordinary man who practices good conduct as long as he lives.

original: gnyis pa ni chad par lta ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni chad par lta ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The second is the one who has the view of annihilation, etc.

original: gsum pa ni mi slob pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni mi slob pa'o //
translated: The third is the one who is beyond training.

original: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma @282a * //🔽gtogs so zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni rnam pa de dag ma @282a * // gtogs so zhes 'byung ba lta bu'o //
translated: The fourth is the one who is not included in the above.

original: tshul gyi sgo ni gang du tshul drug gis don brjod pa ste /
analyzed: tshul gyi sgo ni gang du tshul drug gis don brjod pa ste /
translated: The door of method is where the meaning is expressed by the six methods.

original: de kho na'i don gyi tshul dang / 'thob pa'i tshul dang bshad pa'i tshul dang / mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i tshul dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul dang / dgongs pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: de kho na'i don gyi tshul dang / 'thob pa'i tshul dang bshad pa'i tshul dang / mtha' gnyis spangs pa'i tshul dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul dang / dgongs pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: The method of reality, the method of attainment, the method of explanation, the method of abandoning the two extremes, the method of the inconceivable, and the method of intention.

original: tshul drug po 'di dag las tshul gong ma gsum ni tshul 'og ma gsum gyis go rims bzhin du rig par bya ste //
analyzed: tshul drug po 'di dag las tshul gong ma gsum ni tshul 'og ma gsum gyis go rims bzhin du rig par bya ste //
translated: From these six methods, the three higher methods should be understood by the three lower methods, respectively.

original: dper na ro myong ba'i mdo las dge slong dag gzugs la ro myang ba yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' dang / sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' spangs nas de kha na'i don gyi tshul ston to //
analyzed: dper na ro myong ba'i mdo las dge slong dag gzugs la ro myang ba yod do zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' dang / sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' spangs nas de kha na'i don gyi tshul ston to //
translated: For example, in the Discourse on the Experience of Taste, the Buddha taught the way of the meaning of reality by avoiding the extreme of denial and the extreme of superimposition, saying, “Monks, there is an experience of taste in form, etc.”

original: ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba yod do zhes bya ba 'dis ni skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' spangs so //
analyzed: ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba yod do zhes bya ba 'dis ni skur ba 'debs pa'i mtha' spangs so //
translated: By saying, “There is an experience of taste, there is a danger, there is an escape,” he avoided the extreme of denial.

original: gzugs nas rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'dis ni sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' spangs te /🔽phung po tsam la kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar 'dis ni sgro 'dogs pa'i mtha' spangs te / phung po tsam la kun nas nyon mongs pa'am /
translated: By saying, “Form, etc., up to consciousness,” he avoided the extreme of superimposition.🔽He taught that there is only the defilement and purification of the aggregates,

original: rnam par byad bar zad kyi bdag ni med do zhes rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par byad bar zad kyi bdag ni med do zhes rab tu bstan to //
translated: and that there is no self.

original: dge slong dag ji tsam du ngas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya bar nang du shes so zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: dge slong dag ji tsam du ngas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so zhes bya bar nang du shes so zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: “Monks, I have realized the supreme enlightenment, and I know that I have realized it.”

original: mthong ba'i tshul bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul gyis yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: mthong ba'i tshul bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i tshul gyis yongs su bstan te /
translated: The way of seeing is taught by the inconceivable way.

original: so so rang gis rig par bya ba mthong bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: so so rang gis rig par bya ba mthong bar ston pa'o //
translated: The way of seeing is taught as the individual intuitive wisdom.

original: mdo 'di thams cad ni bshad pa'i tshul lo //
analyzed: mdo 'di thams cad ni bshad pa'i tshul lo //
translated: All of this sutra is the way of explanation.

original: de yang dgongs pa'i tshul gyis khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang dgongs pa'i tshul gyis khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it should be understood by the way of intention.

original: yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po dang / yongs su shes par bya ba'i don dang / yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu dang / de rab tu shes pa la dgongs nas mdo 'di bshad do //
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po dang / yongs su shes par bya ba'i don dang / yongs su shes pa dang / yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu dang / de rab tu shes pa la dgongs nas mdo 'di bshad do //
translated: This sutra is explained with the intention of the thing to be fully known, the meaning to be fully known, full knowing, the result of full knowing, and the thorough knowledge of that.

original: de la yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la yongs su shes par bya ba'i dngos po ni gzugs la sogs pa'o //
translated: Therein, the thing to be fully known is form, etc.

original: yongs su shes par bya ba'i don ni ro myang ba la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba'i don ni ro myang ba la sogs pa ste //
translated: The meaning to be fully known is enjoyment, etc.

original: rnam par des gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par des gzugs la sogs pa'i dngos po yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that discrimination, the thing such as form is fully known.

original: yongs su shes pa de ni nye len pa'i phung po lnga po de dag de ltar gsum du bsgyur bas yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa de ni nye len pa'i phung po lnga po de dag de ltar gsum du bsgyur bas yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i shes pa'o //
translated: That thorough knowledge is the knowledge that fully realizes things as they are by transforming those five appropriated aggregates in that way into the three.

original: yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu ni lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten 'di las zhes bya ba nas //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa'i 'bras bu ni lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten 'di las zhes bya ba nas //
translated: The result of thorough knowledge is that one is liberated from this world with its gods, etc.,

original: lha dang mir bcas pa zhes bya ba'i bar las 'gro bas na rnam par rab tu grol zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: lha dang mir bcas pa zhes bya ba'i bar las 'gro bas na rnam par rab tu grol zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: up to “with its Māra and Brahmā, with its renunciants and brahmins,” and so on up to “from this world with its beings.”

original: de rab tu shes pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs @282b par sangs rgyas pa nang du shes so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rab tu shes pa ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs @282b par sangs rgyas pa nang du shes so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That thorough knowledge is fully realized in unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i sgo ni /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i sgo ni /
translated: The door of thorough knowledge, etc., is

original: gang du de kho na'i mtshan nyid las brtsams nas yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang / spong ba'i mtshan nyid dang / mngon sum du byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de kho na'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa 'di dag gi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: gang du de kho na'i mtshan nyid las brtsams nas yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang / spong ba'i mtshan nyid dang / mngon sum du byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang / bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid dang / de kho na'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa 'di dag gi rnam pa rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid dang /
translated: It is the teaching of the meaning by way of the characteristics of the thorough knowledge of the object of observation, the characteristics of abandonment, the characteristics of realization, the characteristics of cultivation, the characteristics of the aspects of the differentiation of those characteristics of the object of observation, etc.,

original: gnas dang gnas pa 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i bar du gcod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid dang / yongs su ma shes pa la sogs pa dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa la nyes dmigs dang phan yon gyi mtshan nyid kyis don ston pa ste //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas pa 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i bar du gcod pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid dang / rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid dang / yongs su ma shes pa la sogs pa dang / yongs su shes pa la sogs pa la nyes dmigs dang phan yon gyi mtshan nyid kyis don ston pa ste //
translated: the characteristics of the connection of the basis and the based, the characteristics of the phenomena that are obstructions to thorough knowledge, etc., the characteristics of conformity, the characteristics of the disadvantages and benefits in thorough non-knowledge, etc., and thorough knowledge, etc.

original: dper na ro myang ba'i mdo de nyid las 'byung ba de la de kho na'i mtshan nyid nye bar len pa'i phung po lngas bsdus pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
analyzed: dper na ro myang ba'i mdo de nyid las 'byung ba de la de kho na'i mtshan nyid nye bar len pa'i phung po lngas bsdus pa sdug bsngal gyi bden pa'o //
translated: For example, the same Sūtra on Enjoying the Recollection of the Buddhas says, “The characteristic of thatness is the truth of suffering, which is included in the five appropriated aggregates.

original: yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni ro myang ba la sogs pas de nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni ro myang ba la sogs pas de nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of full understanding is the correct knowledge of thatness through enjoying the recollection of the buddhas.

original: spong ba'i mtshan nyid dang / mngon sum du byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: spong ba'i mtshan nyid dang / mngon sum du byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni //
translated: The characteristic of abandonment and the characteristic of actualization

original: 'jig rten thams cad las rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad las rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: are the liberation from all worldly states.

original: sgrib spong ba dang / gnas su gyur ba mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrib spong ba dang / gnas su gyur ba mngon sum du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the obscurations are abandoned and the transformation of the basis is actualized.

original: bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid ni phyin ci log dang bral ba'i sems kyis lan mang du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid ni phyin ci log dang bral ba'i sems kyis lan mang du gnas pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of meditation is the frequent abiding of the mind free from error.

original: rnam pa rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: rnam pa rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of the divisions

original: de kho na'i mtshan nyid rnam pa lngar dbye ba ste /
analyzed: de kho na'i mtshan nyid rnam pa lngar dbye ba ste /
translated: is the division of thatness into five aspects.

original: gzugs nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du ste yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum du dbye ba ste /
analyzed: gzugs nas rnam par shes pa'i bar du ste yongs su shes pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gsum du dbye ba ste /
translated: The characteristic of complete understanding is threefold:

original: ro myang ba la ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs la nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba'i bar la nges par 'byung ba'i bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
analyzed: ro myang ba la ro myang ba dang / nyes dmigs la nyes dmigs dang / nges par 'byung ba'i bar la nges par 'byung ba'i bar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so //
translated: one understands the taste of the taste of form, etc. up to consciousness, one understands the danger in the danger, and one understands the escape in the escape.

original: spong ba'i mtshan nyid dang / mngon sum du byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
analyzed: spong ba'i mtshan nyid dang / mngon sum du byed pa'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa gnyis su dbye ste /
translated: The characteristic of abandonment and the characteristic of realization are twofold:

original: nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba dang / sdug bsngal las rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa las rnam par grol ba dang / sdug bsngal las rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: liberation from the afflictions and liberation from suffering.

original: de la lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: de la lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten zhes bya ba nas /
translated: In this regard, “liberation from the world together with its gods” means

original: lha dang mir bcas pa'i skye dgu'i bar las grol ba ni nyon mongs pa rnams las rnam par thar pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha dang mir bcas pa'i skye dgu'i bar las grol ba ni nyon mongs pa rnams las rnam par thar pa'i phyir ro //
translated: liberation from the world of gods and humans, because one is liberated from the afflictions.

original: de bas na de bye brag tu byed pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba gsungs te //
analyzed: de bas na de bye brag tu byed pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba gsungs te //
translated: Therefore, in order to specify that, “escape” is mentioned.

original: 'di ltar mdo gzhan las nges par 'byung ba gang zhe na gang 'dir 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags 'dul ba dang / 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags spong ba dang / 'dun pa dang 'dod chags las yang @283a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo gzhan las nges par 'byung ba gang zhe na gang 'dir 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags 'dul ba dang / 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags spong ba dang / 'dun pa dang 'dod chags las yang @283a * //
translated: Thus, a sutra declares:🔽What is renunciation? It is the subduing of desire and attachment, the abandonment of desire and attachment, being free from desire and attachment.🔽

original: dag par 'das pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dag par 'das pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, in another sutra, it is said: “What is renunciation? It is the subduing of desire and passion, the abandoning of desire and passion, being completely free from desire and passion, being completely passed beyond desire and passion.

original: de ltar ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bral na //🔽sdug bsngal las kyang rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de ltar ma 'ongs pa'i sdug bsngal mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i nyon mongs pa dang bral na // sdug bsngal las kyang rnam par grol bar 'gyur ro zhes bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir //
translated: Thus, when one is free from the afflictions that bring about the actualization of future suffering,🔽one is also liberated from suffering.

original: bral ba dang rnam par rab tu grol zhes bya ba'i gsungs so //
analyzed: bral ba dang rnam par rab tu grol zhes bya ba'i gsungs so //
translated: In order to make this distinction, it is said: “free and completely liberated.”

original: bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gnyis su dbye ste //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i mtshan nyid rnam par gnyis su dbye ste //
translated: The nature of meditation is twofold:

original: mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam mo /
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam dang / bsgom pa'i lam mo /
translated: the path of seeing and the path of cultivation.

original: de la phyin ci log dang bral ba'i sems kyis zhes bya bas ni mthong ba'i lam ston to //
analyzed: de la phyin ci log dang bral ba'i sems kyis zhes bya bas ni mthong ba'i lam ston to //
translated: Here, the path of seeing is indicated by the phrase “with a mind free from error.”

original: lan mang du gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni bsgom pa'i lam ston to //
analyzed: lan mang du gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'dis ni bsgom pa'i lam ston to //
translated: This shows the path of cultivation.

original: gnas dang gnas pa 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: gnas dang gnas pa 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid ni //
translated: The characteristic of the basis and the based is

original: de kho na'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa 'og ma gong ma'i gnas yin par ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na'i mtshan nyid la sogs pa 'og ma gong ma'i gnas yin par ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the characteristic of reality, etc., because they are the basis of the latter and the based on the former.

original: yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i bar du gcod pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: yongs su shes pa la sogs pa'i bar du gcod pa'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The characteristic of the obstruction to complete understanding, etc., is

original: de ltar gsum du sbyar ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gsum du sbyar ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rnam par mi shes pa'o //
translated: not understanding the three as they are in reality.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid la gzugs la sogs pa 'di dag ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du nyes dmigs la sogs par rnam par dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i mtshan nyid la gzugs la sogs pa 'di dag ji ltar gnas pa bzhin du nyes dmigs la sogs par rnam par dpyod pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of conformity is the investigation of the disadvantages, etc., of these forms, etc., as they are in reality.

original: yongs su mi shes pa las nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid ni mi grol ba na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: yongs su mi shes pa las nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid ni mi grol ba na bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang mi rgya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: The characteristic of disadvantage from complete misunderstanding is non-liberation, up to the non-attainment of unexcelled, perfect enlightenment.

original: de las bzlog pa ni phan yon gyi mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni phan yon gyi mtshan nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of that should be understood as the characteristic of benefit.

original: stobs dang stobs ma yin pa'i sgo ni //
analyzed: stobs dang stobs ma yin pa'i sgo ni //
translated: By way of power and non-power.
