original: gang du tshig gcig ma brjod na don 'di go bar mi 'gyur bas tshig so so thams cad kyi nus pa ston pa ste //
analyzed: gang du tshig gcig ma brjod na don 'di go bar mi 'gyur bas tshig so so thams cad kyi nus pa ston pa ste //
translated: Where, if a single word is not uttered, the meaning is not understood, it shows the power of each word.

original: dper na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mdo las 'di yong bas 'di 'byung //
analyzed: dper na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mdo las 'di yong bas 'di 'byung //
translated: For example, in the Pratītyasamutpāda Sūtra, it says: “Because this exists, that arises.

original: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skyes te //
analyzed: 'di skyes pa'i phyir 'di skyes te //
translated: Because this is produced, that is produced.

original: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnam par shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnam par shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus, with ignorance as a condition, there are formations, consciousness, and so on.

original: tshig 'di dag gis so so'i nus pa ni //
analyzed: tshig 'di dag gis so so'i nus pa ni //
translated: The power of these words

original: ji ltar gong du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid bshad pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gong du rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid bshad pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: should be understood as explained above in the definition of dependent origination.

original: bzlas te brjod pa'i sgo ni gang du mdo'i tshig gcig bzung nas rgya cher don yang dag par ston pa ste //
analyzed: bzlas te brjod pa'i sgo ni gang du mdo'i tshig gcig bzung nas rgya cher don yang dag par ston pa ste //
translated: By way of repetition. Where, having grasped a single phrase of the sūtra, the meaning is extensively and correctly taught.

original: dper na chos drug dang ldan pa'i dge slong ni kha'i dbugs kyis ri'i rgyal po gangs ri yang 'thor na /
analyzed: dper na chos drug dang ldan pa'i dge slong ni kha'i dbugs kyis ri'i rgyal po gangs ri yang 'thor na /
translated: For example, a monk who has six qualities can destroy even the king of mountains, Mount Meru, with the breath from his mouth.

original: ma rig pa bag chags dang bcas pa'i rtsod pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: ma rig pa bag chags dang bcas pa'i rtsod pa lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to mention his destroying the mountain of ignorance along with its propensities?🔽What are the six?

original: drug gang zhe na dge slong dag 'di la dge slong sems bskyed pa la mkhas pa yin pa nas thabs la mkhas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: drug gang zhe na dge slong dag 'di la dge slong sems bskyed pa la mkhas pa yin pa nas thabs la mkhas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Here, monks, a monk is skilled in arousing the mind, and so on up to skilled in means.

original: mdo 'di las bskyed pa dang / gnas pa dang / ldang bar byed pa dang / 'phel ba dang / 'bri @283b ba dang / thabs zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo 'di las bskyed pa dang / gnas pa dang / ldang bar byed pa dang / 'phel ba dang / 'bri @283b ba dang / thabs zhes gsungs so //
translated: In this sutra, arousing, abiding, rising, increasing, decreasing, and means are mentioned.

original: ji ltar na dge slong sems bskyed la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dge slong sems bskyed la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is a monk skilled in arousing the mind?

original: 'di la dge slong ni 'dod pa las dben pa nas /
analyzed: 'di la dge slong ni 'dod pa las dben pa nas /
translated: Here a monk, secluded from desires,🔽and so on up to:

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du rdzogs par byas nas gnas te /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du rdzogs par byas nas gnas te /
translated: he dwells having attained the fourth meditative absorption.

original: de ltar na dge slong sems bskyed pa la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dge slong sems bskyed pa la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: Thus a monk is skilled in arousing the mind.

original: ji ltar na dge slong sems gnas pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar na dge slong sems gnas pa la /
translated: How is a monk skilled in the mind abiding?

original: mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: If he is a wise person,

original: 'di la dge slong ni kun du brten pa'i rgyu'i bar gyis gang nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i bsam gtan de gnas pa'i cha dang mthun par byed de /
analyzed: 'di la dge slong ni kun du brten pa'i rgyu'i bar gyis gang nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i bsam gtan de gnas pa'i cha dang mthun par byed de /
translated: he makes the concentration that is conducive to decline into one that is conducive to stability by means of the causes of complete reliance.

original: de ltar na dge slong gnas pa la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dge slong gnas pa la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: In this way, a monk is skilled in stability.

original: ji ltar na dge slong ldang bar byed pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na /🔽'di la dge slong ni kun du rten rgyus gnas pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i bsam gtan te /
analyzed: ji ltar na dge slong ldang bar byed pa la mkhas pa yin zhe na / 'di la dge slong ni kun du rten rgyus gnas pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i bsam gtan te /
translated: How is a monk skilled in rising?

original: khyad par du gyur pa'i cha dang mthun par byed de /
analyzed: khyad par du gyur pa'i cha dang mthun par byed de /
translated: Here, a monk makes the concentration that is conducive to stability into one that is conducive to distinction by means of the causes of complete reliance.

original: de ltar na dge slong ldang bar byed pa la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dge slong ldang bar byed pa la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: In this way, a monk is skilled in rising.

original: ji ltar na dge slong 'phel ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dge slong 'phel ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is a monk skilled in increase?

original: 'di la dge slong ni /
analyzed: 'di la dge slong ni /
translated: Here, a monk

original: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba yang dag par spong ba gnyis rgya cher byas te /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba yang dag par spong ba gnyis rgya cher byas te /
translated: makes the two perfect abandonments, “the virtuous qualities that have not arisen” and so on, extensive.

original: de ltar na dge slong 'phel ba la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dge slong 'phel ba la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: In this way, a monk is skilled in increase.

original: ji ltar na dge slong 'bri ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dge slong 'bri ba la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is a monk skilled in reducing?🔽Here a monk, having developed the two perfect endeavors,

original: 'di la dge slong ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba yang dag par spong ba gnyis rgyas par byas te /
analyzed: 'di la dge slong ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos ma skyes pa rnams zhes bya ba yang dag par spong ba gnyis rgyas par byas te /
translated: “I will not generate evil, nonvirtuous dharmas that have not yet arisen,” and so on,

original: de ltar na dge slong 'bri ba la mkhas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dge slong 'bri ba la mkhas pa yin no //
translated: in this way a monk is skilled in reducing.

original: ji ltar na dge slong thabs la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dge slong thabs la mkhas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is a monk skilled in means?

original: 'di la dge slong ni 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bsgom mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi rgya cher sbyar te /
analyzed: 'di la dge slong ni 'dun pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bsgom mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi rgya cher sbyar te /
translated: Here a monk cultivates the basis of spiritual power that is concentration of aspiration and the volitional formations that are in accordance with that, and so on, extensively for the four bases of spiritual power.

original: de ltar na dge slong thabs la mkhas pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo //🔽mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo ni //
analyzed: de ltar na dge slong thabs la mkhas pa yin no zhes 'byung ngo // mngon par sgrub pa'i sgo ni //
translated: In this way a monk is skilled in means.

original: gang du tshig ra re la yang mu bzhi sogs par ston pa ste //
analyzed: gang du tshig ra re la yang mu bzhi sogs par ston pa ste //
translated: The four bases of spiritual power are taught in the sutras:🔽The four bases of spiritual power are the basis of spiritual power that is concentration of aspiration and the volitional formations that are in accordance with that, the basis of spiritual power that is concentration of perseverance, the basis of spiritual power that is concentration of mind, and the basis of spiritual power that is concentration of investigation and the volitional formations that are in accordance with that.

original: bzhi pa la sogs pa de dag gi tshig re re la yang /
analyzed: bzhi pa la sogs pa de dag gi tshig re re la yang /
translated: The four bases of spiritual power are taught in the sutras:🔽The basis of spiritual power that is concentration of aspiration and the volitional formations that are in accordance with that, the basis of spiritual power that is concentration of perseverance, the basis of spiritual power that is concentration of mind, and the basis of spiritual power that is concentration of investigation and the volitional formations that are in accordance with that.

original: gzhan bzhi pa la sogs pas thug pa med par mngon par sgrub par rig par bya ste //
analyzed: gzhan bzhi pa la sogs pas thug pa med par mngon par sgrub par rig par bya ste //
translated: The other four and so on are to be known as the infinite means of actualizing the transcendences.

original: dper na sangs rgyas rtsom pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: dper na sangs rgyas rtsom pa'i mdo las /
translated: For example, the Buddha's Activities Sūtra says:

original: bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis byang chub yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: bzhi po 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyis byang chub yongs su sbyong bar byed pa'i chos rnams te /
translated: These four are the things that purify enlightenment for the great bodhisattvas:

original: stong pa nyid bsgom pa dang / sems can thams cad zhe 'gras pa med pa'i sems dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rtag tu @284a * //🔽phan pa nye bar bsgrub pa dang / zang zing med pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa yang dag par rab tu ston pa'o zhes bya ba 'di 'di ni bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don las brtsams te byang chub yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: stong pa nyid bsgom pa dang / sems can thams cad zhe 'gras pa med pa'i sems dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rtag tu @284a * // phan pa nye bar bsgrub pa dang / zang zing med pa'i sems kyis sbyin pa yang dag par rab tu ston pa'o zhes bya ba 'di 'di ni bdag gi don dang gzhan gyi don las brtsams te byang chub yongs su sbyong ba'i phyir /
translated: cultivating emptiness, a nonhostile mind toward all sentient beings, always accomplishing the welfare of the bodhisattvas, and teaching generosity with a mind free of material desires.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs bzhi'i gnyen por rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs bzhi'i gnyen por rig par bya'o //
translated: This is to be known as the antidote to the four opposing factors in the purification of enlightenment, beginning with one's own aim and the aim of others.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs bzhi ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba dang / gnod sems dang / nga rgyal dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la sred pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs bzhi ni snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myang ba dang / gnod sems dang / nga rgyal dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la sred pa'o //
translated: The four unfavorable factors are: relishing the experience of meditative concentration, malice, pride, and craving for gain and honor.

original: rnam grangs gzhan du na chos dang pos ni nyon mongs pa spong ba'i gnyen po bstan to //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan du na chos dang pos ni nyon mongs pa spong ba'i gnyen po bstan to //
translated: In another way, the first verse teaches the antidote to the afflictions.

original: lhag ma rnams kyis ni rgyu gsum gyi theg pa dman pa yongs su spong ba bstan te /
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyis ni rgyu gsum gyi theg pa dman pa yongs su spong ba bstan te /
translated: The remaining verses teach the avoidance of the three causes of the Hinayana.

original: byang chub kyi sems kyis sems can thams cad nye bar 'dzin pa dang / zhugs pa yongs su smin par byed pa dang / ma zhugs pa 'jug par byed pas so //
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems kyis sems can thams cad nye bar 'dzin pa dang / zhugs pa yongs su smin par byed pa dang / ma zhugs pa 'jug par byed pas so //
translated: By the thought of awakening, one embraces all sentient beings; by the practice, one brings to maturity those who are already inclined toward the teaching; and by the teaching, one causes those who are not yet inclined to enter the teaching.

original: rnam grangs gzhan du gcig gis ni ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan du gcig gis ni ye shes kyi tshogs yongs su bstan to //
translated: In another way, one verse teaches the accumulation of wisdom.

original: gsum gyis ni bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su bstan te /
analyzed: gsum gyis ni bsod nams kyi tshogs yongs su bstan te /
translated: Three verses teach the accumulation of merit.

original: nye bar len pa dang / yongs su smin par byed pa dang / 'jug pa rnams re res bsod nams kyi khyad par skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa dang / yongs su smin par byed pa dang / 'jug pa rnams re res bsod nams kyi khyad par skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because each of the four kinds of spiritual practice generates a special kind of merit.

original: yang rgyu gnyis kyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang rgyu gnyis kyis rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the spiritual practice should be understood in terms of two causes:

original: bsam bas ni byams pa'i sems su'o //
analyzed: bsam bas ni byams pa'i sems su'o //
translated: the attitude of loving kindness, and

original: sgrub pas ni thob pa dang lung du nye bar ston par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pas ni thob pa dang lung du nye bar ston par rig par bya'o //
translated: the attainment and teaching of the scriptures.

original: chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid bsgom ste /
analyzed: chos bzhi dang ldan na byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid bsgom ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is endowed with four factors meditates on emptiness:

original: nang du sems rnam par mi rtog pa dang / mos pa la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i stobs skyed pa dang chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du rtog par byed pa dang / sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par thar pa ste /
analyzed: nang du sems rnam par mi rtog pa dang / mos pa la rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i stobs skyed pa dang chos thams cad ji lta ba bzhin du rtog par byed pa dang / sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par thar pa ste /
translated: the inner mind is free from conceptualization, the power of faith is generated, all things are understood as they are, and all obscurations are eliminated.

original: 'di dag gis ni gang la brten nas 'jig rten bsgom pa ste yongs su brten to //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni gang la brten nas 'jig rten bsgom pa ste yongs su brten to //
translated: By means of these four factors, the bodhisattva meditates on emptiness, which is the support of the world.

original: gang la brten nas she na /
analyzed: gang la brten nas she na /
translated: What is the support?

original: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of meditative concentration.

original: ji ltar bsgom zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgom zhe na /
translated: How does he meditate?

original: so so'i skye bo'i lam gyis thos pa dang / bsam pa'i stobs bskyed pa dang / slob pa'i lam dang / mi slob pa'i lam gyis so //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i lam gyis thos pa dang / bsam pa'i stobs bskyed pa dang / slob pa'i lam dang / mi slob pa'i lam gyis so //
translated: The path of the ordinary man by the power of hearing and reflection, the path of the disciple, and the path of the adept.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos bzhi dang ldan na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos bzhi dang ldan na /
translated: The bodhisattva who has four dharmas

original: sems can thams cad la zhe 'gras pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin /
analyzed: sems can thams cad la zhe 'gras pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin /
translated: has a mind free from hostility toward all sentient beings.

original: byams pa bsgom pa dang / sgrub pa la rnam par mi 'khrug pa dang / mtshan ma la rnam par mi rtog pa dang / skyo ba bzod pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa bsgom pa dang / sgrub pa la rnam par mi 'khrug pa dang / mtshan ma la rnam par mi rtog pa dang / skyo ba bzod pa'o //
translated: The cultivation of love, the absence of agitation in practice, the non-discrimination of signs, and the endurance of weariness.

original: 'dir yang gang la @284b brten nas ji ltar zhe 'gras pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin pa de yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir yang gang la @284b brten nas ji ltar zhe 'gras pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin pa de yongs su bstan to //
translated: Here, it is shown on the basis of which and how he has a mind free from hostility.

original: gang la brten nas shes she na /
analyzed: gang la brten nas shes she na /
translated: On the basis of what is it known?

original: tshe rabs snga ma'i byams pa bsgoms pa bsgom pa las so //
analyzed: tshe rabs snga ma'i byams pa bsgoms pa bsgom pa las so //
translated: From the cultivation of love in previous lives.

original: ji ltar zhe 'gras pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin zhe na //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe 'gras pa med pa'i sems dang ldan pa yin zhe na //
translated: How does he have a mind free from hostility?

original: log par bsgrub pa la gnas pa rnams la sems rnam par mi 'khrugs pa dang / gnod par byed pa rnams la gnod par byed ba'i mtshan mar mi rtog pa dang / gzhan la phan pa'i don du rtsol ba la yongs su mi skyo ba'o //🔽byang chub sems dpa' chos bzhi dang ldan na /
analyzed: log par bsgrub pa la gnas pa rnams la sems rnam par mi 'khrugs pa dang / gnod par byed pa rnams la gnod par byed ba'i mtshan mar mi rtog pa dang / gzhan la phan pa'i don du rtsol ba la yongs su mi skyo ba'o // byang chub sems dpa' chos bzhi dang ldan na /
translated: (1) not being upset by those who are wrongly oriented, (2) not conceptualizing the signs of harmfulness toward those who are harmful, and (3) not being discouraged from striving for the benefit of others.🔽The bodhisattva who has four dharmas always benefits the bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rtag tu phan pa nye bar bsgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la rtag tu phan pa nye bar bsgrub pa yin te /
translated: What are the four?

original: gang yongs su 'jal ba dang / yang dag pa'i gdams pa la 'jug pa dang // des shing 'grogs na bde ba dang / mchod pa dang rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang / bsnyen bkur byas pa nye bar bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: gang yongs su 'jal ba dang / yang dag pa'i gdams pa la 'jug pa dang // des shing 'grogs na bde ba dang / mchod pa dang rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang / bsnyen bkur byas pa nye bar bsgrub pa'o //
translated: (1) He is not greedy for gain and honor. (2) He is not a betrayer of secrets. (3) He is not a braggart. (4) He is not a flatterer.

original: 'dir yang gang la brten nas ji ltar bsgrub pa de yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir yang gang la brten nas ji ltar bsgrub pa de yongs su bstan to //
translated: Here, it is shown on the basis of what and how one practices.

original: gang la brten nas she na /
analyzed: gang la brten nas she na /
translated: On the basis of what?

original: nga rgyal bcag pa la'o //
analyzed: nga rgyal bcag pa la'o //
translated: On the basis of the destruction of pride.

original: ji ltar nye bar bsgrub ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar nye bar bsgrub ce na /
translated: How does one practice?

original: ji skad bstan pa rnams la gsum gyis dman pa dang / 'bring po dang / khyad par du 'phags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa rnams la gsum gyis dman pa dang / 'bring po dang / khyad par du 'phags pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams la go rims bzhin no //
translated: The three types of bodhisattvas are those who are inferior, middling, and superior with regard to the teachings that have been presented.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chos bzhi dang ldan na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chos bzhi dang ldan na /
translated: A bodhisattva who possesses four qualities

original: zang zing med pa'i sems kyis chos kyi sbyin pa yang dag par rab tu ston to //
analyzed: zang zing med pa'i sems kyis chos kyi sbyin pa yang dag par rab tu ston to //
translated: teaches the gift of the Dharma with a mind free of material desire.

original: bar du gcod pas legs par rab tu rtog pa dang / rmongs pa dang / bying ba sel ba la mkhas pa dang / yid bde ba nye bar sgrub pa dang / mgon med pa'i chos la dga' ba'o //🔽'dir yang gang la brten nas /
analyzed: bar du gcod pas legs par rab tu rtog pa dang / rmongs pa dang / bying ba sel ba la mkhas pa dang / yid bde ba nye bar sgrub pa dang / mgon med pa'i chos la dga' ba'o // 'dir yang gang la brten nas /
translated: He or she is skilled in the means of dispelling the obstacles, confusion, and dispiritedness that arise in others; he or she is skilled in the means of producing a sense of spiritual pleasure in others; and he or she delights in the Dharma that is free of any protector.

original: ji ltar yang dag par rab tu ston pa de yongs su bstan to//
analyzed: ji ltar yang dag par rab tu ston pa de yongs su bstan to//
translated: Here, it should be understood that the manner in which the bodhisattva teaches the gift of the Dharma with a mind free of material desire is revealed by the very fact that he or she possesses these four qualities.

original: gang la brten nas she na /
analyzed: gang la brten nas she na /
translated: What is the basis for this teaching?🔽What is the manner in which the gift of the Dharma is taught?

original: rnyed pa dang / bkur stis bar du gcod par byed pa nyid du legs par rtogs pa la'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang / bkur stis bar du gcod par byed pa nyid du legs par rtogs pa la'o //
translated: The basis for this teaching is the understanding that material gain and honor constitute an obstacle.

original: ji ltar yang dag par rab tu ston ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar yang dag par rab tu ston ce na /
translated: The manner in which the gift of the Dharma is taught is as follows.

original: rmongs pa med pa rnams la yang dag par rab tu ston pa dang / bag med pa la chags pa dang / bdag dman par 'dzin pas zhum pa rnams las yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: rmongs pa med pa rnams la yang dag par rab tu ston pa dang / bag med pa la chags pa dang / bdag dman par 'dzin pas zhum pa rnams las yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa dang / yang dag par gzengs bstod pa dang yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la yang dag par rab tu dga' bar byed pa dang /
translated: and for those who are not confused, he teaches them correctly; he encourages those who are attached to heedlessness and who are discouraged by the thought that they are inferior; he extols those who are correctly engaged; and he delights those who are correctly settled.

original: rang bzhin gyis chos la dga' bas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis chos la dga' bas so //
translated: He does this because he naturally loves the Dharma.

original: de ltar bzhi pa gzhan ni bzhi pa dang po'i tshig rab tu dbye ba la mngon par bsgrub par rig par bya'o //🔽rab tu @285a * //🔽phye nas kun du bstan pa rnam nges gang //
analyzed: de ltar bzhi pa gzhan ni bzhi pa dang po'i tshig rab tu dbye ba la mngon par bsgrub par rig par bya'o // rab tu @285a * // phye nas kun du bstan pa rnam nges gang //
translated: Thus, the fourth is to be known as the accomplishment of the analysis of the terms of the first tetrad.🔽The analysis of the teaching is the analysis of the teaching of the four noble truths.

original: ji skad du bstan pa'i chos rnams la ci rigs su sbyar te //
analyzed: ji skad du bstan pa'i chos rnams la ci rigs su sbyar te //
translated: The analysis of the teaching is the analysis of the teaching of the four noble truths.🔽The analysis of the teaching is the analysis of the teaching of the four noble truths.

original: gcig nas rtog pa dang / tshig gong ma dang sbyong ba dang // tshig 'og ma dang sbyor ba dang / mu gnyis pa dang / mu gsum pa dang / mu bzhi pa dang / de de bzhin no zhes bya ba dang spong ba'o //
analyzed: gcig nas rtog pa dang / tshig gong ma dang sbyong ba dang // tshig 'og ma dang sbyor ba dang / mu gnyis pa dang / mu gsum pa dang / mu bzhi pa dang / de de bzhin no zhes bya ba dang spong ba'o //
translated: 1. the question of one by one, 2. the question of the preceding word, 3. the question of the following word, 4. the question of the two alternatives, 5. the question of the three alternatives, 6. the question of the four alternatives, 7. the question of “so it is,” and 8. the question of “it is not so.”

original: rab tu phye nas kun du bstan pa rnam par nges pa ni /
analyzed: rab tu phye nas kun du bstan pa rnam par nges pa ni /
translated: The determination of the exposition of the analysis is as follows:

original: ji skad du bstan pa'i phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams la gcig nas rtog pa la sogs pa ci rigs su sbyar ro //🔽de la gcig nas rtog pa zhes bya ba'i dri ba ni gang gis chos gcig chos lhag ma gzhan rnams dang lhan cig tu re re nas dris nas de bor te /
analyzed: ji skad du bstan pa'i phung po la sogs pa'i chos rnams la gcig nas rtog pa la sogs pa ci rigs su sbyar ro // de la gcig nas rtog pa zhes bya ba'i dri ba ni gang gis chos gcig chos lhag ma gzhan rnams dang lhan cig tu re re nas dris nas de bor te /
translated: The aggregates, etc., which are taught should be analyzed one by one, etc., as appropriate.

original: des gnyis pa yang gzhan rnams dang lhan cig tu 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: des gnyis pa yang gzhan rnams dang lhan cig tu 'dri ba'o //
translated: Therein, the question of one by one is as follows: By means of which one dharma, one asks, is each of the remaining dharmas questioned one by one, and then that one is set aside, and by means of the second one, the second is questioned together with the others, and so on.

original: de bzhin du re re nas thams cad dri ba ste /🔽dper na gang mig gi skye mched dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du re re nas thams cad dri ba ste / dper na gang mig gi skye mched dang ldan pa ste /
translated: In the same way, each one is questioned one by one.

original: gzugs kyi skye mched dang yang ldan nam /
analyzed: gzugs kyi skye mched dang yang ldan nam /
translated: For example, “Whoever possesses the eye faculty, does he also possess the form faculty?

original: gang gzugs kyi skye mched dang ldan pa de mig gi skye mched dang yang ldan nam zhes bya ba ni tshig gong ma dang sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gang gzugs kyi skye mched dang ldan pa de mig gi skye mched dang yang ldan nam zhes bya ba ni tshig gong ma dang sbyor ba'o //
translated: The phrase one who possesses the form base also possesses the eye base is connected to the previous phrase.

original: gang mig gi skye mched dang ldan pa de rna ba'i skye mched dang yang ldan nam zhes bya ba 'di la mu bzhi'o //
analyzed: gang mig gi skye mched dang ldan pa de rna ba'i skye mched dang yang ldan nam zhes bya ba 'di la mu bzhi'o //
translated: The phrase one who possesses the eye base also possesses the ear base has four possibilities.

original: de bzhin du yid kyi skye mched dang yang ldan zhes bya ba'i bar du 'di ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yid kyi skye mched dang yang ldan zhes bya ba'i bar du 'di ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the phrase also possesses the mental base is connected to this in the appropriate manner.

original: de chos kyi skye mched dang yang ldan nam zhes bya ba 'di tshig gong ma dang sbyor ba'o //🔽gzugs kyi skye mched dang yang ldan pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de chos kyi skye mched dang yang ldan nam zhes bya ba 'di tshig gong ma dang sbyor ba'o // gzugs kyi skye mched dang yang ldan pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The phrase also possesses the phenomena base is connected to the previous phrase.

original: mig gi skye mched dang yang ldan nam /
analyzed: mig gi skye mched dang yang ldan nam /
translated: One who possesses the form base also possesses the eye base.

original: gang mig gi skye mched dang ldan pa de gzugs kyi skye mched dang yang ldan na zhes bya ba 'di ni tshig 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: gang mig gi skye mched dang ldan pa de gzugs kyi skye mched dang yang ldan na zhes bya ba 'di ni tshig 'og ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: One who possesses the eye base also possesses the form base is connected to the following phrase.

original: gang gzugs kyi skye mched dang ldan pa de ni rna ba'i skye mched dang yang ldan nam zhes bya ba 'di yang tshig 'og ma dang sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: gang gzugs kyi skye mched dang ldan pa de ni rna ba'i skye mched dang yang ldan nam zhes bya ba 'di yang tshig 'og ma dang sbyar ba'o //
translated: The phrase “One who possesses the visible-form base also possesses the ear base” is connected to the next line.

original: de bzhin du chos kyi skye mched dang yang ldan nam zhes ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o //🔽gang rna ba'i skye mched dang ldan pa de mig gi skye mched dang yang ldan nam zhes bya ba 'di la mu bzhi'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi skye mched dang yang ldan nam zhes ci rigs su sbyar bar bya'o // gang rna ba'i skye mched dang ldan pa de mig gi skye mched dang yang ldan nam zhes bya ba 'di la mu bzhi'o //
translated: Similarly, the phrase “One who possesses the visible-form base also possesses the mental-object base” is connected to the next line.🔽The phrase “One who possesses the ear base also possesses the eye base” has four possibilities.

original: de bzhin du chos kyi skye mched kyi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi skye mched kyi bar du yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the phrase “One who possesses the ear base also possesses the mental-object base” has four possibilities.

original: de ltar re re nas brtsams pa'i tshul gyis skye mched thams cad phan tshun du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar re re nas brtsams pa'i tshul gyis skye mched thams cad phan tshun du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In this way, all the bases should be mutually connected by beginning with each one.

original: tshig 'og ma dang sbyar ba gnyis pa ni /
analyzed: tshig 'og ma dang sbyar ba gnyis pa ni /
translated: The second type of connection is

original: chos 'ga' zhig la brtsams nas phan tshun 'dri na /
analyzed: chos 'ga' zhig la brtsams nas phan tshun 'dri na /
translated: when one begins with some phenomenon and asks a question about it.

original: chos gong ma la brten nas gang lung ston pa ste /
analyzed: chos gong ma la brten nas gang lung ston pa ste /
translated: The answer is based on the preceding phenomenon.

original: dper na shes pa gang @285b yin pa shes bya de 'am zhes bya ba gang yin pa shes pa'ang zhes bya ba de tshig gong ma dang sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: dper na shes pa gang @285b yin pa shes bya de 'am zhes bya ba gang yin pa shes pa'ang zhes bya ba de tshig gong ma dang sbyor ba ste /
translated: For example, “Whatever is consciousness is also an object of consciousness” is a question that is connected to the previous statement.

original: shes pa gang yin pa shes bya 'ang de yin no //
analyzed: shes pa gang yin pa shes bya 'ang de yin no //
translated: Whatever is consciousness is also an object of consciousness.

original: shes bya yid la shes pa ma yin pa'ang yod de /
analyzed: shes bya yid la shes pa ma yin pa'ang yod de /
translated: There is an object of consciousness that is not consciousness,

original: de las gzhan pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: namely, all phenomena other than consciousness.

original: tshig 'og ma dang sbyor ba ni de bzhin du gnyis gnyis dris pa la gang phyi ma la brten nas gang du lung ston pa ste /🔽dper na gzung ba gang yin pa 'dzin pa'ang de 'am /
analyzed: tshig 'og ma dang sbyor ba ni de bzhin du gnyis gnyis dris pa la gang phyi ma la brten nas gang du lung ston pa ste / dper na gzung ba gang yin pa 'dzin pa'ang de 'am /
translated: “Whatever is consciousness is also an object of consciousness” is a question that is connected to the following statement.

original: 'dzin pa gang yin pa gzung ba'ang de 'am zhes bya ba ni tshig 'og ma dang sbyor ba ste //
analyzed: 'dzin pa gang yin pa gzung ba'ang de 'am zhes bya ba ni tshig 'og ma dang sbyor ba ste //
translated: For example, “Whatever is apprehended is also an apprehender” or “Whatever is an apprehender is also an apprehended object” is a question that is connected to the following statement.

original: 'dzin pa gang yin pa gzung ba'ang de'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa gang yin pa gzung ba'ang de'o //
translated: Whatever is an apprehender is also an apprehended object.

original: gzung ba yin pa la 'dzin pa ma yin pa'ang yod de //
analyzed: gzung ba yin pa la 'dzin pa ma yin pa'ang yod de //
translated: There is an apprehended object that is not an apprehender,🔽namely, all phenomena other than an apprehender.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga po de dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma gtogs pa'i chos kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul lnga po de dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma gtogs pa'i chos kyi skye mched do //
translated: The sense-sphere of factors is the five sense-objects, visible form, etc., and the factors not associated with thought.

original: mu gnyis pa ni gang du mu gnyis ston pa ste //
analyzed: mu gnyis pa ni gang du mu gnyis ston pa ste //
translated: The second alternative is where two alternatives are taught.

original: de bas gzhan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas gzhan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is nothing other than those two.

original: dper na phung po rnam par gzhag pa dang / khams rnam par gzhag pa la brten nas brjod pa ste /🔽phung po'i grangs gang yin pa de khams kyang de 'am //
analyzed: dper na phung po rnam par gzhag pa dang / khams rnam par gzhag pa la brten nas brjod pa ste / phung po'i grangs gang yin pa de khams kyang de 'am //
translated: For example, it is said in dependence on the presentation of the aggregates and the presentation of the elements:🔽Are the aggregates the same in number as the elements?🔽Or are the elements the same in number as the aggregates?

original: khams kyi grangs gang yin pa phung po'i grangs kyang de 'am zhes bya ba ni mu gnyis te //
analyzed: khams kyi grangs gang yin pa phung po'i grangs kyang de 'am zhes bya ba ni mu gnyis te //
translated: This is the second alternative.

original: phung po'i grangs yin la khams kyi grang ma yin pa'ang yod de //
analyzed: phung po'i grangs yin la khams kyi grang ma yin pa'ang yod de //
translated: There are aggregates that are not elements.

original: gzugs kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
translated: The form aggregate and the consciousness aggregate.

original: 'di ltar gzugs kyi phung po'i mtshan nyid mtha' dag gam /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs kyi phung po'i mtshan nyid mtha' dag gam /
translated: Because the entire characteristic of the form aggregate

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i mtshan nyid mtha' dag khams gcig tu gyur pa med do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po'i mtshan nyid mtha' dag khams gcig tu gyur pa med do //
translated: or the entire characteristic of the consciousness aggregate is not included in one element.

original: khams kyi grangs yin la /
analyzed: khams kyi grangs yin la /
translated: There is a fourth alternative that is neither.

original: phung po'i grangs ma yin pa'ang yod de /
analyzed: phung po'i grangs ma yin pa'ang yod de /
translated: There is a fourth alternative that is neither.

original: chos kyi khams so //
analyzed: chos kyi khams so //
translated: The element of mental objects is the fourth alternative.

original: mu gsum pa ni gang du mu gsum kho na ston pa ste /
analyzed: mu gsum pa ni gang du mu gsum kho na ston pa ste /
translated: The third alternative is where only three alternatives are taught.

original: dper na phung po'i grang gang yin pa skye mched kyi grangs kyang de 'am zhes bya ba ni mu gsum pa ste /🔽phung po'i grangs yin la skye mched kyi grangs ma yin pa yang yod de /🔽gzugs kyi phung po'i //
analyzed: dper na phung po'i grang gang yin pa skye mched kyi grangs kyang de 'am zhes bya ba ni mu gsum pa ste / phung po'i grangs yin la skye mched kyi grangs ma yin pa yang yod de / gzugs kyi phung po'i //
translated: For example, “Is the number of aggregates the same as the number of sense spheres?”🔽There is a fourth alternative that is neither.

original: skye mched kyi grangs yin la phung po'i grangs ma yin pa'ang yod de /🔽chos kyi skye mched do //🔽phung po'i grangs kyang yin la skye mched kyi grangs kyang yin pa'ang yod de //
analyzed: skye mched kyi grangs yin la phung po'i grangs ma yin pa'ang yod de / chos kyi skye mched do // phung po'i grangs kyang yin la skye mched kyi grangs kyang yin pa'ang yod de //
translated: The aggregate of form is the fourth alternative.🔽The sense sphere of mental objects is the fourth alternative.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang yid kyi skye mched do //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po dang yid kyi skye mched do //
translated: The aggregate of consciousness and the sense sphere of the mental faculty are the fourth alternative.

original: de gnyi ga ma yin pa'i grangs ni phung po dang skye mched la med do //
analyzed: de gnyi ga ma yin pa'i grangs ni phung po dang skye mched la med do //
translated: There is no fourth alternative that is neither of the two.

original: mu bzhi pa ni gang du mi bzhi ston pa ste //
analyzed: mu bzhi pa ni gang du mi bzhi ston pa ste //
translated: The fourth alternative is where four alternatives are taught.

original: mig gi dbang po dang ldan pa de'am //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po dang ldan pa de'am //
translated: He is endowed with the eye faculty.

original: rna ba'i dbang po dang ldan pa mig gi dbang po dang ldan pa @286a * //
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po dang ldan pa mig gi dbang po dang ldan pa @286a * //
translated: He is endowed with the ear faculty and the eye faculty.

original: de'am zhes bya ba mu bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: de'am zhes bya ba mu bzhi pa ste /
translated: There are four alternatives.

original: mu dang po ni mig skyes shing ma nyams pa la 'on pa'o //
analyzed: mu dang po ni mig skyes shing ma nyams pa la 'on pa'o //
translated: The first alternative is the one who is born blind but whose eyes have not been destroyed.

original: mu gnyis pa ni rna ba skyes shing ma nyams pa la long ba'o //🔽mu gsum pa ni mig dang rna ba skyes pa la ma nyams pa'o //
analyzed: mu gnyis pa ni rna ba skyes shing ma nyams pa la long ba'o // mu gsum pa ni mig dang rna ba skyes pa la ma nyams pa'o //
translated: The second alternative is the one who is born deaf but whose ears have not been destroyed.🔽The third alternative is the one who is born with both eyes and ears and whose eyes and ears have not been destroyed.

original: mu bzhi ba'i ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mu bzhi ba'i ni rnam pa de dag ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The fourth alternative is the one who is born with eyes and ears but whose eyes and ears have been destroyed.

original: de de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gang du dris pa lung bstan pa la de de bzhin no zhes brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni gang du dris pa lung bstan pa la de de bzhin no zhes brjod pa ste /
translated: “It is just so” means that when a question is asked and an answer is given, one says “it is just so.”

original: de de bzhin no zhes khas len zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽dper na gang dag mi rtag pa de thams cad 'du byed yin nam /
analyzed: de de bzhin no zhes khas len zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // dper na gang dag mi rtag pa de thams cad 'du byed yin nam /
translated: It means “I agree that it is just so.”🔽For example, when asked “Are all impermanent things conditioned?

original: 'du byed gang yin pa de thams cad mi rtag pa'am zhes dris pa la de bzhin no zhes bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'du byed gang yin pa de thams cad mi rtag pa'am zhes dris pa la de bzhin no zhes bstan par bya'o //
translated: Are all conditioned things impermanent?” one should answer “it is just so.”

original: spang ba ni gang du ma yin zhes spangs pa ste /
analyzed: spang ba ni gang du ma yin zhes spangs pa ste /
translated: Abandonment is the denial of something that does not exist.

original: dper na phung po la ma gtogs pa'i 'du byed rnams bden pa gang dag gis bsdus zhes zer ba la /
analyzed: dper na phung po la ma gtogs pa'i 'du byed rnams bden pa gang dag gis bsdus zhes zer ba la /
translated: For example, when it is asked, “Are the formations not included in the aggregates included in any of the truths?

original: phung po las ma gtogs pa'i 'du byed dag med do zhes spong ba'o //
analyzed: phung po las ma gtogs pa'i 'du byed dag med do zhes spong ba'o //
translated: ” it is denied that there are any formations not included in the aggregates.

original: yang dag par dri ba rnam nges gang /
analyzed: yang dag par dri ba rnam nges gang /
translated: What is the determination of a correct question?

original: rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: It is of eight types:

original: ci zhes brjod pa yang dag par dri ba rnam nges dang / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ci zhes brjod pa yang dag par dri ba rnam nges dang / 'di lta ste /
translated: The determination of a correct question is the question “What is this?”

original: su zhig mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: su zhig mi dmigs she na /
translated: Who does not perceive?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who has attained the perfection of wisdom.🔽What does he not perceive?

original: ci mi dmigs she na gzung ba'i mtshan nyid dang / 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ci mi dmigs she na gzung ba'i mtshan nyid dang / 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristics of the apprehended and the characteristics of the apprehender.

original: gang gis ni mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: gang gis ni mi dmigs she na /
translated: By what means does he not perceive?

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas so //
translated: By the perfection of wisdom.

original: ci'i phyir mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi dmigs she na /
translated: Why does he not perceive?

original: sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su bskyab pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to protect all sentient beings and to attain supreme enlightenment.

original: gang las mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: gang las mi dmigs she na /
translated: From what is there non-apprehension?

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba mnyes par byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub pa las so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba mnyes par byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang / chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos bsgrub pa las so //
translated: From the appearance of the Buddha, from listening to the true Dharma, from proper attention, and from the practice of the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma.

original: gang gis mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: gang gis mi dmigs she na /
translated: By what means is there non-apprehension?

original: chos thams cad kyi'o /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi'o /
translated: By the means of all dharmas.

original: gang du mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: gang du mi dmigs she na /
translated: Where is there non-apprehension?

original: mos pa spyad pa'i sa nas sa bcu'i bar du'o //
analyzed: mos pa spyad pa'i sa nas sa bcu'i bar du'o //
translated: From the stage of action in faith up to the tenth stage.

original: rnam pa du zhig gis mi dmigs she na /
analyzed: rnam pa du zhig gis mi dmigs she na /
translated: By how many kinds of non-apprehension is there non-apprehension?

original: rnam pa bcu gcig ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gcig ste /
translated: By eleven kinds.

original: skyes nas 'gag pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / rgyu'i stobs las byung ba dang / mdza' bo'i stobs las byung ba dang / chos thams cad mi dmigs pa dang / stong ba nyid mi dmigs pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang bcas pa dang /
analyzed: skyes nas 'gag pa dang / ma skyes pa dang / mngon du gyur pa dang / rgyu'i stobs las byung ba dang / mdza' bo'i stobs las byung ba dang / chos thams cad mi dmigs pa dang / stong ba nyid mi dmigs pa dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang bcas pa dang /
translated: that which has arisen and ceased, that which has not arisen, that which is manifest, that which has arisen from the power of a cause, that which has arisen from the power of a friend, that which is the non-apprehension of all dharmas, that which is the non-apprehension of emptiness, that which is accompanied by the pride of thinking “I am”,

original: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal med pa dang / tshogs ma bsags pa dang / tshogs @286b bsags pa'o //
analyzed: nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal med pa dang / tshogs ma bsags pa dang / tshogs @286b bsags pa'o //
translated: that which is not accompanied by the pride of thinking “I am”, that which is not accumulated, and that which is accumulated.

original: mi dmigs pa 'di dag ni gang ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa 'di dag ni gang ci yang rung ste /
translated: These non-apprehensions are whatever they may be.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / nang dang / phyi'i dang / rags pa dang / phra ba dang / ngan pa dang / bzang po dang / rgyang ring ba dang / thag nye ba zhes bya ba 'di dag gi go rims kyi tshul gyis blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba dang / nang dang / phyi'i dang / rags pa dang / phra ba dang / ngan pa dang / bzang po dang / rgyang ring ba dang / thag nye ba zhes bya ba 'di dag gi go rims kyi tshul gyis blta bar bya'o //
translated: They should be seen in the order in which they are mentioned, as past, future, and present, internal and external, gross and subtle, inferior and superior, distant and near.

original: ci brjod pa la ji lta bar gang brjod pa la'ang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: ci brjod pa la ji lta bar gang brjod pa la'ang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Just as it is with what is expressed, so it is with the expression.

original: gang zhig mi dmigs pa dang / gang dang gang gis dang / gang gi phyir dang / gang las dang gang gi dang / gang du mi dmigs pa dang / ji snyed cig mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig mi dmigs pa dang / gang dang gang gis dang / gang gi phyir dang / gang las dang gang gi dang / gang du mi dmigs pa dang / ji snyed cig mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: What is not perceived, by what, for what reason, from what, with what, where, and to what extent is it not perceived?

original: yang rnam nges kyi lam bzhi ste /🔽sun 'byin par byed pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang rnam nges kyi lam bzhi ste / sun 'byin par byed pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: There are four paths of ascertainment:

original: sun 'byin par byed pa dang / sgrub par byed pa dang / gcod par byed pa dang / khong du chud par byed pa'o //🔽de la sun 'byin par byed pa ni /
analyzed: sun 'byin par byed pa dang / sgrub par byed pa dang / gcod par byed pa dang / khong du chud par byed pa'o // de la sun 'byin par byed pa ni /
translated: refutation, proof, division, and understanding.

original: gzhan gyi phyogs nyes par smras pa'ang 'di legs pa ma yin no zhes rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs nyes par smras pa'ang 'di legs pa ma yin no zhes rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: Refutation is the analysis of the faults of others' positions, saying, This is not good.

original: sgrub par byed pa ni rang gi phyogs legs par smras pa la 'di ni legs pa'o zhes rjod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa ni rang gi phyogs legs par smras pa la 'di ni legs pa'o zhes rjod par byed pa'o //
translated: Proof is the statement, This is good, regarding one's own position that is well-spoken.

original: gcod par byed pa ni gzhan dag gis the tshom skyes pa'am ma skyes pa la rnam par nges par 'byin par byed pa'o //🔽khong du chud par byed pa ni /
analyzed: gcod par byed pa ni gzhan dag gis the tshom skyes pa'am ma skyes pa la rnam par nges par 'byin par byed pa'o //🔽khong du chud par byed pa ni /
translated: Division is the ascertainment of what has arisen or not arisen in others through doubt.🔽Understanding is the ascertainment of what is well-spoken by others.

original: don de dang de dag la rmongs pa rnams la don de ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: don de dang de dag la rmongs pa rnams la don de ston par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the teaching of the meaning of the ten subjects to those who are confused about those subjects.

original: bsdu ba rnam nges gang /
analyzed: bsdu ba rnam nges gang /
translated: What is the Ascertainment of the Collections?

original: gnas bcu'i rnam nges bsdus par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas bcu'i rnam nges bsdus par 'gyur te /
translated: It is the ascertainment of the ten subjects.

original: gnas bcu gang bya ba bsgrub pa rnam nges dang / 'jug pa'i rnam nges dang / mos pa rnam nges dang / rig pa rnam nges dang / yang dag pa'i gtam rnam nges dang / rab tu rtogs pas rnam nges dang / rnam par dag pas rnam nges dang /
analyzed: gnas bcu gang bya ba bsgrub pa rnam nges dang / 'jug pa'i rnam nges dang / mos pa rnam nges dang / rig pa rnam nges dang / yang dag pa'i gtam rnam nges dang / rab tu rtogs pas rnam nges dang / rnam par dag pas rnam nges dang /
translated: The ten subjects are: the ascertainment of the accomplishment of action, the ascertainment of engagement, the ascertainment of aspiration, the ascertainment of knowledge, the ascertainment of right speech, the ascertainment of full understanding, the ascertainment of purification,

original: mngon par bsgrub pas rnam nges dang / tshig rab tu dbye bas rnam nges dang / lhun gyis grub pa dang rtsol ba tsam gyis don thams cad 'grub pa rnam nges so //
analyzed: mngon par bsgrub pas rnam nges dang / tshig rab tu dbye bas rnam nges dang / lhun gyis grub pa dang rtsol ba tsam gyis don thams cad 'grub pa rnam nges so //
translated: the ascertainment of realization, the ascertainment of the differentiation of words, and the ascertainment of the accomplishment of all goals by mere effort without premeditation.

original: de la bya ba bsgrub pa rnam nges gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bya ba bsgrub pa rnam nges gang zhe na /
translated: What is the ascertainment of the accomplishment of action?

original: 'jig rten phan tshun du 'tsho ba'i thabs la sogs pa'i dgos pa bsgrub pa'o ;
analyzed: 'jig rten phan tshun du 'tsho ba'i thabs la sogs pa'i dgos pa bsgrub pa'o ;
translated: It is the accomplishment of the necessities of life by means of mutual commerce.

original: /'jug pa rnam nges gang zhe na /
analyzed: /'jug pa rnam nges gang zhe na /
translated: What is the ascertainment of engagement?

original: theg pa gsum po dag las shes pa gang la 'jug par bya zhing gzhug par bya zhes rnam par dpyad pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa gsum po dag las shes pa gang la 'jug par bya zhing gzhug par bya zhes rnam par dpyad pa'o //
translated: It is the analysis of the three Vehicles, namely, the Vehicle of the Listeners, the Vehicle of the Self-Buddhas and the Great Vehicle.

original: mos pa rnam par nges pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mos pa rnam par nges pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the certainty of devotion?

original: thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis ji ltar thob pa bzhin du yid ches pa'o //🔽rig pa rnam par @287a * //
analyzed: thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis ji ltar thob pa bzhin du yid ches pa'o // rig pa rnam par @287a * //
translated: It is the certainty of faith in the Teaching as it has been acquired through the wisdom born of listening.

original: nges pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: nges pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the certainty of knowledge?

original: bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis snga phyi'i dgongs pa yongs su 'jal ba'o //
analyzed: bsams pa las byung ba'i shes rab kyis snga phyi'i dgongs pa yongs su 'jal ba'o //
translated: It is the certainty of knowledge of the successive stages of devotion through the wisdom born of reflection.

original: yang dag pa'i gtam gyi rnam nges gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i gtam gyi rnam nges gang zhe na /
translated: What is the certainty of right speech?

original: ji ltar thos pa dang bsam pa rnams dri ba dang / phyir 'dri bar bya ba'i tshul gyis phan tshun chos la rdzogs par longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar thos pa dang bsam pa rnams dri ba dang / phyir 'dri bar bya ba'i tshul gyis phan tshun chos la rdzogs par longs spyod pa'o //
translated: It is the mutual enjoyment of the Teaching through questions and answers concerning what has been acquired through listening and reflection.

original: rab tu rtogs pas rnam nges gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab tu rtogs pas rnam nges gang zhe na /
translated: What is the certainty of complete understanding?

original: mthong ba'i lam ste des bden par rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam ste des bden par rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the Path of Seeing, because it is the direct realization of the Truths.

original: rnam par dag pas rnam par nges pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par dag pas rnam par nges pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the certainty of purification?

original: bsgom pa'i lam ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam ste /
translated: It is the Path of Development, because it is the purification of the Path.

original: de nyon mongs pa ma lus par spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyon mongs pa ma lus par spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it eliminates all the defilements without exception.

original: mngon par bsgrub pas rnam par nges pa ni khyad par can gyi lam ste des yon tan khyad par can mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par bsgrub pas rnam par nges pa ni khyad par can gyi lam ste des yon tan khyad par can mngon par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As for the determination through realization, it is the special path, because it is the realization of special qualities.

original: tshig rab tu dbye bas rnam nges gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshig rab tu dbye bas rnam nges gang zhe na /
translated: What is the determination through the analysis of words?

original: gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i sgo nas chos ston pa mtha' yas so //
analyzed: gnyis pa dang / gsum pa dang / bzhi pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa mngon par bsgrub pa'i sgo nas chos ston pa mtha' yas so //
translated: It is the teaching of the Dharma through the analysis of the second, third, fourth, etc.,

original: lhun gyis grub pa dang rtsol ba tsam gyis don thams cad 'grub pa rnam nges gang zhe na /
analyzed: lhun gyis grub pa dang rtsol ba tsam gyis don thams cad 'grub pa rnam nges gang zhe na /
translated: What is the determination through spontaneous and effortless accomplishment of all actions?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes te /
translated: It is the knowledge of the Tathagata.

original: sngon gyi rtsol ba med par yang don thams cad la rtsol ba med la chags pa med pa dang thogs pa med pa'i ye shes mthong pa med pa'i ye shes mthong ba la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi rtsol ba med par yang don thams cad la rtsol ba med la chags pa med pa dang thogs pa med pa'i ye shes mthong pa med pa'i ye shes mthong ba la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the spontaneous and effortless accomplishment of all actions, because it is the entry into the knowledge-perception of the Tathagata which is unobstructed and unimpeded with regard to all things.

original: smra ba rnam nges dang / smra ba dang / smra ba'i zhal ce ba dang / smra ba'i gzhi dang / smra ba'i rgyan dang / smra ba la chad pas bcad pa dang / smra ba las byung ba dang / smra ba las gces spras byed pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: smra ba rnam nges dang / smra ba dang / smra ba'i zhal ce ba dang / smra ba'i gzhi dang / smra ba'i rgyan dang / smra ba la chad pas bcad pa dang / smra ba las byung ba dang / smra ba las gces spras byed pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: 1. the definition of speech, 2. speech, 3. the judge of speech, 4. the basis of speech, 5. the ornament of speech, 6. the punishment for bad speech, 7. the origin of speech, 8. the rules for the practice of speech.

original: smra ba'i zhal ce ba la sogs pa la mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: smra ba'i zhal ce ba la sogs pa la mkhas pa ni /
translated: The skill in the judge of speech, etc.

original: smra ba rnam par nges par brjod do //
analyzed: smra ba rnam par nges par brjod do //
translated: is called the definition of speech.

original: de la smra ba gang /
analyzed: de la smra ba gang /
translated: What is speech?

original: smra ba dang / rmad khyer ba smra ba dang ; rtsod pa smra ba dang / tshig ngan pa smra ba dang / mthun par smra ba dang / gdams par smra'o //
analyzed: smra ba dang / rmad khyer ba smra ba dang ; rtsod pa smra ba dang / tshig ngan pa smra ba dang / mthun par smra ba dang / gdams par smra'o //
translated: Speech is of eight kinds: 1) speech, 2) idle speech, 3) argumentative speech, 4) harsh speech, 5) flattering speech, 6) instructive speech.

original: de la smra ba ni tshig brjod pa thams cad do //🔽rmad khyer ba smra ba ni 'jig rten na grags pa'o //
analyzed: de la smra ba ni tshig brjod pa thams cad do // rmad khyer ba smra ba ni 'jig rten na grags pa'o //
translated: Speech is all vocal sound.🔽Idle speech is what is commonly known as idle talk.

original: 'jig rten na rnam par smra ba ni rmad khyer bar smra ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten na rnam par smra ba ni rmad khyer bar smra ba'o //
translated: In the world, idle talk is called idle speech.

original: rtsod pas smra ba ni phan tshun mi mthun par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pas smra ba ni phan tshun mi mthun par gnas pa'o //
translated: Argumentative speech is the mutual contradiction of adversaries.

original: gang zhig 'gal ba dag la rtsod pa ni rtsod pa smra ba'o //
analyzed: gang zhig 'gal ba dag la rtsod pa ni rtsod pa smra ba'o //
translated: The disputant is one who argues with those who are in error.

original: tshig ngan smra ba ni phan tshun tshig brlang pos nye bar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: tshig ngan smra ba ni phan tshun tshig brlang pos nye bar gnas pa'o //
translated: The insulter is one who is verbally abusive.

original: gang dag ngan pa smra ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag ngan pa smra ba'o //
translated: The slanderer is one who speaks maliciously.

original: mthun par smra ba ni ye shes mthong ba rnam par dag pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i yang dag pa'i gtam rnam nges so //🔽rjes su mthun @287b par smra ba ni /
analyzed: mthun par smra ba ni ye shes mthong ba rnam par dag pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i yang dag pa'i gtam rnam nges so // rjes su mthun @287b par smra ba ni /
translated: The expounder is one who expounds the true teaching in a manner that is consistent with the pure vision of wisdom.

original: rjes su mthun pa'i yang dag pa'i gtam gyis gtan la 'bebs pa'o //🔽gdams pa smra ba ni /🔽sems mnyam par ma gzhag par mnyam par gzhag par bya ba dang / sems mnyam par gzhag pa rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa'i yang dag pa'i gtam gyis gtan la 'bebs pa'o // gdams pa smra ba ni / sems mnyam par ma gzhag par mnyam par gzhag par bya ba dang / sems mnyam par gzhag pa rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa'o //
translated: The expounder of what is consistent is one who expounds the true teaching in a manner that is consistent with the pure vision of wisdom.

original: dbang du bya ba'i phyir gdams ngag brjod pa ni gdams par smra ba'o //
analyzed: dbang du bya ba'i phyir gdams ngag brjod pa ni gdams par smra ba'o //
translated: The counselor is one who teaches in order to bring about the meditative concentration of those whose minds are not concentrated, and in order to bring about the liberation of those whose minds are concentrated.🔽The counselor is one who teaches in order to bring about the meditative concentration of those whose minds are not concentrated, and in order to bring about the liberation of those whose minds are concentrated.

original: smra ba'i zhal ce ba ni rgyal po bzhugs pa dang / bskos pa 'du ba'i sa dang / 'dus pa dang / tshad mar rung ba'i zla grogs rnams dang / dge spyod dang / bram ze chos dang don la mkhas pa rnams so //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: smra ba'i zhal ce ba ni rgyal po bzhugs pa dang / bskos pa 'du ba'i sa dang / 'dus pa dang / tshad mar rung ba'i zla grogs rnams dang / dge spyod dang / bram ze chos dang don la mkhas pa rnams so // 'di lta ste /
translated: The assembly of speakers consists of the king, the assembly of the appointed, the assembly of the people, the assembly of reliable witnesses, the virtuous, and the brahmins who are learned in the Dharma and its meaning.

original: rgyal po'i pho brang gang na rgyal po nyid bzhugs pa'o //🔽bskos pa 'du ba'i sa ni /
analyzed: rgyal po'i pho brang gang na rgyal po nyid bzhugs pa'o // bskos pa 'du ba'i sa ni /
translated: The king is the one who resides in the royal palace.

original: gang du rgyal pos bskos pa rnams 'dus pa'o //
analyzed: gang du rgyal pos bskos pa rnams 'dus pa'o //
translated: The assembly of the appointed is the one in which the king’s appointees gather.

original: 'dus pa ni tshong pa 'dus pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa ni tshong pa 'dus pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The assembly of the people is the one in which merchants and others gather.

original: tshad mar rung ba'i zla grogs ni gang dag gi tshig rgol ba dang / phyir rgol ba gnyi gas mi gcag pa'o //🔽dge sbyong dang bram ze chos dang don la mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: tshad mar rung ba'i zla grogs ni gang dag gi tshig rgol ba dang / phyir rgol ba gnyi gas mi gcag pa'o // dge sbyong dang bram ze chos dang don la mkhas pa ni /
translated: The assembly of reliable witnesses is the one in which the words of both the challenger and the defender are not rejected.

original: gang dag bstan bcos de dang de dag gi tshig dang don la blo byang ba'o //
analyzed: gang dag bstan bcos de dang de dag gi tshig dang don la blo byang ba'o //
translated: The virtuous and the brahmins who are learned in the Dharma and its meaning are the ones who are skilled in the words and meanings of the various treatises.

original: smra ba'i bzhi bsgrub pa dang sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: smra ba'i bzhi bsgrub pa dang sgrub pa'o //
translated: The four bases of speaking are the establishment of the case and the establishment of the proof.

original: smra ba'i gzhi ni gang smra ba'i gnas su byed pa ste /
analyzed: smra ba'i gzhi ni gang smra ba'i gnas su byed pa ste /
translated: The basis of speech is that which is made the topic of speech.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: bsgrub pa dang / sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub pa dang / sgrub pa'o //
translated: the thesis and the proof.

original: bsgrub pa ni ngo bo nyid dang khyad par ro //
analyzed: bsgrub pa ni ngo bo nyid dang khyad par ro //
translated: The thesis is the nature and the distinction.

original: sgrub pa ni dam bca' dang / gtan tshigs dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyor ba dang / mjug sdud dang / mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ches pa'i lung ngo //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni dam bca' dang / gtan tshigs dang / dpe dang / nye bar sbyor ba dang / mjug sdud dang / mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang / yid ches pa'i lung ngo //
translated: The proof is the proposition, the reason, the example, the application, the conclusion, perception, inference, and trustworthy scripture.

original: de la ngo bo nyid sgrub pa ni /🔽bdag gi ngo bo nyid dang / chos kyi ngo bo nyid dang / yod do zhe'am /
analyzed: de la ngo bo nyid sgrub pa ni / bdag gi ngo bo nyid dang / chos kyi ngo bo nyid dang / yod do zhe'am /
translated: The proof of the nature is

original: med do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: med do zhes pa'o //
translated: the nature of the self, the nature of the dharma, and the proposition that it exists or does not exist.

original: khyad par ni bdag gi khyad par dang / chos kyi khyad par ro //🔽thams cad du song ba'am /
analyzed: khyad par ni bdag gi khyad par dang / chos kyi khyad par ro // thams cad du song ba'am /
translated: The distinction is the distinction of the self and the distinction of the dharma.

original: thams cad du song ba ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: thams cad du song ba ma yin pa'am /
translated: It is the proposition that it pervades everything or does not pervade everything,

original: rtag pa'am / mi rtag pa'am /🔽gzugs can nam /
analyzed: rtag pa'am / mi rtag pa'am / gzugs can nam /
translated: that it is permanent or impermanent,

original: gzugs can ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: gzugs can ma yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis so //
translated: that it has form or is formless, and so on.

original: dam bca' ba ni bdag 'dod pa sgrub pa'i don gzhan la go bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: dam bca' ba ni bdag 'dod pa sgrub pa'i don gzhan la go bar ston pa'o //
translated: The thesis is the statement of the proof for the sake of making the other understand.

original: gal te sgrub pa ma smos na bdag gi phyogs grub zin pa yang gzhan dag la bstan pas dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sgrub pa ma smos na bdag gi phyogs grub zin pa yang gzhan dag la bstan pas dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the proof is not stated, then even the establishment of one’s own position would be a thesis, since it is stated for the sake of the other.

original: gal te bdag 'dod pa'i don ma smos na ni /
analyzed: gal te bdag 'dod pa'i don ma smos na ni /
translated: If the purpose of the thesis is not stated,

original: gzhan gyi phyogs sgrub pa'i tshig kyang dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs sgrub pa'i tshig kyang dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then even the words that establish the position of the other would be a thesis.

original: gal te gzhan ma smos na ni gcig pu yang tshig de dag dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gzhan ma smos na ni gcig pu yang tshig de dag dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the other is not stated, then even a single word would be a thesis.

original: gal te go ba ma smos na ni lus kyi don de @288a * //
analyzed: gal te go ba ma smos na ni lus kyi don de @288a * //
translated: If the understanding is not stated, then even the bodily expression of the meaning

original: brda sprod pa yang dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brda sprod pa yang dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: would be a thesis.

original: gal te ston pa ma smos na ni nyan pa rnams kyis don de ma shes pa yang dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ston pa ma smos na ni nyan pa rnams kyis don de ma shes pa yang dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the teaching is not stated, then even the meaning that is not understood by the listener would be a thesis.

original: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa la nyes pa 'di dag thams cad med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar bstan pa bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa la nyes pa 'di dag thams cad med par 'gyur te /
translated: But when the thesis is formulated as we have explained, none of these faults will occur.

original: de lta bas na 'di rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'di rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the thesis should be formulated in this way.

original: gtan tshigs ni sgrub pa po de nyid la ma grags pa'i don yid ches par byed pa'i rgyu mngon sum du dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs pa bsnyad pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni sgrub pa po de nyid la ma grags pa'i don yid ches par byed pa'i rgyu mngon sum du dmigs pa dang / mi dmigs pa bsnyad pa'o //
translated: The reason is the direct observation of the cause of conviction in a matter unknown to the proponent himself, and the statement of non-observation.

original: yid ches par byed pa'i rgyu'i don ni 'dir gtan tshigs kyi don zhes bya bar ston te /
analyzed: yid ches par byed pa'i rgyu'i don ni 'dir gtan tshigs kyi don zhes bya bar ston te /
translated: The meaning of the cause of conviction is shown here as the meaning of reason.

original: 'di ltar mngon sum du dmigs pa dang / ma dmigs pa zhes bstan pa 'dis bsgrub pa de nyid la ma grags pa'i don la yid ches pa bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon sum du dmigs pa dang / ma dmigs pa zhes bstan pa 'dis bsgrub pa de nyid la ma grags pa'i don la yid ches pa bskyed pa ste /
translated: Thus, by this teaching of direct observation and non-observation, conviction is produced in the matter unknown to the proponent himself.

original: des na bsnyad pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir gtan tshigs zhes brjod do //
analyzed: des na bsnyad pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir gtan tshigs zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, because it is the cause of statement, it is called reason.

original: mngon sum du dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: mngon sum du dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa ni /
translated: Direct observation and non-observation

original: ngo bo nyid dang tshul gyis dbang du bya bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang tshul gyis dbang du bya bar rig par bya'o //
translated: should be understood as being governed by nature and method.

original: dpe ni mtha' mthong ba dang mtha' ma mthong ba mtshungs par sbyar zhing bsnyad pa'o //
analyzed: dpe ni mtha' mthong ba dang mtha' ma mthong ba mtshungs par sbyar zhing bsnyad pa'o //
translated: The example is the application and statement of similarity with and without seeing the end.

original: grags pa'i chas ma grags pa'i cha rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bsnyad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: grags pa'i chas ma grags pa'i cha rtogs par bya ba'i phyir bsnyad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term is said means is understood in order to understand the unfamous part from the famous part.

original: nye bar sbyor ba ni lhag ma de dang 'dra ba yang de'i chos sbyar ba'i phyir tshul gyis mthun par bsnyad pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar sbyor ba ni lhag ma de dang 'dra ba yang de'i chos sbyar ba'i phyir tshul gyis mthun par bsnyad pa'o //
translated: Application is the statement of the method of similarity in order to apply the property of the remainder that is similar to that remainder.

original: ji ltar bsgrub pa'i don yan lag gsum gyis bsgrub pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgrub pa'i don yan lag gsum gyis bsgrub pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the meaning of proof is established by three branches,

original: lhag ma de dang 'dra ba bsgrub pa rnams la yang grub pa'i don gyi chos sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lhag ma de dang 'dra ba bsgrub pa rnams la yang grub pa'i don gyi chos sbyar ba'i phyir /
translated: in the same way, in the proofs of the remainder that are similar to that,

original: tshul gyis mthun par bsnyad par ci rigs pas 'dra bar ston pa ni nye bar sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: tshul gyis mthun par bsnyad par ci rigs pas 'dra bar ston pa ni nye bar sbyor ba'o //
translated: the statement of the method of similarity is the application that shows the similarity by the appropriate application of the property of the probandum.

original: mjug sdud ni mthar phyin par bsnyad pa'o //
analyzed: mjug sdud ni mthar phyin par bsnyad pa'o //
translated: Conclusion is the statement of completion.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rigs legs par 'thad pa de'i phyir 'di ni de bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni mjug sdud du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rigs legs par 'thad pa de'i phyir 'di ni de bzhin no zhes bya ba 'di ni mjug sdud du rig par bya'o //
translated: Since the reasoning is well-established in that way, therefore this is just so. This is to be known as the conclusion.

original: dam bca' ba la sogs pa 'di dag ni dpe brjod pa tsam 'di rab tu bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: dam bca' ba la sogs pa 'di dag ni dpe brjod pa tsam 'di rab tu bstan par bya ste /
translated: These theses and so on are to be fully explained by merely stating the example.

original: dper na rtsod pa'i phyir rgol ba dang bcas pa de la bdag med par smra bas bdag med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni dam bca' ba'o //
analyzed: dper na rtsod pa'i phyir rgol ba dang bcas pa de la bdag med par smra bas bdag med do zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni dam bca' ba'o //
translated: For example, in a debate, the statement “There is no self” by the proponent of no-self is the thesis.

original: phung po la 'dogs pa la nyes pa rnam pa bzhi dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: phung po la 'dogs pa la nyes pa rnam pa bzhi dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs te /
translated: The reason is: “Because four faults are found in the imputation of the self to the aggregates.”

original: bdag de la 'dogs na phung po la mtshan nyid du'am /
analyzed: bdag de la 'dogs na phung po la mtshan nyid du'am /
translated: If the self is imputed to that, it is imputed as the characteristic of the aggregates,

original: phung po rnams la'am /
analyzed: phung po rnams la'am /
translated: or to the aggregates,

original: phung po rnams las gzhan pa'am /
analyzed: phung po rnams las gzhan pa'am /
translated: or other than the aggregates,

original: phung po med pa zhig tu gdags grang na /
analyzed: phung po med pa zhig tu gdags grang na /
translated: or without aggregates.

original: de la gal te phung po'i mtshan nyid ces bya bar ni phung po de dag rang @288b dbang med par rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can te /
analyzed: de la gal te phung po'i mtshan nyid ces bya bar ni phung po de dag rang @288b dbang med par rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can te /
translated: If it is said to be imputed as the characteristic of the aggregates, the aggregates arise in dependence and are subject to destruction, without independent nature.

original: bdag gi mtshan nyid du mi 'thad pas nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi mtshan nyid du mi 'thad pas nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is not tenable that the aggregates are the characteristic of the self, there is a fault.

original: ji ste phung po rnams la 'dogs na ni /
analyzed: ji ste phung po rnams la 'dogs na ni /
translated: If it is imputed to the aggregates,

original: des na phung po mi rtag pa la brten nas bdag mi rtag par gyur pa'i phyir nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na phung po mi rtag pa la brten nas bdag mi rtag par gyur pa'i phyir nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: then because the self would be dependent on the impermanent aggregates, there would be a fault.

original: ji ste phung po dag las gzhan du /
analyzed: ji ste phung po dag las gzhan du /
translated: If the self were different from the aggregates,🔽

original: 'dogs na ni /
analyzed: 'dogs na ni /
translated: If it is designated as other than the aggregates,

original: des na bdag lus med cing mi 'dogs pa'i phyir nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na bdag lus med cing mi 'dogs pa'i phyir nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the self would be non-existent and not designated as a body, and that would be a fault.

original: gal te phung po med par 'dogs na ni /
analyzed: gal te phung po med par 'dogs na ni /
translated: If it is designated as not existing in the aggregates,

original: rang bzhin gyis grol ba ma 'dres pa yin pas thar par bya ba'i 'bad pa don med pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis grol ba ma 'dres pa yin pas thar par bya ba'i 'bad pa don med pa'i nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be naturally liberated and not mixed, and the effort to attain liberation would be pointless—that would be a fault.

original: da ltar na 'das pa 'dogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
analyzed: da ltar na 'das pa 'dogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni dpe'o //
translated: The example is like designating the past.

original: 'das pa de yod pa'i mtshan nyid kho nar 'dogs pa na da ltar gyi mtshan nyid du 'am /
analyzed: 'das pa de yod pa'i mtshan nyid kho nar 'dogs pa na da ltar gyi mtshan nyid du 'am /
translated: When the past is designated as having the characteristic of existence, is it designated as having the characteristic of the present,

original: da ltar byung ba la'am /🔽da ltar byung ba las gzhan du'am /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba la'am / da ltar byung ba las gzhan du'am /
translated: in the present,🔽other than the present,

original: da ltar byung ba la mi ltos pa zhig tu gdags grang na /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba la mi ltos pa zhig tu gdags grang na /
translated: or without relying on the present?

original: de gal te da ltar gyi mtshan nyid du 'dogs na ni /
analyzed: de gal te da ltar gyi mtshan nyid du 'dogs na ni /
translated: If it is designated as having the characteristic of the present,

original: des na da ltar gyi byung ba ma 'gags pa yin pas de'i mtshan nyid 'das pa yang byung ba ma 'gags pa'i bdag nyid kyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na da ltar gyi byung ba ma 'gags pa yin pas de'i mtshan nyid 'das pa yang byung ba ma 'gags pa'i bdag nyid kyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: then since the present occurrence is unceasing, the fault would be that the characteristic of the past would also be the nature of unceasing occurrence.

original: ji ltar da ltar la 'dogs na des na ma 'gags pa ni 'gag pa'i bdag nyid dang 'brel bar mi rung bas nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar da ltar la 'dogs na des na ma 'gags pa ni 'gag pa'i bdag nyid dang 'brel bar mi rung bas nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is designated in the present, then since that which has not ceased is not suitable to be related to the nature of cessation, there is a fault.

original: ji ste da ltar las gzhan du 'dogs na ni /
analyzed: ji ste da ltar las gzhan du 'dogs na ni /
translated: If it is designated as other than the present,

original: des na da ltar bor na dngos po de ci yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: des na da ltar bor na dngos po de ci yang mi dmigs te /
translated: then since the present is abandoned by that, that thing is not observed at all.

original: de la de 'dogs pa nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la de 'dogs pa nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is designated in that, there is a fault.

original: ji ste de da ltar la mi ltos na ni des na 'dus ma byas kyang 'das par 'gyur bas nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ste de da ltar la mi ltos na ni des na 'dus ma byas kyang 'das par 'gyur bas nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not rely on the present, then since unconditioned states would also be past, there is a fault.

original: 'das pa de ni mtshan nyid nyams pa'i phyir mtshan nyid kyis nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'das pa de ni mtshan nyid nyams pa'i phyir mtshan nyid kyis nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: That past is a fault by the characteristics because of the degeneration of the characteristics.
