original: de'i phyir da ltar la 'dogs pa la nyes pa zhi 'grub pa 'dis bdag med pa ma grub ba yang phung po la 'dogs pa la nyes pa rnam pa bzhi dmigs pa'i phyir med par rab tu gyur bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir da ltar la 'dogs pa la nyes pa zhi 'grub pa 'dis bdag med pa ma grub ba yang phung po la 'dogs pa la nyes pa rnam pa bzhi dmigs pa'i phyir med par rab tu gyur bo //
translated: Therefore, since the faults are established by this, since the four faults are observed in the designation of selflessness in the aggregates, it is well known that it does not exist.

original: de ltar bdag tu phyin ci log pa bkag nas rigs pa 'dis rtag pa la sogs pa yang med do zhes 'dra bar ston pa ni nye bar sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar bdag tu phyin ci log pa bkag nas rigs pa 'dis rtag pa la sogs pa yang med do zhes 'dra bar ston pa ni nye bar sbyar ba'o //
translated: Having thus refuted the error of self, this reasoning shows the similarity of the refutation of permanence, etc.

original: gang gi phyir de de ltar ma yin pa de'i phyir phung po lnga ni mi rtag pa nas bdag med do zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de de ltar ma yin pa de'i phyir phung po lnga ni mi rtag pa nas bdag med do zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa'o //
translated: The conclusion is: Therefore, the five aggregates are impermanent, etc.

original: mngon sum ni rang gi don yod cing snang la ma nor ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum ni rang gi don yod cing snang la ma nor ba'o //
translated: Direct perception is the existence and appearance of one's own object without error.

original: de la rang gi don ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la rang gi don ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among them, one's own object is as follows:

original: mig gi gzugs so //
analyzed: mig gi gzugs so //
translated: The form of the eye.

original: yod pa smos pa ni /🔽bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas 'jig rten na mngon sum du grags pa rnams mngon sum ma yin par bsal ba'i phyir te btags @289a * //
analyzed: yod pa smos pa ni / bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas 'jig rten na mngon sum du grags pa rnams mngon sum ma yin par bsal ba'i phyir te btags @289a * //
translated: The mention of existence is

original: pa tsam gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: pa tsam gyi phyir ro //
translated: in order to exclude the non-perception of substances such as pots that are known in the world as direct perception, because they are mere designations.

original: snang ba smos pa ni bsgribs pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i rgyu rnams kyis mi snang bar 'gyur ba'i yul bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba smos pa ni bsgribs pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i rgyu rnams kyis mi snang bar 'gyur ba'i yul bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The mention of appearance is in order to exclude objects that do not appear due to causes of non-apprehension such as obstruction, etc.

original: ma nor ba smos pa ni mgal me bskor ba dang / sgyu ma dang smig rgyu la sogs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nor ba smos pa ni mgal me bskor ba dang / sgyu ma dang smig rgyu la sogs pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “nonerroneous” is used to exclude such things as a whirling firebrand and a mirage.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum gyi lhag ma la yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum gyi lhag ma la yid ches pa'o //
translated: Inference is the conviction about the remainder of a direct perception.

original: mngon sum las gzhan pa gang yin pa ni lhag ma mngon sum ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: mngon sum las gzhan pa gang yin pa ni lhag ma mngon sum ma yin pa ste /
translated: That which is other than direct perception is the remainder, which is not direct perception.

original: nges pa de dang lhan cig gnas par mngon par mthong ba po la sngar rab tu grub pa'o //
analyzed: nges pa de dang lhan cig gnas par mngon par mthong ba po la sngar rab tu grub pa'o //

original: rnam par thams cad du 'gal ba med cing 'khrul ba med pa ste /

analyzed: tshig dang don snga phyi rgyun chags par rnam par ston par lcogs pa'o //
translated: that by which one's words in debate are very beautiful.

analyzed: tshig zur phyin pa phun sum tshogs pa ni sgra smra ba 'og nas 'byung ba'i gtam gyis nyes pa las bzlog ste cal col la sogs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of the point is the opposite of the fault of the grammarians, because it is free from nonsense and so forth.

analyzed: mi 'jigs pa ni dper brjod du ma la mngon par zhen pa can mkhas pa 'dus par yang smra zhing bag tsha ba med la zhum pa med pa'o //
translated: Fearlessness is speaking in an assembly of scholars without attachment to many examples, without hesitation, and without timidity.

original: brtan pa ni phyir rgol ba'i tshig mjug tu phyin par bsdad nas yid dal du smra ba'o //
analyzed: brtan pa ni phyir rgol ba'i tshig mjug tu phyin par bsdad nas yid dal du smra ba'o //
translated: Stability is speaking slowly with a composed mind, having sat down to the end of the words of the opponent.

original: mthun par byed pa ni rang bzhin gyis bzang bas gzu bo dang phyir rgol ba'i sems dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: mthun par byed pa ni rang bzhin gyis bzang bas gzu bo dang phyir rgol ba'i sems dang mthun pa'o //
translated: Agreeableness is being honest by nature, and in accord with the minds of the opponent.

original: smra ba chad pas gcad pa ni /
analyzed: smra ba chad pas gcad pa ni /
translated: Punishment for speaking is🔽the punishment for cutting off the conversation,🔽the punishment for leaving the conversation unfinished, and

original: gtam rjes gcad pa dang / gtam la 'phro lus pa dang / gtam gyi nyes pa'o //
analyzed: gtam rjes gcad pa dang / gtam la 'phro lus pa dang / gtam gyi nyes pa'o //
translated: the punishment for faults in the conversation.

original: de rnams ni smra ba chad pas gcod pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de rnams ni smra ba chad pas gcod pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: These are the three types of punishment for speaking.

original: de rnams kyi smra ba chad pas gcad par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi smra ba chad pas gcad par bya'o //
translated: One should punish them with those.

original: de la gtam rjes @289b gcad pa ni /
analyzed: de la gtam rjes @289b gcad pa ni /
translated: Among them, the punishment for cutting off the conversation is🔽as follows.

original: rang gi smra ba'i skyon khas blangs pa dang / gzhan gyi smra ba'i yon tan khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi smra ba'i skyon khas blangs pa dang / gzhan gyi smra ba'i yon tan khas blangs pa'o //
translated: You have accepted the faults of your own doctrine and the good qualities of the doctrine of another.

original: bdag gis ma legs so zhes khyod kyis legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis rang dang gzhan gyi smra ba'i skyon dang yon tan khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis ma legs so zhes khyod kyis legs so zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa rnams kyis rang dang gzhan gyi smra ba'i skyon dang yon tan khas blangs pa'o //
translated: You have accepted the faults and good qualities of your own and another's doctrine by saying, It is not good, and so on.

original: gtam 'phro lus pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gtam 'phro lus pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The remainder of the discussion is as follows.🔽Jumping from one thing to another🔽is talking about something else.

original: gzhan nas gzhan du brgyud pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan nas gzhan du brgyud pa'am /
translated: Jumping from one thing to another

original: gtam gzhan smra ba ste mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gtam gzhan smra ba ste mdo las ji skad 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: is the manner of external discussion. It means distraction by jumping from one thing to another, as in the sutra.

original: gzhan nas gzhan du 'phros pa ni /
analyzed: gzhan nas gzhan du 'phros pa ni /
translated: Talking about something else

original: phyi rol gyi gtam gyi tshul te ji ltar mdo las gzhan nas gzhan du brgyud pa la sogs pas g-yeng bar byed pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi gtam gyi tshul te ji ltar mdo las gzhan nas gzhan du brgyud pa la sogs pas g-yeng bar byed pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: is the manner of external discussion. It means distraction by talking about something else, as in the sutra.

original: mdo las tshe dang ldan pa tstshandi ka mu stegs rnams dang lhan cig rtsod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mdo las tshe dang ldan pa tstshandi ka mu stegs rnams dang lhan cig rtsod par mi bya'o //
translated: The venerable Candraka should not debate with the tirthikas.

original: rtsod pa mi shes pa shes par bya ba'i phyir te mi shes pa dang mi rtsod do zhes gang gsungs so //
analyzed: rtsod pa mi shes pa shes par bya ba'i phyir te mi shes pa dang mi rtsod do zhes gang gsungs so //
translated: In order to make known the unknown, but one does not dispute with the unknown.

original: gtam gyis nyes pa ni /
analyzed: gtam gyis nyes pa ni /
translated: The faults of conversation are:

original: cal col dang / 'khrugs pa dang / brda phrad du mi rung ba dang / ran pa ma yin pa dang / don dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang / dus tshigs ma yin par smra ba gang /
analyzed: cal col dang / 'khrugs pa dang / brda phrad du mi rung ba dang / ran pa ma yin pa dang / don dang ldan pa ma yin pa dang / dus tshigs ma yin par smra ba gang /
translated: frivolity, confusion, unintelligibility, unsuitability, irrelevance, and inopportune speech.

original: mi brten pa dang / mi gsal ba dang ; tshig rgyun chags pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi brten pa dang / mi gsal ba dang ; tshig rgyun chags pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is also unsupportable, unclear, and not continuous.

original: de la cal col ni gang skabs bor te gtam sna tshogs rgyas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la cal col ni gang skabs bor te gtam sna tshogs rgyas par byed pa'o //
translated: Frivolity is to digress and elaborate on various topics.

original: 'khrugs pa ni gang /
analyzed: 'khrugs pa ni gang /
translated: Confusion is

original: khros pas g-yengs pa dang / dga' bas g-yengs pa'o //
analyzed: khros pas g-yengs pa dang / dga' bas g-yengs pa'o //
translated: to be distracted by anger or by joy.

original: brda phrad du mi rung ba ni /
analyzed: brda phrad du mi rung ba ni /
translated: Unintelligibility is

original: gang chos dang don 'khor dang phyir rgol ba rnams kyis ma zin pa'o //
analyzed: gang chos dang don 'khor dang phyir rgol ba rnams kyis ma zin pa'o //
translated: to be incomprehensible to the assembly or to the adversaries.

original: ran pa ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: ran pa ma yin pa ni /
translated: Unsuitability is

original: gang lhag pa dang zlos pa dang nyung ba'o //
analyzed: gang lhag pa dang zlos pa dang nyung ba'o //
translated: to speak too much, to repeat oneself, or to speak too little.🔽Irrelevance is🔽to speak of something else when one should speak of something else.

original: don dang ldan pa ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: don dang ldan pa ma yin pa ni /
translated: Inopportuneness is🔽to speak when the time is not opportune.

original: de rnam pa bcur blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de rnam pa bcur blta bar bya ste /
translated: This should be understood in ten ways:

original: don med pa dang / don dang bral ba dang / rigs dang bral ba dang / bsgrub par mtshungs pa dang / ltag chod dang ldan pa ste don mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don med pa dang / don dang bral ba dang / rigs dang bral ba dang / bsgrub par mtshungs pa dang / ltag chod dang ldan pa ste don mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: 1. without meaning, 2. without purpose, 3. without reason, 4. with equal establishment, 5. with contradiction, 6. with non-perception of meaning, 7. without connection with the meaning, 8. with uncertainty, 9. with equal establishment of proof, 10. with non-establishment of proof.

original: don dang mi 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dang mi 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of non-connection with the meaning.

original: ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of uncertainty.

original: sgrub pa yang bsgrub dgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa yang bsgrub dgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the proof must be established.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa dang / tshogs par byung ba ma yin pa dang / smra ba thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa dang / tshogs par byung ba ma yin pa dang / smra ba thams cad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of non-conformity, because of non-occurrence in the assembly, and because of being endowed with all speech.

original: dus tshigs ma yin par smra ba ni /
analyzed: dus tshigs ma yin par smra ba ni /
translated: Speaking out of season is

original: gang sngar smras pa ste phyis smra ba dang / phyis smra ba de sdar smra ba'o //
analyzed: gang sngar smras pa ste phyis smra ba dang / phyis smra ba de sdar smra ba'o //
translated: speaking first and then later, and speaking later and then earlier.

original: mi brtan pa ni /
analyzed: mi brtan pa ni /
translated: Unstable is

original: gang dam bcas nas smod pa dang / smad nas dam bca' ba dang / myur ches pas ha cang rtab rtab por gyur te mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: gang dam bcas nas smod pa dang / smad nas dam bca' ba dang / myur ches pas ha cang rtab rtab por gyur te mi gsal ba'o //
translated: that which, having been promised, is criticized, and having been criticized, is promised, and that which, being too hasty, is not clear.

original: tshig mi gsal ba ni gang sgra'i mtshan nyid 'gal ba dang / phyi ma bzlas par lan smra ba dang / legs par sbyar ba la brtsams te tha mal bas mthar byung ba dang / tha mal bas brtsams te legs par @290a * //🔽sbyar bas mthar phyung ba'o //🔽tshig rgyun chags pa ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: tshig mi gsal ba ni gang sgra'i mtshan nyid 'gal ba dang / phyi ma bzlas par lan smra ba dang / legs par sbyar ba la brtsams te tha mal bas mthar byung ba dang / tha mal bas brtsams te legs par @290a * // sbyar bas mthar phyung ba'o // tshig rgyun chags pa ma yin pa ni /
translated: Unclear speech is that which is contrary to the characteristics of speech, that which repeats the last syllable of the preceding word, that which is incorrect, that which is vulgar, that which is begun in a classical language but ends in a vulgar tongue, and that which is begun in a vulgar tongue but ends in a classical language.🔽Unconnected speech is that which is interrupted by other words and by hesitations.

original: gang bar skabs su tshig dang spobs pa thogs pa dang / rgyun chad pa'o //🔽smra ba las byung ba ni /
analyzed: gang bar skabs su tshig dang spobs pa thogs pa dang / rgyun chad pa'o // smra ba las byung ba ni /
translated: Speech that is not spontaneous is that which is not natural to the speaker.

original: gang gis smra ba las byung ba ste /
analyzed: gang gis smra ba las byung ba ste /
translated: Speech that is not free is that which is not free from the faults of speech.🔽Speech that is not clear is that which is not clear to the listener.🔽Speech that is not continuous is that which is interrupted by other words and by hesitations.

original: smra ba'i yon tan dang nyes pa brtags nas mi phyed pas 'byung ba ni chad pa'i gnas su mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ;🔽/ byed pas 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: smra ba'i yon tan dang nyes pa brtags nas mi phyed pas 'byung ba ni chad pa'i gnas su mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro ; / byed pas 'byung ba ni /
translated: Speech that is not spontaneous is that which is not natural to the speaker.

original: mi gzhol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gzhol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Speech that is not free is that which is not free from the faults of speech.🔽Speech that is not clear is that which is not clear to the listener.

original: de la phyir rgol ba snod ma yin pa dang / 'khor yon tan med pa dang / bdag kyang mi mkhas par rig nas smra bar mi bya ba dang / phyir rgol ba snod du gyur pa zhig gam /🔽'khor yon tan dang ldan nam /
analyzed: de la phyir rgol ba snod ma yin pa dang / 'khor yon tan med pa dang / bdag kyang mi mkhas par rig nas smra bar mi bya ba dang / phyir rgol ba snod du gyur pa zhig gam / 'khor yon tan dang ldan nam /
translated: One should not speak if one knows that the opponent is not a suitable vessel, that the audience is not endowed with good qualities, or that one is not learned.🔽One should speak if one knows that the opponent is a suitable vessel,

original: bdag kyang mkhas par rig nas smra bar byed do //🔽de la phyir rgol ba snod ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: bdag kyang mkhas par rig nas smra bar byed do // de la phyir rgol ba snod ma yin pa ni /
translated: that the audience is endowed with good qualities, or that one is learned.

original: mi dge ba'i gnas nas blangs te dge ba'i gnas su gzhag par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i gnas nas blangs te dge ba'i gnas su gzhag par mi nus pa'o //
translated: An opponent is not a suitable vessel if he is incapable of being lifted out of the nonvirtuous state and placed in the virtuous state.

original: 'khor yon tan med pa ni tshogs pa rung ba ma yin pa dang / mngon par zhen pa can dang phyogs su lhung ba la sogs pa'o //🔽bdag kyang mi mkhas pa ni /
analyzed: 'khor yon tan med pa ni tshogs pa rung ba ma yin pa dang / mngon par zhen pa can dang phyogs su lhung ba la sogs pa'o // bdag kyang mi mkhas pa ni /
translated: An audience is not endowed with good qualities if it is not a suitable assembly, if it is attached to its own position, if it is biased, and so on.

original: smra ba nas smra ba'i rgyan gyi bar la ma byang ba'o //
analyzed: smra ba nas smra ba'i rgyan gyi bar la ma byang ba'o //
translated: One is not learned if one is not skilled in speaking and in the ornaments of speaking.

original: de las bzlog ba ni 'khor snod du gyur pa la sogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog ba ni 'khor snod du gyur pa la sogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The opposite of these is to know that the opponent is a suitable vessel, and so on.

original: smra ba la gces spras byed pa'i chos rnams ni /
analyzed: smra ba la gces spras byed pa'i chos rnams ni /
translated: The qualities that are cherished in speaking are

original: gang dag smra ba rnams la ni gdon mi za bar dgos pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag smra ba rnams la ni gdon mi za bar dgos pa ste /
translated: Those who speak must have a purpose.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What is that purpose?

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi gzhung lugs la mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi gzhung lugs la mkhas pa ste /
translated: To be learned in one's own and others' scriptures.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi gzhung lugs la mkhas pa ni smra ba la gces spras byed pa'i chos so //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi gzhung lugs la mkhas pa ni smra ba la gces spras byed pa'i chos so //
translated: To be learned in one's own and others' scriptures is a quality that is cherished by speakers.

original: des thams cad du smra bar byed do //
analyzed: des thams cad du smra bar byed do //
translated: By it one speaks everywhere.

original: des gtam gyi gzhi thams cad smra bar byed do //
analyzed: des gtam gyi gzhi thams cad smra bar byed do //
translated: By it one speaks on all topics.

original: mi 'jigs pa ni gang gis 'khor thams cad smra bar byed do //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa ni gang gis 'khor thams cad smra bar byed do //
translated: Fearlessness is that by which one speaks in the midst of an assembly.

original: spobs pa ni gang gis thams cad du lan gdab pa shes pa'o //
analyzed: spobs pa ni gang gis thams cad du lan gdab pa shes pa'o //
translated: Eloquence is that by which one knows how to respond to everything.

original: gang gi 'khor thams cad lan 'debs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi 'khor thams cad lan 'debs pa'o //
translated: By it one responds to everything in the assembly.🔽Moreover, one should speak with the desire to benefit oneself and others.

original: yang bdag legs par 'dod par smra ba'i tshul shes par bya'i bcad cing smra bar ni mi bya ste /
analyzed: yang bdag legs par 'dod par smra ba'i tshul shes par bya'i bcad cing smra bar ni mi bya ste /
translated: One should not speak in a way that is divisive.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos mngon pa'i mdo las ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos mngon pa'i mdo las ji skad gsungs pa lta bu ste /
translated: As the Blessed One said in the Abhidharma Sūtra:🔽Bhikṣus, a bhikṣu who is skilled in the seven topics and the eighteen matters is called 'skilled in the Abhidharma.'

original: gnas bcu gnyis mthong ba'i byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa nan tan snying por byed pa /
analyzed: gnas bcu gnyis mthong ba'i byang chub sems dpa' dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa nan tan snying por byed pa /
translated: The bodhisattva who sees the twelve situations should be intent on the side of virtue, should make practice essential,

original: sems can yongs su sdud ba dang / myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas gzhan dag dang rtsod par smra bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su sdud ba dang / myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'dod pas gzhan dag dang rtsod par smra bar mi bya'o //
translated: should gather living beings, and should quickly wish for the supreme enlightenment.

original: bcu gnyis gang /
analyzed: bcu gnyis gang /
translated: What are the twelve?

original: dam pa'i chos don gyi mchog dang ldan pa'i bshad pa kun shes pa dkon pa dang / kun shes par bya ba'i bsam pas smra ba dkon pa dang / @290b tshogs pas mkhas pa dang / rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams dkon pa dang / spong ba'i smra ba dang /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos don gyi mchog dang ldan pa'i bshad pa kun shes pa dkon pa dang / kun shes par bya ba'i bsam pas smra ba dkon pa dang / @290b tshogs pas mkhas pa dang / rtog pa dang ldan pa rnams dkon pa dang / spong ba'i smra ba dang /
translated: It is rare to find a teacher who knows the explanation that has the supreme meaning of the holy Dharma, it is rare to find a teacher who teaches with the intention of understanding, it is rare to find an assembly that is wise and has understanding, it is rare to find a teacher who teaches the Dharma of rejection,

original: phyogs ngan pa yongs su 'dzin cing mngon par zhen pa'i nyes pa dang / ngan g-yo smra ba'i nyes pa dang / dus ma yin par gtam la sbyor ba'i nyes pa dang / gtam khyad du gsod pa'i nyes pa dang / tshig brlang po'i nyes pa dang /
analyzed: phyogs ngan pa yongs su 'dzin cing mngon par zhen pa'i nyes pa dang / ngan g-yo smra ba'i nyes pa dang / dus ma yin par gtam la sbyor ba'i nyes pa dang / gtam khyad du gsod pa'i nyes pa dang / tshig brlang po'i nyes pa dang /
translated: The faults of holding and clinging to bad views, the faults of speaking deceitfully, the faults of speaking at the wrong time, the faults of speaking in a way that is contemptuous, the faults of speaking harshly,🔽the faults of speaking in a way that is disturbing, and the faults of speaking in a way that is not beneficial.🔽The faults of speaking in a way that is not beneficial are sixfold: speaking in a way that is not beneficial, speaking in a way that is not timely, speaking in a way that is not truthful, speaking in a way that is not gentle, speaking in a way that is not loving, and speaking in a way that is not meaningful.

original: yid 'khrugs pa'i nyes pa dang / gang nyes pa drug rnams par spangs te smra ba dkon pa dang / 'khrug pa med par smra ba dkon pa dang / gzhan gyi sems srung zhing smra ba dkon pa dang / ring nge 'dzin rjes su bsrung zhing smra ba dkon pa dang /
analyzed: yid 'khrugs pa'i nyes pa dang / gang nyes pa drug rnams par spangs te smra ba dkon pa dang / 'khrug pa med par smra ba dkon pa dang / gzhan gyi sems srung zhing smra ba dkon pa dang / ring nge 'dzin rjes su bsrung zhing smra ba dkon pa dang /
translated: The faults of speaking in a way that is not beneficial are sixfold: speaking in a way that is not beneficial, speaking in a way that is not timely, speaking in a way that is not truthful, speaking in a way that is not gentle, speaking in a way that is not loving, and speaking in a way that is not meaningful.

original: rgyal ba'am pham pa'i sems med par smra ba dkon pa dang / rgyal ba'am pham pa kun nas nyon mongs pa med par smra ba dkon pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs par gyur na reg par gnas pa dkon pa dang / reg par mi gnas na dge ba'i chos rnams la rgyun du bsgom pa dkon pa dang /
analyzed: rgyal ba'am pham pa'i sems med par smra ba dkon pa dang / rgyal ba'am pham pa kun nas nyon mongs pa med par smra ba dkon pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs par gyur na reg par gnas pa dkon pa dang / reg par mi gnas na dge ba'i chos rnams la rgyun du bsgom pa dkon pa dang /
translated: It is rare to find someone who speaks without a mind to win or lose. It is rare to find someone who speaks without being afflicted. It is rare to find someone who remains in contact with others when they are afflicted. It is rare to find someone who continuously cultivates wholesome states when they are not in contact with others.

original: dge ba'i chos rgyun du ma bsgoms na sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa la mnyam par gzhag pa dang / sems mnyam par bzhag pa la rnam par grol ba dkon no //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rgyun du ma bsgoms na sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa la mnyam par gzhag pa dang / sems mnyam par bzhag pa la rnam par grol ba dkon no //
translated: It is rare to find someone who enters into meditative concentration when their mind is not in meditative concentration. It is rare to find someone who is liberated when their mind is in meditative concentration.

original: dge ba'i phyogs la rtsom zhes gsungs nas nan tan snying por byed pa zhes bka' stsal ba ni bsam pa rnam par dag par bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs la rtsom zhes gsungs nas nan tan snying por byed pa zhes bka' stsal ba ni bsam pa rnam par dag par bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Having said, “One should begin with the wholesome side,” he said, “One should make effort the essence,” in order to demonstrate the purity of attitude.

original: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la sogs pa'i rgyur thos pa la sogs pa dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang / bkur sti la sogs pa'i rgyur thos pa la sogs pa dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that one should not strive for the wholesome side of learning, etc. for the sake of gain, honor, etc.

original: sems can sdud pa ni /
analyzed: sems can sdud pa ni /
translated: Attracting sentient beings.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa las bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa las bye brag tu bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: In order to distinguish it from the disciples, etc.

original: gzhan la phan pa bsgrub pa lhur len ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa bsgrub pa lhur len ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the one who is intent on accomplishing the benefit of others.

original: de ltar bdag la phan pa dang / gzhan la phan pa zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar bdag la phan pa dang / gzhan la phan pa zhugs pa ni /
translated: Thus, the one who is intent on his own benefit and the benefit of others🔽will quickly and fully awaken to unsurpassed, complete enlightenment.

original: myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhes bya ba 'di ni tshig 'di dag gis mtshams sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya zhes bya ba 'di ni tshig 'di dag gis mtshams sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: This is the connection with those words.

original: mi rtsod par smra bar byed du zin kyang theg pa chen po'i chos ni rang bzhin gyis zab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi rtsod par smra bar byed du zin kyang theg pa chen po'i chos ni rang bzhin gyis zab pa'i phyir /
translated: Even if one speaks without dispute, the Dharma of the Great Vehicle is profound by nature.

original: kun shes pa dkon na rtsod pas lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: kun shes pa dkon na rtsod pas lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: If it is rare to understand it completely, what need is there to mention dispute?

original: gang dang lhan cig tu rtsod par smra bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang dang lhan cig tu rtsod par smra bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispute with those who speak,

original: smra ba de dag kun shes par bya ba'i bsam pas phyir smra ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: smra ba de dag kun shes par bya ba'i bsam pas phyir smra ba ma yin gyi /
translated: one does not speak with the intention to understand them completely.

original: 'on kyang skyon gdags pa'i bsam pas so //
analyzed: 'on kyang skyon gdags pa'i bsam pas so //
translated: Rather, one speaks with the intention to find fault.

original: gzu bo gang dag gi mdun du de smra bar bya ba'i tshogs pa de dag kyang rung ba ma yin zhing byang ba ma yin pa'am mngon par zhen pa can dag go //
analyzed: gzu bo gang dag gi mdun du de smra bar bya ba'i tshogs pa de dag kyang rung ba ma yin zhing byang ba ma yin pa'am mngon par zhen pa can dag go //
translated: The assembly in front of whom he speaks is also not suitable or pure, or is full of attachment.

original: @291a * // smra bar bya ba thams cad kyang phal cher nyes pa drug dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: @291a * // smra bar bya ba thams cad kyang phal cher nyes pa drug dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: All speech is mostly endowed with six faults.

original: 'di ltar smra bar byed pa ni res 'ga' byung rgyal du phyogs ngan pa yongs su bzung nas mngon par zhen pa dang / tshig dor dang ltag chod chad pa'i gnas rnams la yang sbyor ba dang / tshig mdzug tu phyin phyin mi sdong par dus ma yin par smra bar rtsom pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar smra bar byed pa ni res 'ga' byung rgyal du phyogs ngan pa yongs su bzung nas mngon par zhen pa dang / tshig dor dang ltag chod chad pa'i gnas rnams la yang sbyor ba dang / tshig mdzug tu phyin phyin mi sdong par dus ma yin par smra bar rtsom pa dang /
translated: Thus, the speaker sometimes, without restraint, having taken up a bad position, is attached, and applies himself to the points of defeat of words that are irrelevant and contradictory, and does not stop until the words are finished, but begins to speak at the wrong time.

original: phyir rgol bas legs par smras kyang gtam khyad du gsod de smod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyir rgol bas legs par smras kyang gtam khyad du gsod de smod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Even when the opponent speaks well, he insults, that is, disparages, the conversation.

original: tshig brlang po yang smra ste /
analyzed: tshig brlang po yang smra ste /
translated: He speaks harshly.

original: des phyir rgol ba la sogs pa'i sems 'khrugs par byed pa dang / bdag kyang de dag la sems 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba'i nyes pa 'di dag drug dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: des phyir rgol ba la sogs pa'i sems 'khrugs par byed pa dang / bdag kyang de dag la sems 'khrugs pa zhes bya ba'i nyes pa 'di dag drug dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: He is also reproached with the fault of agitation of mind, because he agitates the minds of his adversaries.

original: nye bar zhi bas ni smra ba dkon no //
analyzed: nye bar zhi bas ni smra ba dkon no //
translated: He is not at peace, because he is not a speaker who is at peace.🔽He is not a protector of the minds of others, because he does not have the mental stability of one who is at peace. He is not a protector of his own mind, because he does not have the mental stability of one who is at peace.🔽He is not a speaker who is at peace, because he is not a speaker who is at peace.🔽He is not a speaker who is at peace, because he is not a speaker who is at peace.🔽He is not a speaker who is at peace, because he is not a speaker who is at peace.

original: nye bar ma zhi ba la ni gang dag gis gzhan dang pa thob par 'gyur ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i gnas dang ldan pas rang gi sems mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur ba gzhan gyi sems bsrung ba dang / rang gi sems bsrung ba gnyi ga dkon no //🔽smra ba phal cher ni ji ltar na bdag rgyal bar 'gyur zhing pha rol pham par 'gyur snyam pa'i sems kun du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nye bar ma zhi ba la ni gang dag gis gzhan dang pa thob par 'gyur ba dang / rnam par grol ba'i gnas dang ldan pas rang gi sems mnyam par 'jog par 'gyur ba gzhan gyi sems bsrung ba dang / rang gi sems bsrung ba gnyi ga dkon no // smra ba phal cher ni ji ltar na bdag rgyal bar 'gyur zhing pha rol pham par 'gyur snyam pa'i sems kun du 'byung ngo //
translated: He is not a speaker who is at peace, because he is not a speaker who is at peace.🔽He is not a speaker who is at peace, because he is not a speaker who is at peace.🔽He is not a speaker who is at peace, because he is not a speaker who is at peace.🔽He is not a speaker who is at peace, because he is not a speaker who is at peace.

original: de yod na yongs su gdung ba'i sdug bsngal gyis kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yod na yongs su gdung ba'i sdug bsngal gyis kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ro //
translated: He is not a speaker who is at peace, because he is not a speaker who is at peace.🔽He is not a speaker who is at peace, because he is not a speaker who is at peace.🔽He is not a speaker who is at peace, because he is not a speaker who is at peace.🔽He is not a speaker who is at peace, because he is not a speaker who is at peace.🔽He is not a speaker who is at peace, because he is not a speaker who is at peace.🔽He is not a speaker who is at peace, because he is not a speaker who is at peace.

original: de yod na bde ba la gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yod na bde ba la gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He is not a speaker who is at peace, because he is not a speaker who is at peace.🔽He is not a speaker who is at peace, because he is not a speaker who is at peace.🔽He is not a speaker who is at peace, because he is not a speaker who is at peace.🔽He is not a speaker who is at peace, because he is not a speaker who is at peace.🔽He is not a speaker who is at peace, because he is not a speaker who is at peace.🔽He is not a speaker who is at peace, because he is not a speaker who is at peace.

original: de'i phyir rgyun mi chad par dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor mi nus so //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyun mi chad par dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor mi nus so //
translated: Therefore, one is not able to apply oneself uninterruptedly to the side of virtue.

original: de'i phyir khyad par thob par bya ba la ma thob pa'i yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par thob par bya ba la ma thob pa'i yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one falls away from the attainment of distinction.

original: ldem por dgongs pa'i rnam nges gang /
analyzed: ldem por dgongs pa'i rnam nges gang /
translated: What is the Ascertainment of the Implicit?

original: ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / gsal byed kyi tshogs rnams kyi don gzhan du brjod pa don gzhan du yongs su bsgyur te /
analyzed: ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / gsal byed kyi tshogs rnams kyi don gzhan du brjod pa don gzhan du yongs su bsgyur te /
translated: It is the transformation of the meaning of the collections of names, the collections of words, and the collections of letters into another meaning.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: ma dang pha ni gsad bya zhing //
analyzed: ma dang pha ni gsad bya zhing //
translated: “One should kill one’s mother and father,🔽and also the two kings, and the one who is pure,

original: rgyal po gtsang sbra can gnyis dang / yul 'khor 'khor dang bcas bcom nas //
analyzed: rgyal po gtsang sbra can gnyis dang / yul 'khor 'khor dang bcas bcom nas //
translated: and the country with its retinue.

original: mi de dag par 'gyur zhes gsungs //
analyzed: mi de dag par 'gyur zhes gsungs //
translated: That person becomes pure.”

original: gang 'jig rten na shin tu kha na ma tho bar sdig tor rtsi ba de brjod pa'i yi ge rnams rnam par dag par yongs su bsgyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang 'jig rten na shin tu kha na ma tho bar sdig tor rtsi ba de brjod pa'i yi ge rnams rnam par dag par yongs su bsgyur ba'o //
translated: The letters that express the most heinous sin in the world are transformed into pure letters.

original: 'jig rten na shin tu kha na ma tho bar grags pa de ni skye bo bla ma bsad pa dang / skye bo chen po bsad pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten na shin tu kha na ma tho bar grags pa de ni skye bo bla ma bsad pa dang / skye bo chen po bsad pa'o //
translated: The most reprehensible of all is the killing of a superior being and the killing of a great person.

original: skye bo bla ma de la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: skye bo bla ma de la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: A superior being is of two kinds:

original: so sor nges pa dang 'jig rten dang thun mong ba'o //
analyzed: so sor nges pa dang 'jig rten dang thun mong ba'o //
translated: one who is superior individually and one who is superior in the world.

original: 'jig rten dang thun mong ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'jig rten dang thun mong ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: One who is superior in the world is also of two kinds:

original: yongs su skyong bar byed pa dang sbyin gnas so //
analyzed: yongs su skyong bar byed pa dang sbyin gnas so //
translated: one who is a protector and one who is a recipient of offerings.

original: de la so sor nges pa'i bla ma ni pha dang ma'o //
analyzed: de la so sor nges pa'i bla ma ni pha dang ma'o //
translated: One who is superior individually is one’s father and mother.

original: skyong bar byed pa ni rgyal po'o //
analyzed: skyong bar byed pa ni rgyal po'o //
translated: One who is a protector is the king.

original: sbyin @291b gnas ni bram ze gtsang sbra can rnams te /
analyzed: sbyin @291b gnas ni bram ze gtsang sbra can rnams te /
translated: One who is a recipient of offerings is a pure brahmin,

original: de dag ni shin tu dag par grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni shin tu dag par grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is well known to be very pure.

original: de dag thams cad bsad pa de ni skye bo bla ma bsad ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad bsad pa de ni skye bo bla ma bsad ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The killing of all of these is called “the killing of a superior being.”

original: skye bo chen po bsad pa ni /
analyzed: skye bo chen po bsad pa ni /
translated: The killing of a great person is

original: yul 'khor 'khor dang bcas bcom nas //
analyzed: yul 'khor 'khor dang bcas bcom nas //
translated: the destruction of a country and its king.

original: zhes bya'o // 'khor ni ba lang dang rta dang rnga mo dang ma he la sogs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya'o // 'khor ni ba lang dang rta dang rnga mo dang ma he la sogs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The retinue is to be understood as cows, horses, camels, buffaloes, and so on.

original: ji ltar yi ge 'di dag yang dag par yongs su bsgyur zhe na /🔽ma la sogs pa gsad pa'i tshig ni sred pa la sogs pa spong par yongs su bsgyur ba'i phyir te go rims bzhin du sred pa dang las kyi sred pa dang / nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / lta ba dang tshul khrims dang /
analyzed: ji ltar yi ge 'di dag yang dag par yongs su bsgyur zhe na / ma la sogs pa gsad pa'i tshig ni sred pa la sogs pa spong par yongs su bsgyur ba'i phyir te go rims bzhin du sred pa dang las kyi sred pa dang / nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / lta ba dang tshul khrims dang /
translated: How are these letters transformed?🔽The words “mother” and so on are transformed into the abandonment of craving and so on, respectively, that is, craving, craving for action, consciousness with appropriation, the two views of holding a view as paramount and holding morality and asceticism as paramount, and the six sense spheres with their objects.

original: brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa gnyis dang / skye mched drug spyod yul dang bcas pa'i dbang du byas nas ma la sogs par blta bar bya ste de dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa gnyis dang / skye mched drug spyod yul dang bcas pa'i dbang du byas nas ma la sogs par blta bar bya ste de dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Mother” and so on are to be viewed as such because they are similar to that.

original: de la sred pa ni mngon par bsgrub pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de la sred pa ni mngon par bsgrub pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: Therein, craving is the cause of accomplishment.

original: las kyi sred pa ni skye ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: las kyi sred pa ni skye ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: Craving for action is the cause of birth.

original: de ni sgom pa'i bag chags skyed pa'i tshul gyis pha lta bur blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sgom pa'i bag chags skyed pa'i tshul gyis pha lta bur blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be regarded as like a father, in the sense that it is the cause for the development of the latent impressions of meditation.

original: rgyu 'di gnyis las las kyi nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu 'di gnyis las las kyi nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ngo //
translated: From these two causes, consciousness arises, together with the appropriation of karma.

original: de de ltar byung na thar pa 'dod du zin kyang mchog dang dag par yid ches par byed pa'i mchog tu 'dzin pa gnyis thar pa thob pa la gegs byed do //
analyzed: de de ltar byung na thar pa 'dod du zin kyang mchog dang dag par yid ches par byed pa'i mchog tu 'dzin pa gnyis thar pa thob pa la gegs byed do //
translated: When it arises in this way, even if one desires liberation, the two types of clinging to the highest and the pure obstruct the attainment of liberation.

original: 'di gnyis gtsang sbra can dang 'dra ba ni 'di lta bur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di gnyis gtsang sbra can dang 'dra ba ni 'di lta bur rig par bya ste /
translated: These two should be understood as being like the following example:

original: 'di ltar mchog dang dag par mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar mchog dang dag par mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: It is like the clinging to the highest and the pure.

original: rnam par shes pa de'i gnas dang / dmigs pa'i dngos po skye mched drug yul dang bcas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de'i gnas dang / dmigs pa'i dngos po skye mched drug yul dang bcas par rig par bya'o //
translated: The basis of that consciousness and the objective entity that is its object should be understood as the six sense spheres together with their objects.

original: yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang gsungs pa /
translated: It is also said:

original: yid mi ches dang byas mi gzo //
analyzed: yid mi ches dang byas mi gzo //
translated: The one who is not faithful and ungrateful,🔽the one who destroys the house,

original: mi gang khyim 'bigs byed pa dang // go skabs bcom dang skyugs za ba /
analyzed: mi gang khyim 'bigs byed pa dang // go skabs bcom dang skyugs za ba /
translated: the one who destroys the opportunity, and the one who eats vomit,

original: de ni skyes bu mchog yin no //
analyzed: de ni skyes bu mchog yin no //
translated: he is the supreme person.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni don ngan pa brjod pa'i yi ge rnams mchog gi don du yongs su bsgyur ro //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni don ngan pa brjod pa'i yi ge rnams mchog gi don du yongs su bsgyur ro //
translated: This verse is a transformation of the letters expressing bad meaning into the supreme meaning.

original: 'jig rten na ngan pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten na ngan pa rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: In the world, there are four kinds of bad things:

original: yid kyi las ngan pa dang / lus kyi las ngan pa dang / ngag gi las ngan pa dang / longs spyod ngan pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi las ngan pa dang / lus kyi las ngan pa dang / ngag gi las ngan pa dang / longs spyod ngan pa'o //
translated: bad mental activity, bad physical activity, bad verbal activity, and bad enjoyments.

original: yid kyi las ngan ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yid kyi las ngan ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Bad mental activity is twofold:

original: dge ba la 'jug pa dang mi mthun pas yid mi ches pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba la 'jug pa dang mi mthun pas yid mi ches pa ste /
translated: lack of faith in the wholesome, because it is not in accord with engagement in the wholesome;

original: 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa yod par yid mi ches pas sbyin pa la sogs pa la mi sbyor ba'i phyir ro //🔽mi dge ba la 'jug pa dang / mthun par byas pa mi gzo ba ste /🔽sngon phan btags pa la mi lta bar ma gsod pa la sogs pa nyes par spyod @292a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol la sogs pa yod par yid mi ches pas sbyin pa la sogs pa la mi sbyor ba'i phyir ro // mi dge ba la 'jug pa dang / mthun par byas pa mi gzo ba ste / sngon phan btags pa la mi lta bar ma gsod pa la sogs pa nyes par spyod @292a * //
translated: and lack of faith in the world beyond, because one does not engage in generosity, etc.🔽Lack of gratitude for the help one has received is the second kind of bad mental activity, because one is not afraid of wrongdoing, such as killing one’s mother, etc.,

original: pa la yang mi 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa la yang mi 'jigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: without regard for previous benefits received.

original: lus kyi las ngan pa ni /
analyzed: lus kyi las ngan pa ni /
translated: Bad physical activity is twofold:

original: khyim 'bigs pa'i rkun po ste 'tsho ba shin tu smad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyim 'bigs pa'i rkun po ste 'tsho ba shin tu smad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are thieves who plunder the house of the Dharma and their livelihood is extremely contemptible.

original: dag gi las ngan pa ni /
analyzed: dag gi las ngan pa ni /
translated: Bad action is

original: brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa lhur len pa ste de lta bu dang ldan pa ni tshogs pa la sogs pa'i nang du 'jug tu mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa lhur len pa ste de lta bu dang ldan pa ni tshogs pa la sogs pa'i nang du 'jug tu mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: the practice of lying, etc. One who possesses that is not fit to enter an assembly, etc.

original: longs spyod ngan pa ni khyi dang bya rog dang yi dags la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: longs spyod ngan pa ni khyi dang bya rog dang yi dags la sogs pa ste /
translated: Bad enjoyments are the enjoyments of dogs, crows, pretas, etc.

original: skyugs pa za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyugs pa za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they eat vomit.
